loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
K. Muhammadjon is the father of three children, for whom he has to take care of and provides daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture industry since he was very young and has acquired experience. In this way, he is able to maintain his family. 

Today this gentleman needs to acquire a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for planting wheat, watermelon and onion. For this reason Muhammadjon has come to IMON International to obtain the  necessary loan so that he can continue caring for his humble family that needs his support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
It's hard to imagine that T. Stanley, in his late 50s, has been running an agricultural enterprise for over 30 years and is still at his best, proving to his fellow businessmen that he can make it. Having been inspired and trained by a parent for quite some time, hardworking Stanley got a vision to start up a banana plantation, as well as a business selling bananas and coffee. He has been practicing this from Kyakahesi, where he gets 150,000 UGX on a monthly basis from mobile buyers.

Stanley's main drawback is harvesting poor quantities. However, with this loan he will be able to purchase mulch and manure for his plantation. This will make it possible for him to earn more revenue and to cater for his family of seven school-going children and wife at home. It will also allow him to go for his goal of buying more land and owning a vehicle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To purchase mulch and manure for his plantation

loans.name: Soeur

texts.en:
Mr. Soeur L. is a 53-year-old farmer and father whose wife appears in the photo here. He was blessed with seven children, two of whom are married while the other five are single. To help with the responsibility of family expenses, four of his children are employed at different occupations. 

Soeur L. has a life partner in his wife, who works with him on the farm. The coming rainy season is good for growing; however, Soeur L. doesn't have any materials to support his field. Thus, Soeur L. has decided to ask a loan to use toward planting rice crops.

loans.use: To use toward planting rice crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase necessary things for his land.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Porfirio es un señor de 45 años de edad, reside en la colonia Morazán de San Francisco Gotera, él es casado y vive con su esposa, un hijo de 24 años de edad y un nieto de 2 años que dependen de él, 
Él tiene 10 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, el negocio es atendido por él, su esposa y su hijo, además su esposa se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde en una pequeña granja.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de productos como, frijol, arroz, azúcar, aceite para ofrecer en su tienda.
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Porfirio a incrementar su capital de inversión y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos necesarios para el Hogar, aumentando así sus ingresos familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son lograr aumentar su negocio, obtener mayores ventas que le brinden una mayor estabilidad económica y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Porfirio is 45 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Morazán de San Francisco Gotera. He is married and lives with his wife, 24-year-old son, and 2-year-old grandson that are all dependant on him. He has 10 years of experience in selling basic staples. His wife and son both help him run the business, plus his wife raises broiler chickens on a small farm. He needs a loan to purchase products such as beans, rice, sugar, and oil to sell in his store. This loan will help Don Porfirio increase his capital investment to be able to offer his customers a wider variety of home products, thereby increasing his family income. His goal is to increase his business and sell more goods to provide his family with greater economic stability and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic staples like beans, rice, sugar

loans.name: Hannah Waruguru

texts.en:
Hannah Waruguru is 41 years old and is married to Peter K. who is a driver and so is a source of additional income for the family. They have three school-going children and they live in Mitero, Thika.

Hannah practices dairy farming and has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000.

Hannah learned about KADET through marketing awareness done in her area. She is applying for her first loan of Kshs 25,000 which she intends to use to buy rabbits to enhance her income from dairy farming. This will be her secondary business. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her rabbit-keeping business.

In the future Hannah wishes to start poultry farming since this businesses has proved to be very profitable in her area. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy rabbits to raise in addition to her dairy farming

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme marié et père de 4 enfants. il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'ablogamé, l'activité qu'il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de  boissons locales alcoolisées appelées SODABI. il fait ce commerce depuis 1995 et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité de KOUVE. il veut s'approvisionner en sodabi, il sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 27 bidons de sodabi et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a married man and father of four children. He lives with his family in the district of Ablogamé. 

To provide for his family, he makes a living by selling the local alcoholic beverage called SODABI. 
He has been in this business since 1995 and buys his stocks inland, in the town of KOUVE. 

Kodjo wants to stock up on Sodabi. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 27 cans of Sodabi and pay for shipment.

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella was born in 1963 and is married without any children. Drocella takes care of two dependent relatives. She is a businesswoman but her husband does not work. That's why,she has to work hard to get everything her family needs. Drocella owns a business selling various styles of clothes. This business is known and organized. This is her fifth year of success in this business operation.

Drocella is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing more bales of clothing for sale. With this expansion, Drocella will be more efficient and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of one young child. He has ten years of experience working as a sanitary man repairing toilets, faucets, etc. and also as an electrician. He works independently on a freelance basis, upon request of the clients. In addition, he takes small projects home and finalizes all the sanitary and electric work on it. He is the main income provider for his housewife and his baby. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric power puncher and a compressor. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas and taking bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase an electric power puncher and a compressor.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the city of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Grace is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of buying and selling coconut for copra (dried coconut for making coconut oil) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts

loans.name: Jenitt

texts.es: Jenitt, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy dedicada, es separada y por el momento vive en una casa ajena. Día a día recorre las calles arenales de su distrito, ofreciendo productos de belleza, ya sea por medio de catálogos o de algunos que tiene en stock. Más de un año que se dedica a la venta de éstos productos y ha logrado ganar varios clientes, lo cual le vuelven a renovar otros pedidos y eso le conviene a Jenitt. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es la amistad que tiene con sus clientes y las ofertas que realiza la empresa, ya que en estas temporadas sus ganancias son el doble. En adelante, anhela construir su casa de material noble, de ese modo mejorará su estilo de vida y la de sus hijos. Para ella es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, de esa manera no perjudicará a los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicitó, incrementará más productos de belleza, para abastecer los pedidos que le han solicitado.
texts.en: Jenitt is 35 years old. She is a mother and she is very devoted to her family. She is separated and for the time being she lives in a rented home. Day after day she travels the gravel roads of her district selling beauty products, be it through a catalogue or the items she's got in stock. She has been selling these products for more than a year and it has been good for Jenitt. What she most enjoys about the business is the contact she has with her clients. She also enjoys when the supplier has special offers, especially during this time of year when her sales double.  In the future she endeavors to build a house made of dependable materials in order to improve her way of life and that of her children. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments. She does not want to cause trouble for the other members of her community bank. The loan she requested will be used to increase her stock of beauty products and to fill the orders that have already been placed.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products to fill orders that have already been placed.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene 23 años, y después de titularse espera trabajar,  es estudiante de 3º año de la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas en la UDABOL; el crédito requiere para pago de pensiones de un curso de especialización en sistemas. Trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de las salas del cine Mega Center, que esta ubicado en la zona de Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Álvaro is single and doesn't have any children.  He has lived for a long time in his parents' home, in Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is 23 years old and, after he leaves university, he hopes to work.

Álvaro is in his third year of a systems engineering degree at UDABOL.  He requires this loan to pay his tuition for a specialization course.  He works as a maintenance worker in the Mega Center cinema complex which is located in Irpavi neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  This is how he makes income for his household.

This is Álvaro's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To pay for a specialization course

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business selling fish and seafood.  Her husband Rafael D. Jr., who is 33 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn income.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 7 months and 5 years old. 

Rachelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rachelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. 

Rachelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna T. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Anna has a bar, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks (such as beer and sodas) for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Anna hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to own another branch of her bar.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks (such as beer and sodas) for resale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Marcelina M. is 38 years of age, married,  and is a resident of Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.  To make a living,  Marcelina operates a sari-sari store business and dried fish vending business. For 5 years, she was able to maintain her business, even in hard times.  She is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000, which the said is so helpful for herself and her family. 

Marcelina joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2010 because she is very much interested in our products and services.   For her 3rd cycle loan, she was given an amount of P14,999 to add to her working capital for her business. The future income from the business will be used for her family's basic daily  needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and progress her business.

About PMPC:   Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to maximize efficiency and reduce costs.  This loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital for sari-sari store and dried fish vending business

loans.name: Marjorie Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Marjorie es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fisca de pagos del banco y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir  los créditos. Tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene una  hija de siete años la misma que  estudia en  escuela. Su marido está en el extranjero.

Trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela en Manta pero además de eso se dedica al comercio ya que  tiene un local en Montecristi donde vende de todo de acuerdo a la temporada, vende desde ropa, sabanas, juguetes, útiles escolares entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha las épocas del año para vender sus productos. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes cuando está trabajando de maestra pero todo el dia en sus días libres ya que hay que aprovechar el mayor tiempo para ganar más clientela nos comenta. Algunas veces su papa le ayuda en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de temporada, además de útiles escolares ya que pronto se viene la época de entrada a clases. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento del estado para  su cargo de maestra.
texts.en:
The Soraya communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is a place famous for its Panama hats.

Marjorie is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the bank’s Payments Overseer and she likes the bank because of the ease of getting loans.  She is 31 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has a 7-year-old daughter who is in school.  Her husband is abroad.

She works as a contractual Teacher at a school in Manta but she’s also a merchant.  She has a locale in Montecristi where she sells all sorts of things according to the season.  She sells clothes, bed sheets, toys and school supplies, among others.  She tells us that she takes advantage of the seasons in a year to sell her items.  She works every day during the afternoon when she’s working as a teacher and all day on her days off because one has to take advantage of the most time to win over more customers, she tells us.  Sometimes her father helps her in the business.

This loan is to buy seasonal clothing as well as school supplies because the new school term is fast approaching.  Her dream is to secure a state teaching position.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Joel Alcides

texts.es:
Joel, es un joven de 23 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, vive con sus padres, es soltero y en su hogar todos trabajan ya que tienen un comedor, este negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de su madre, quien ya posee experiencia, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 8:00pm.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, materiales que necesita diariamente para preparar los alimentos, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar la producción del negocio y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, que sea rentable y le provea lo necesario para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Joel, 23, lives in Santa Elena, Usulután Department, with his parents.  He’s single and in his home everyone works because they have an eatery.  The business started with help from his mother who has experience.  They are open from 6am until 8pm.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise that’s needed for daily meal preparation.  This purchase will help him increase business production and improve customer service.

His goal is to grow in the business, that it be profitable and provides everything needed for him to help out his parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the eatery

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila M. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Laila is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Laila owns & operates a business selling rice and corn grains in the local community. Laila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Laila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Laila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of rice and corn. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice & corn

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
Cholpon S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 47 and married to a teacher. She and her husband have three daughters. Two older daughters study at the university and the youngest daughter is in school. 

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses, Cholpon cultivates potatoes and wheat. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel for sowing wheat. In the near future, she hopes to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe una hombre soltero de 33 años de edad que vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona urbano marginal, contando con los servicios de agua y luz solamente; en el departamento de Cajamarca,la cual se encuentra a una distancia de 6 horas de la provinciade Chiclayo.  Este departamento se caracteriza por ser una ciudad turística a nivel internacional, por sus ricos platos típicos, por sus festividades y costumbres de su gente y por ser una zona minera.

Desde hace varios años Noe se dedica al comercio de diferentes tipos de papa junto con su padre  ya que es un negocio altamente rentable.  La papa es un producto consumido a nivel nacional e internacional por ser agradable y  sus diferentes usos en las comidas tanto en distintos restaurantes como en las casas de los pobladores, por lo cual le permitiría a Noe aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

Por lo mismo Noe a solicitado un préstamo  de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para poder seguir comprando el producto y venderlo al por mayor y menor en en los distintos mercados del departamento de Cajamarca como a otros departamentos, para seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conicido en los distintos lugares que vende por tener un producto de calidad.

Noe es conocido en los distintos mercados por ser un hombre bueno, trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante para poder darles lo que deseen a sus padres y mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Noe is a single man who is 33 years old and he lives in his parents' house, located in a suburban region. They have only have water and hydro services. They live in the department of Cajamarca and it is located 6 hours from the province of Chiclayo. This department is known as a tourist town at the international level for its delicious traditional foods, its festivals and culture, and for being a mining region.

Noe has been a merchant for several years, selling all types of potatoes with his father. The business is highly successful. Potatoes are a product that is consumed nationally and internationally for its taste and for the different uses in foods, in both restaurants and the homes of the population. This will permit Noe to increase his earnings and to cover his daily expenses.

For this reason Noe has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to be able to keep purchasing the product and reselling it in wholesale and retail at the various markets in the department of Cajamarca and other departments. He will increase his sales and he will become well known in the various locales where he sells for having quality products.

Noe is well known at the different markets for being a decent, hardworking man who is eager to succeed to be able to give his parents whatever they need and to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy various types of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ever José

texts.es: El señor Ever, tiene la edad de 49 años , habitante del municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales estudian su secundaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales y personas de bien  , don Ever desde hace seis años labora como docente en una escuelita publica del sector , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción ya que él quiere terminar de construir un baño por que el actual está muy deteriorado . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Ever is 49 years old and resides in the town of Nidirí.  He and his wife, who works as a merchant, help each other with the household expenses.  They have two children who are high school students.  

His plans for the future include continuing to support his children with their studies so that they can become professionals and successful individuals.  Don Ever has worked six years as a teacher at a local school.  The greatest challenge that he faces is not having enough money from his salary to make a one-time purchase of construction materials needed to complete the renovation of a bathroom that is currently in disrepair.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy these construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for renovating a bathroom.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina nació en la ciudad de Sicuani (Cusco, Perú), tiene 43 años edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella está feliz porque está sacando adelante a su único hijo ya que es madre y padre para él. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística y comercio). Ella pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa que cada treinta días se reúnen en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco.  
  
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Marcelina que nos cuenta que ella tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de llantas y un taller de mantenimientos de carros. Desde el año 1990 que ella se dedica  a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo llantas.
texts.en:
Marcelina was born in the city of Sicuani (Cusco, Perú).  She is 43 years old and lives in Cusco.  She is happy because she is successfully raising her only son since she is both mother and father to him.  (Cusco is noted for having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism and commerce).  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “María Auxiliadora” communal bank which meets every thirty days in the house of one of the members in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood.

We met Marcelina at the communal bank’s meeting and she tells us that she has a small store selling tires and a car repair shop.  She’s been in this business since 1990 and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like tires, for example.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like tires, for example.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap and her husband, Sam Oeun, have been married since 2004 and have one young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap is a weaver while her husband raises chickens at home. She is requesting a loan of $600 to help her husband’s chicken raising business by purchasing additional chickens and chicken feed.   

Photo: Sopheap and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Duhorimbere Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de poisson  depuis 15ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence juste après sa sortie d’école en tant qu’élève. Elle est mariée a Bernard, lui-même commerçant de poisson et ont ensemble 4 enfants qui étudient. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 8e année. 
Son crédit de 450,000francs burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de poisson à vendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. L’histoire de son commerce est fascinante car elle a commence avec un capital de 65,000francs burundais avant de connaitre Turame 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« DUHORIMBERE».
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 30 year-old merchant who lives in the Gatumba neighborhood in Bujumbura city. She has been in the fish trade for 15 years. It is the profession she started in right after leaving school, where she was a student. She is married to Bernard, himself a fish seller, and together they have four children, who attend school. She herself went to school up to the eighth grade.
Her loan of 450,000 Burundian francs will contribute to increasing her capital and augment the quantity of fish for sale to make large profits. The story of her business is fascinating, as she started with a capital of 65,000 Burundian francs before discovering Turame.
She is a member of the community group "Vugukuri."

loans.use: to increase her capital and augment the quantity of fish for sale to make large profits.

loans.name: Yeanor

texts.en: This is 45yrs- old Yeanor.  She is married, and has 2 children aged 21and 27yrs. She has no additional dependants.   In 1990, Yeanor established her business to buy school bags, suitcases,toys etc. She began her business because she realized  it will be very necessary to assist her husband. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 944,000 every month from this business as profit. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Yeanor requires this amount in order to improve on her business by purchasing large stock of bags,toys and suitcase at a reasonable cost. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Yeanor plans to have an apartment structure where she will live to enjoy her old age.   She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more toys, school bags and a suitcase.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws). Hadjah has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for eight years and she works six days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Hadjah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Hadjah include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to educate her children up to university .Hadjah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: To  buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rasy

texts.en: Rasy is 29 years old and has been married to his wife, Sokry, since 2005. They have one young daughter and live in a village along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Rasy makes a living by driving a bicycle-powered taxi while his wife works as a vegetable seller. Rasy would like to go into business in Phnom Penh, but his type of vehicle is not legal there. He is applying for this loan for $800 to buy a motorized taxi, or tuk tuk, which the law allows him to use in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a motorized taxi.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  

Eva has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Eva has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy clothes.  She also generates additional income through houses for rent water.

The main business challenges for Eva include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start importing clothes from China and to be a wholesaler.

 Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu sells food items like salted fish, canned tomatoes and powdered pepper at Ayensudu near Elmina.  She has done this for 6 years. Ayishatu   is married. Her husband is a farmer and together they live with six dependents. She uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She will use this loan to purchase salted fish, tomatoes, salt and other food items to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Ayishatu plans to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase salted fish, tomatoes, salt and other food items to sell

loans.name: Nancy Vivi

texts.en: Nancy is a single woman. She has three children ranging from 6 to 13 years old. She describes herself as social and she likes sharing ideas. She operates a retail kiosk where she sells bread, soda, biscuits, water, sweets, soap and paper bags. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located inside a county bus terminal and her primary customers are travelers boarding vehicles within the county bus terminal. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add Coca Cola products to her business. Her business goal is to open a shop and more kiosks within her town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the graduate level.

loans.use: To buy Coca Cola products to add to her business

loans.name: Bamar

texts.fr: Monsieur Bamar est un homme d’une quarantaine d’année qui  évolue depuis plus de 24 ans dans le domaine de la menuiserie.  Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 13 ans .  En plus il pratique le commerce d’appareils  portables.  Après avoir abandonné ses études, il a choisi l’activité de menuisier  sur recommandation de  ses parents. Il aime bien concevoir de jolis meubles qu’il parvient  à écouler facilement. Autre chose qui l’intéresse  beaucoup c’est la réalisation de profits que lui procure son activité. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2008 et a déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits antérieurs dans l’institution. Il sollicite un prêt de 350 000 frs prévu pour financer un voyage vers un des pays limitrophes du Sénégal ou il compte acheter des portables pour revenir les  vendre a sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui  permet de fabriquer quelques meubles qu’il expose a la vente. Son  objectif principal  est développer ses activités pour améliorer la condition  de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Bamar is a 40-something year old man who has been working for 24 years in the domain of woodworking. He is married and the father of two children, who are 3 and 13 years old. In addition, he has a business selling mobile phones. After having dropped out of school, he chose this work in woodworking upon his parents' recommendation. He really likes to design beautiful furniture that he manages to sell easily. Another thing he likes a lot is making money, which his business brings in. 

Mr. Bamar has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch since September 2008 and has already benefited from two previous loans with this institution. He is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs for financing a trip to a country bordering Senegal where he intends to buy mobile phones to resell to his customers. Increasing his profits will enable him to make some furniture, which he displays for sale. 

His main goal is to develop his businesses to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida  is 42 years old, married, and the loving mother of one child. She dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her family, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. Her monthly income is 250 USD.

Saida is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to buy more calves to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es: Gloria Angélica, D. cincuenta y siete años D. edad, resiD. en colonia urbana cerca a la zona D. cordilleras del país desD. hace mas D. 35 años, junto a ella su esposo Don José que es empleado y genera ingreso para el sostenimiento del hogar. Gloria a fin D. contribuir al sostenimiento del hogar y mejorar su calidad D. vida decidió desD. hace más D. cuatro años vender medicina natural y popular D. forma ambulante en colonias cercanas a donD. vive, ella cuenta con descuentos preferenciales en droguerías que permite adquirirlas a bajos precios y que las proponga a precios accesibles a sus clientes, por eso la prefieren y ella obtiene un ingreso con el cual pueD. llevar alimento a su hogar. Gloria es una mujer optimista y desea en esta ocasión reinvertir a su negocio comprando medicamento con el que no ha podido contar y sus clientes se encuentran demandando, como son pomadas para dolores musculares, desparasitantes, cremas cicatrizantes, tratamientos para infecciones urinarias y bronquiales. Cuenta que con el apoyo que INTEGRAL esto se transforme D. un sueño a una realidad y su anhelado sueño granD. D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia gracias a estos pequeños impulsos se acerquen cada vez mas a el.-
texts.en:
Gloria Angélica is 57 years old and lives in an urban area near the mountainous area of the country. She lives with her husband Don José who is employed and earns money for household expenses.

Gloria, in order to contribute to the household and to improve their quality of life, decided more than 4 years ago to sell natural and popular medicine in the neighborhood towns close to where she lives. She is offered a discount in drugstores, and buys at low prices which allows her to sell at affordable prices to her customers which they appreciate and she makes a profit with which she can buy food for the home.

Gloria is an optimistic woman and wants on this occasion to reinvest in her business buying healing remedies which she has not been able to as her clients ask for them, such as ointments for muscle pain, deworming medication, healing creams, and treatments for urinary tract infections and bronchitis.

She says that with the support of INTEGRAL, and thanks to these little whims that come increasingly to her, her yearned for big dream of improving the quality of life for her family changes from a dream to fact.

loans.use: to buy ointments for muscle pain, deworming medication, healing creams, and treatments for urinary tract infections and bronchitis

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Santos se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos) y aves de corral, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar las necesidades de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales de otras especies, alimento e implementar un nuevo corral para sus nuevos animales y una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga más clientes y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para brindarle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida.  Santos es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que a su hija y nieta tengas las comodidades necesarias y siempre mantengan unidas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos, 47, is a mother living with her daughter and granddaughter in her own house which only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

For several years now Santos has been raising pigs and barnyard fowl to sell.  Her corral is in her back yard.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Once they reach optimal development she can sell them to her customers and with income obtained is able to cover household expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy more animals of other species, to buy feed and to build a new corral for the new animals.  Once she fattens them up she will sell them in the local markets to obtain more customers and thus earn higher income to provide her family with a better quality of life.  Santos is a responsible, hardworking person who only wants her daughter and granddaughter to have the necessary comforts and that they always stay together to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more animals, feed and to build a new corral.

loans.name: 06.02.05-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan has an iron furniture manufacturing business. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

Loan is 30 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Loan is the group leader of the 06.02.05-Đông Vệ solidarity group which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
She has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is married with seven children. Teofila is 49 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occdiental.

Teofila sells fish, shrimp and crabs to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase variety of fish, shrimp and crabs.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Teofila hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, shrimp and crabs.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La señora  Araceli  nos cuenta que desde pequeña empezó a trabajar ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cinco años es una señora que le gusta cumplir sus sueños y romper todas las piedras que se cruzan por su camino para lograr  lo que propone.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Gaudelino con quien tiene  dos hijos  por quien trabaja día a día para  que tenga un mejor futuro el día de mañana.
 Tambien vende dulces ,galletas en su casa para que los niños que salen de la escuela pasen a comprarle.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de ropa para niños y niñas dama y caballero ya que su esposo sale a vender a los pueblos vecinos y ella se queda vendiendo en casa.
Les da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para cambiar su vida  y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs.  Araceli tells us that she started working when she was very young. She has sold clothing for five years. This is a woman who enjoys fulfilling her dreams and breaking every barrier.
She is happily married to Mr. Gaudelino, and they have two children. They work hard every day so that their children can have a better future. She also sells candy and cookies from her home to the children who walk by after school.
She requested this loan for the purchase of clothing for men, women and children. Her husband travels to sell in the neighbouring villages and she stays home and sells from there.
She is grateful to the Fundacion for the support that they have offered so that she can change her life and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from Dalapang, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business raising crops. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 6,800 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 31 years old, and she is a married woman with 3 children, aged 7, 3, and 1. Ma. Victoria runs a fishing business with her husband. Her husband goes out to sea to fish and Ma. Victoria sells the catch at the market. Ma. Victoria does her best to take care of her children and to help sustain her family.

Ma. Victoria has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help her business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Luna has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.

Luna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past two years, she has owned a general store and she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. Marichu has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Marichu is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es: Socorro es una emprendedora que tiene una pulpería desde hace diez años, es casada, con 49 años de edad y madre de dos hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, azúcar, chiverías, café, cloro, naturas, sopas magi, cremas, fósforos, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo.
texts.en: Socorro’s an entrepreneur who has had a grocery store for ten years.  She’s married and 49-years-old; she’s the mother of two children.  She’ll use the loan to buy basic grains like rice and sugar, snacks, coffee, chlorine bleach, vegetables, Maggi soups, creams, matches, dairy products, beef and chicken.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: WILBER es de estado civil casado, no tiene hijos bajo su dependencia, el  y su esposa  quieren establecerse económicamente para luego darles comodidad a los hijos que fueran a tener y agrandar su familia, según referencias son responsables y muy trabajadores;  la actividad a la que se dedica es al servicio de internet en una tienda, dónde también cuenta con cabinas telefónicas,  actualmente está pasando por una mala situación económica, ya que los equipos sufrieron un corte que afectó a las computadoras, y ahora el solicitante requiere este crédito para poder obtener más capital comprando tarjetas de telefonía, y luego juntar dinero para que pueda hacer arreglar sus equipos de computación y así mejorar, sus ingresos, y evitar cualquier inconveniente económico.
texts.en: Wilber is married without children under his responsibility. He and his wife want to be financially stable so they will be able to accommodate their future children and expand their family. As per references, they are responsible and hard working. He runs an Internet service in a store where he also offers phone service. He is currently going through hard financial times as his equipment suffered an electrical surge that affected all of the computers. He is requesting the loan to buy phone cards and to put money together to repair his computers and equipment in order to improve his earnings and prevent any more economic inconveniences.

loans.use: buy phone cards for his business.

loans.name: Madeley

texts.es: Laboriosa y perseverante son características que describen a Madeley, una mujer de 43 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada de manera ambulante desde hace cuatro años, solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de perfumes, cremas camisas, faldas y pantalones. Una de sus metas es incursionar en un nuevo negocio de venta de pollo, considera que es una buena oportunidad de negocio porque su casa está ubicada en un punto céntrico.

loans.use: para la compra de perfumes, cremas camisas, faldas y pantalones

loans.name: Têko

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Mr Têko F. B. is married and father of eight (8) children, four of whom are no longer under his charge. Polygamous, he today finds himself crushed under the weight of his household. Thanks to a first loan of $400 dollars, he was able to install a corn mill in his town and run it with rigor and efficiency. The scope of this activity has allowed him to lighten the suffering of his family. In light of the significant activity at his mill each day, Mr F. B. is thinking he should install a second corn mill. To do this, he needs more consistant financial support. This is why he’s asking for a loan of $850 which will allow him to rent a locale, buy a second mill and have it installed. This will help speed up service and ease the long lines waiting to use his first mill. This will allow Mr. F. B. to increase his income for the well being of his family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1952, Monsieur F. B. Têko est marié et père de huit (8) enfants dont 4 ne sont plus à sa charge. Polygame, il se trouve aujourd’hui écrasé par les lourdes charges de son ménage. Grâce à un premier crédit de $400 obtenu, Il installe un moulin à maïs dans sa localité qu’il arrive à gérer avec rigueur et efficacité. L’ampleur de l’activité de ce moulin a permis d’alléger les souffrances de la famille. Vu l’importance de la clientèle dans le moulin chaque jour, Monsieur F. B. a pensé qu’il faudrait en installer un second. Pour cela, il lui faut un appui financier plus consistant. C’est dans ce sens qu’il sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre de louer un local, d’acheter le second moulin et de faire l’installation. Ceci aiderait à rendre plus rapide la prestation de travail et à soulager la longue attente des clients. Cela permettra à Monsieur F. B. d’améliorer son revenu pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: buying a second corn mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Andres will use the loan to rent machinery that will help him plow the land and plant the seeds for his rice farm

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old, has three kids and is separated from her husband. She covers household expenses by making and selling pozole, a popular regional dish made with corn, out of her home. She also makes and sells drinks. Silvia is part of a collective with three other people who have similar work who would use the loan to invest in more supplies for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

SILVIA TIENE 30 AÑOS TIENE 3 HIJOS SE ENCUENTRA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO DEBIDO A ESTO ELLA MANTIENE SU HOGAR TRABAJANDO EN SU CASA PREPARANDO UN ALIMENTO TIPICO DE LA ZONA LLAMADO POZOLE QUE ES UNA ESPECIE DE MASA DE MAIZ QUE SE VENDE Y POSTERIORMENTE SE LICUA PARA PREPARAR UNA BEBIDA ALIMENTICIA QUE SE CONSUME FRECUENTEMENTE EN LAS COMUNIDADES . SILVIA TRABAJA COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE EN LAS GASOLINERAS DEL SECTOR PERTENECE AL GRUPO CONCEPCION 2 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MARIA DEL CARMEN BERMUDEZ LOPEZ ( COMPRA MAIZ , CACAO Y VENDE DULCES DE PANELA ) VICTORIA H. H. ( VENTA DE SUSTITUTIVOS ALIMENTICIOS POR CATALOGO) Y LAURA GUADALUPE S. H. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) TODAS CON EL PRESTAMO PIENSAN INVERTIR EN MEJORAR LAS GANANCIAS DE SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO MATERIAS PRIMAS PARA MEJOR ELABORAR SUS PRODUCTOS LAS QUE HACEN ALIMENTOS ARTESANALES Y LAURA COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU LOCAL

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make popular foods

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband and his two brothers have a big bakery at their big house. Their wives prepare the dough and bake the bread to sell in the bakery.

Today, they have many customers and they sell the bread quickly. Their bakery attracts more customers, because they use flour of high quality. Due to this fact, their bakery became one of the best bakeries in Kistakuz, Khudjand.

They received a lot of orders for September. So Mukaddas needs extra capital to purchase the flour for baking bread to fill the orders for September.

loans.use: For purchasing three sacks of flour

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil is 25 years old, single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. He has rented a space in the local market  for three years where he intends to set up a clothing sales business. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy clothes for his store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his sales business

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra Luz is a single mother of a small girl. To be able to take good care of her daughter, she used to work all day; nevertheless, she was neglecting her a lot. One day she made a small piñata for her daughter to celebrate her birthday, and everybody that saw it asked her where she bought it. She noticed that people liked the way she made piñatas, so she decided to begin selling them full-time. Little by little, the people in her town noticed that Sandra made piñatas, and that's how she formed her clientele.

Today Sandra is requesting a credit of $925, to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money she will be able to buy more material to make her piñatas and to prepare herself adequately for the Christmas season when many people buy piñatas. With your help, Sandra will be able to take good care of her daughter without the need of the girl's father. And she will be able to show her daughter that everything in life can be accomplished with the right effort and attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

. Sandra Luz, es madre soltera de una pequeñita niña, para poder sacar adelante a su hija trabajaba todo el día sin embargo la descuidaba mucho. Un día que le hizo una pequeña piñatita a su hija para festejarle su cumpleaños, le hizo una piñata, y todos los que vieron esta piñatita, le preguntaban el lugar dónde compró la piñata y ella se dio cuenta que a la gente le gustaba la forma en que ella estaba haciendo las piñatas. Por lo que decidió ponerse a vender piñatas de tiempo completo y así poco a poco las personas de su colonia se fueron dando cuenta que Sandra hacía piñatas, y fue formando su clientela.

Hoy Sandra está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más materia prima para fabricar sus piñatas para prepararse suficientemente en esta temporada navideña, en que muchas personas compran piñatas. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá sacar a su hija adelante sin la necesidad del padre de la niña. Y le mostrará que en la vida todo se puede a base de esfuerzo y actitud.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to make more piñatas.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin K. is a 37 year-old teacher and mother of two - Issa, 14, and Zuhura, 6.  In 2004, she established a business selling sodas to supplement her teacher’s salary.  She now requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock in bulk.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of soda in bulk.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: A. Toyin is married with 4 children, is 34 years old and hails from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria; she sells baby wear and shoes. She has been in her business since 2002 and needs a loan of $275 to buy more baby wear and shoes for sale. She has been a client of LAPO for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old trader who owns a small men's clothing store in the small village Qaranuru in Saatli region. He has four years of experience in this field. He always has clients who come to buy a suit, but client demand is higher than the number of suits he has to sell. The money he makes from selling clothes is just enough to keep his family in normal living conditions.

To increase number of products he sells, he needs more funds. He has applied for $1200 USD. With this loan, he will be able to purchase more than 20 suits, which can help him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase 20 or more suits to expand his business

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.en: N. Uktamjon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married with 3 children. He is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock, which his father started years ago.  As a boy, he helped his father to take care the flock and now he has his own flock which he is working to increase. Mr. N. Uktamjon loves the work he is engaged in.  He is applying to Kiva for a loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Mir Abbas

texts.en: Mir Abbas lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated, married, and the father of two daughters. He was in Pakistan for a long time. He came back 2 years ago and opened a clothing shop where he sells children's clothes. He needs to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import more new designs of clothes for children to attract more customers and make a good income to support his family and make a better life in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To import more new designs of children's clothing

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel B. sells flour and also operates a corn mill in Ghana. He is married and has four children.  However, his income currently is not sufficient to meet his family’s financial needs. Nonetheless, he is confident that he can improve his business and increase sales if he is able to have his milling machine serviced.  Therefore, Samuel is requesting a loan of $525 to service his milling machine.

loans.use: For the servicing of his milling machine.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi I. sells candles, mosquito coils, and matches. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for Esi and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sonia Luz

texts.es:
Ms. Sonia belongs to the bank Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, located in Jr. Emancipación Mz.F Lt.18, in the District of San Fernando, Department of Ucayali. She’s 42 years old and has one child. Her husband works as a personal assistant. Sonia was able to stock her clothing business with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos S./300 (300 soles, Peruvian currency). She also provides tailoring services. With this loan in the amount of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 moths, she will invest in purchasing material by the meter, 12 shoe sole inserts, 6 pairs of jeans, 12 blouses and 5 sets children’s clothing. Sonia is very happy with the bank Banco Manuela Ramos because thanks to them business is increasing. She hopes to buy a display case so that she can sell jewelry, perfume and to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz.F Lt.18, Distrito de san fernando del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y tiene un solo hijo y su esposo es Asistente Personal, Sonia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 implemento su negocio de venta de ropas. También brinda servicio de costura. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella invierto comprando telas por metros, 12 plantilla de zapatos, 6 pantalones jean, 12 blusas y 5 conjuntos para niños. Sonia esta muy contenta con el Banco Manuela Ramos por que gracias a ello su negocio esta surgiendo. Ella tiene toda la esperanza de comprarse su vitrina para que así que venda sus joya, perfumería y para que así pueda tener mejor exhibición sus productos.

loans.use: To buy clothing and material at wholesale price.

loans.name: Basir Khan

texts.en:
Basir Khan is 41 years old and lives in a household of 11. He is married and is an uneducated man. He has a retail shop, and he has been involved in this business for more than 15 years. He has good experience in his business. One of his brothers is working with Basir Khan. They support the family together. His brother is working part-time with Basir Khan.

Basir Khan wants to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to enlarge his shop and further his business with more success.

He is happy with all members of his family. He wishes to open another shop in the next 2 years for his brother to run. He tries a lot and works very hard to do this. He would like to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and she is single. She has been a bread seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Elizabeth is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Es natural del centro poblado de Santa María, elabora prendas de vestir, además también se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ganado, con los cuales ha venido manteniéndose desde hace 4 años.   Ella trabaja desde su casa, confeccionando estas prendas, pero también viaja constantemente a las ferias de Taraco, Juliaca y Azangaro donde vende el ganado.  Ella suele trabajar los días de feria, variando en cada distrito, siendo en algunos los jueves en otros los viernes, sábados o domingos, esto es muy cansado y más aun trasladando el ganado.  A Eduarda le gusta la independencia económica que le da su trabajo, ya que puede ayudar al gasto familiar y también sentirse útil hacia la sociedad.  Su deseo es seguir trabajando arduamente para obtener una mejor estabilidad económica y así, en un futuro tener una familia.  Con el dinero del préstamo Eduarda quiere comprar más cantidad de tela para elaborar sus prendas de vestir y también más ganado para venderlo y lograr mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 24 years old, single and lives with her parents. She 's from central Santa María. She makes clothing and also has a business buying and selling livestock. She's been supporting herself for the last 4 years. She works from home, making clothing but she also travels constantly to the fairs in Taraco, Juliaca and Azangaro where she sells livestock. Depending on the schedule of each district, she usually works at the fairs on Thursdays or sometimes Fridays, Saturdays or Sundays -- it's very tiring, especially transferring livestock. Eduarda enjoys the financial independence her job allows her as she can help with household expenses and feel useful in society. Her wish is to continue working hard in order to better her economic stability, and as such, be able to have a family of her own in the future. With the money from the loan, Eduarda would like to buy more material to make her clothing and more livestock so she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more material to make clothing, and increase the amount of livestock she has to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes y la apoyan mucho. Ella vive con su esposo, quien esta de acuerdo en todo lo que se propone. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, sal entre otras cosas) formando así su pequeña bodega, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su labor diaria es tratar mucho con sus clientes, sobre todo con aquellos que hablan de negocios, esta bodega le es rentable, ya que es la única persona que tiene este tipo de negocio por su zona razón por la cual  le va muy bien. Este ya es su préstamo nº 7 en su IMF y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará más productos para implementar su negocio, así como también quiere ampliar y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 55-year-old mother of five children who are self-reliant and give her a great deal of support. She lives with her husband, who is in agreement with all her decisions. Rosa works selling basic food staples (rice, sugar, and salt, among other things) in a small grocery store which she has run for the past 3 years. She enjoys dealing with her customers, especially with those whom she can talk business. This grocery store is profitable for her; as she is the only person with this type of business in the region, business is going very well. This will be her seventh loan with this bank, and she is punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will buy more products to finish setting up her shop; she would also like to expand her business and be more welcoming to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to stock her store and expand the size of her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sophat Brang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of twelve members and is located in the Tuol Tbaeng village in Takeo Province. They plan to use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sophat B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  She is 32 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land that shes uses to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Thoeun, is a teacher in the local school and makes a small salary of which cannot improve his household's living conditions by much. 

Even though they have different business activities, they still earn too little income to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sophat B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. She hopes to increase their combined income and provide a better life for her children.

Two members in this village bank loan possess end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine P. is 25 years old and married to Eddie. The young couple were blessed with three children and live in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Cristine became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative way back in April 2003. With the wide array of programs and services of the Cooperative, she decided to join Paglaum MPC. Two of their children are beneficiaries of Paglaum Community Development Foundation Incorporated (PCDFI), the mother organization, and at the same time, the social development partner of the Cooperative. With the education sponsorship of PCDFI to their children, the couple is aiming to survive on their daily expenses. Gifted with skills in carpentry, they tried their hand at the construction of fishing boats. In need of capital, they are reaching out to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a PHP 15,000 loan. Cristine and Eddie would like to own a motorized pumpboat in the future and hope to see their children fulfill their lifelong careers.

loans.use: Construction of fishing boats

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat H. is a small entrepreneur from Khujand, Tajikistan. She is married and the loving mother of three children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. Shahodat sells women's traditional dresses and skull-caps in one of the famous local markets called “Panjshanbe”.

Shahodat is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD for the term of 12 months to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. The only dream of Shahodat is to ensure her children of a good education and to make them happy. We believe Shahodat’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her venture and timely loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing women's traditional dresses and skull-caps to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy B., 57, is married and lives with her husband (pictured here) and her child in the Battambang province. She and her husband raise chickens and grow rice to earn a living, and are able to make a combined $4 every day. This couple hopes to use this loan to build a cage and expand their livestock by adding more chickens and purchasing more feed.

loans.use: Buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia is 24 years old and is originally from Xeatzac, a small village about 3 kilometers outside of Tecpan, Guatemala.
