Maria Lucrecia raises and sells animals, which she has done ever since she was a little girl and used to help her father. She is now married and her husband works as a construction assistant. She raises animals to contribute financially to the household and to help earn enough to build their house and pay daily living expenses.

For the past five years, she has had pigs and just one cow, from which she sells milk. She is requesting a loan to help her invest in another dairy cow. She also needs capital to purchase food and supplements to help care for the cows and to aid in producing more milk. Her hope is to increase her income and to have enough money to improve their home.

*************************************************************************************


Maria Lucrecia es una mujer joven, tiene 24 años de edad,  es originaria de la aldea Xeatzac a 3  Kilómetros del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala,  en el departamento de Chimaltenango.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales,  se inicio desde muy pequeña en esa activad productiva, ayudándole a su padre. Luego se caso, y su esposo se dedicaba a ayudante de construcción. Maria Lucrecia para contribuir económicamente con su esposo, y para construir juntos su casa y sufragar los gastos según sus necesidades se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, hace aproximadamente 5 años y a la venta de leche, actualmente tiene los cerdos y una vaca.  Ella quiere invertir mas en otra vaca lechera, y necesita capital para comprar 5 quintales de concentrado,  para crecimiento, y 5 quintales para engorde,  con el fin de tener mejores ingresos, y con un capital propio para mejorar de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase a new dairy cow and food for livestock

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza S. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Roza is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 39 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos que viven en su casa. En sus 17 años de casado, quien lidera la actividad agrícola de su familia es su esposa, porque a ella le agradan mucho estas labores, mientras que Víctor, conocido como el “chino”, sólo acude a la chacra en época de cosecha para cargar los sacos a los mercados de Tarma. Años atrás trabajaba como chofer, pero ahora compraron un carro y lo ingresó a una línea de transportes, entonces ahora “el chino” está conduciendo su propia movilidad y está muy contento por ello. A las 4.00am ya está haciendo cola esperando su turno, pero muchas veces, antes de su turno le piden sus servicios, y en esos días sus ganancias ya no son sólo 40 soles diarios, sino que aumenta a 80 por ello que siempre se levanta muy temprano. Los planes de Víctor son de trabajar muy duro para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y tener otro negocio para que su esposa no se sacrifique tanto en la chacra. Víctor está ingresando al banco comunal de su esposa porque ella tuvo que viajar por el fallecimiento de un familiar. Entonces Víctor está asumiendo la responsabilidad de su esposa comprometiéndose a asistir a cada una de las reuniones de pago. El dinero que solicitan es para la compra de fertilizantes, y la otra parte para la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto.
texts.en:
Victor is 39 years old, is married and has six kids that live at home. In 17 years of marriage, his wife has led the agricultural activities, because she likes to do these tasks, while Victor, nicknamed the "Chinese", only goes to the farm during harvesting time to load bags to take to the markets in Tarma. Years ago he worked as a driver, but now he has bought a car and has joined a transportation line. Now the "Chinese" is driving himself and is very happy for this.

At 4:00 AM he is already queuing up in line waiting for his turn, but many times, before his turn people ask for his services. On these days his earnings increase from 40 soles per day to 80 soles, which is why he always gets up very early. Victor plans to work very hard to improve the quality of life for his family, and have another business so that his wife does not have to sacrifice so much at the farm. Victor is going to his wife's village bank because she had to travel for the death of a family member. Now Victor is assuming his wife's responsibility of attending each of the payment meetings. The money requested is to buy fertilizer and new tires for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es:
La Señora Crecencia  tiene 47 años de edad, madre soltera de cinco hijos, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, una mujer emprendedora creando un ingreso económico por medio de la comercialización de comidas caseras y la iniciación de una pulpería.
Sus planes es que con mayores ingresos realizar mejoras en su vivienda y estabilidad económica. Con el préstamo en Afodenic lograr comprar variedad de productos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, verduras y otros productos de los cuales abastecerá la pulpería y la comideria, ofreciendo a sus clientes una variedad de alimentos, con esto espera captar clientes nuevos y obtener mejor ganancia,
texts.en:
Crecencia, 47, is a single mother of five children. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the city of Managua. Crecencia, an enterprising woman, is creating income by selling home made meals and starting a mini market. When her income increase she plans to improve her home and have economic stability. With a loan from Afodenic she will buy a variety of basic products like rice, beans, corn, oil, vegetables and others to stock her mini market and eatery. She will offer a variety of foods, and she hopes to gain new customers and a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and products to make her delicious food

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is borrowing PHP 7,000 as additional working capital in her general store business in their simple village of Monguia, Dupax Del Norte of Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Pedro E., and they are blessed with five children. With sacrifices and patience in maintaining their family livelihood, four of their children have already finished their studies in college while her youngest child is still a college student.

Thus, Julieta and her husband are doing their best to earn a higher income. She will use the loan to buy different grocery items and at least two cases of soft drinks that are very much in demand this summer. She is expecting to increase her income with the loan she is hoping to borrow and by working very hard.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her general store

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Delmi Jeannette

texts.es: Delmi Jeannette C. vive en el departamento de La Paz, vive con sus hijos Tatiana de 11 años y Josué de 9 años, el esposo de Delmi se encuentra fuera del país, ayudando a su familia mensualmente por medio de remesas. Delmi aprovecha la oportunidad de superación económica, montando una tienda en su casa, donde lleva ya 7 años de tenerla. Delmi solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio, el cual ha ido crecido por la gran ambición de Delmi hacia poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delmi Jeannette C. lives in the Dept. of La Paz with her children, eleven-year-old Tatiana and nine-year-old Josué. Her husband is out of the country, helping his family with monthly remittance payments. Delmi is taking advantage of the opportunity for economic advancement by setting up a store in their house, which they have had for the last seven years. She is seeking this loan because she wants to stock up her business, which has been growing because of the great ambition she has of being able to improve things for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her business.

loans.name: Shahnoz

texts.ru: Шахноз – молодая женщина 27 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды и женской обуви на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Так как ее муж не очень хорошо зарабатывает, она старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Конечно же ей очень трудно. Шахноз закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Шахноз хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Shahnoz is a 27-year old mother of three. She is married. She has a high school diploma and makes a living by purchasing children's clothing and women's shoes at Istaravshan's wholesale market and selling them at the Farovon market of Gafurov town. Since her husband does not earn much, Shahnoz works hard in order to provide for her family. This is certainly not easy. In order to expand her assortment and attract more customers, Shahnoz has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's clothing and women's shoes

loans.name: Hafizan Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Hafizan baji is the wife of M. A.. They have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Her husband has run a construction-supplies business for more than three years. He sells the supplies to building contractors and earns income. Hafizan baji is a very hardworking lady. She has a business of making electric wire rolls and selling them to the electric shops. She has been doing this work for more than two years. Her business gives her a good income, which allows her to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to advance her husband’s business. 

This group loan consists of four additional people: 

Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Nadra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy school bags to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Hafizan baji is wearing a red shawl in this photo.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  De Fofanabougou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à FOFANABOUGOU  un des villages de la commune rurale de FANA, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ils viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ils comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 5 hectares. Ils s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur le marché hebdomadaire de la ville de FANA.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Tingolé, après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married men who average 36 years of age and 3 children. The men live in polygamous families in FOFANABOUGOU, a village in the rural community of FANA, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members just started collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being able to carry out their winter-time work. They grow corn exclusively which remains the dominant crop of the area. As for the use of this loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizer and the like, and minor farm supplies and equipment. They also intend to cover the cost of labor for maintaining 5 hectares. Supplies are gotten essentially from the weekly market of the city of FANA. After the harvests, the produce is sold in Fana, Tingolé, to customers composed of men and women. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Beg

texts.en:
Beg C. T. is thirty years old and married with three young children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of selling food, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family, generating income through his employment as a construction worker, earning $2 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, including Beg C. T.'s family. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's difficulties, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy more fish and chickens, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity, as she can resell them at a fair and profitable price.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chickens to resell

loans.name: Agossi Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et assure avec son mari l’éducation scolaire de leurs deux enfants. C’est justement pour cette raison qu’elle a décidé en 2003 de vendre des produits d’alimentation générale pour compléter les ressources financières de leur foyer. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; elle demande d’avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 10 cartons d’OMO, 05 sacs de riz, 03 sacs de gari et 05 bidons d’huile. Elle est très connue dans son quartier Agoè hombi à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman is married and, with her husband, ensures that their two children are educated.  For this reason only, she decided to sell grocery items in 2003 in order to round out her financial resources at home.  Currently, she needs to renew her inventory;  she's asking WAGES to obtain a loan to buy ten boxes of OMO (a brand of dish detergent), five sacks of rice, three sacks of gari (granulated cassava), and five containers of oil.  She is well-known in her district of Agoè Hombi in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji S. bakes and sells bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials. Keji is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 5 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es: María Candelaria M. D. D. C. resiD. en el oriente D. país en San Francisco Gotera D. departamento D. Morazán. María vive con su hijo quien estudia y su esposo que le ayuda en el negocio. María tiene un comedor donD. todos los días da servicio, se venden desayunos, almuerzos, tortillas y bebidas; el crédito que solita María es porque quiere comprar al por mayor,  ya que se ahorra mucho y esto le hará obtener mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the eastern part of the country, in San Francisco Gotera, Morazan Department. She lives with her son who studies and her husband who helps her in the business.

Maria has an eatery where she offers her services every day. She sells breakfasts, lunches, tortillas and drinks. The loan Maria requests is to buy supplies at wholesale, since she can save a lot this way and obtain a greater profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES AT WHOLESALE

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: At the age of 50, Tessie B. still dreams of having a shelter that will secure her and her husband against any harm brought about by poverty, as they grow old. She joined ASHI, a KIVA field partner in the Philippines, to be able to access a loan. This opportunity will enable her to put up her own business, bandi making (coconut candy making), and be economically independent from her husband who is a farmer. Bandi is one of the famous delicacies of Antique province. Most of the customers buying this delicacy are tourists and they are buying bandi for a present when they go home to their own places. Profits she will be getting out of this business will be her means to augment her husband’s sporadic income. Most of her earnings will be saved for her and her husband’s needs in the future and some will be used to support her children’s family, which is also poor. Though her children no longer live with her, she can’t afford seeing them suffer because of poverty. Through loans she can request, she believes that the business she’ll be financing will bring change to her family's lives.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for bandi making (coconut candy making)

loans.name: Mr. Koeng Yun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Koeng Y. is the president of the village bank loan consisting of 8 people located in Choes Village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes

Mr. Koeng Y. is 26 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Sath Kosal, is employed in a garment factory.

Mr. Koeng Y. is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. With this plantation he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile which has a bad effect on his crops.

In order to deal with this problem he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. He will use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is from the village of Owaon. She is 47 years old. Elena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products by "Avon" in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Arewa

texts.en: Arewa lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells groceries in her house. She is happy with her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase her groceries. Arewa has been in this business for a long time. Arewa is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She is a friendly woman and hardworking. Arewa wants to increase the prosperity of her family and that of her business. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hilda Perfecta

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Perfecta A. D. A., tiene 51 años D. edad, vive a 10 km D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, en la zona oeste, la Sra. Hilda es casada se encuentra a cargo D. 2 hijas quienes se encuentran estudiando y al mismo tiempo colaborando con la atención al ganado lechero, cuenta con vivienda propia, que al mismo tiempo utiliza el espacio para la crianza D. su ganado.

La señora Hilda se dedica a la actividad lechera desD. hace más D. 20 años siendo esta su principal actividad económica, destinando su producción a la elaboración D. quesillo con ventas directas al público en la feria central D. Cochabamba. 

El presente crédito será empleado en la compra D. alimento en general para su ganado lechero, previendo la escases del alimento durante gran parte del año. La Sra. Hilda nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su ganado lechero para poder dejar a sus hijas una buena herencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilsa Perfecta A. D. A. is 51 years old and lives 10 km away from the city of Cochabamba, in the west. Mrs. Hilda is married and has 2 daughters, who are students and help their mother work with their dairy livestock. They have their own housing, which also has space for the livestock.

Mrs. Hilda has been involved in dairy farming for more than 20 years as her principle economic activity. She sells cheese that they make at the market in the center of Cochabamba.

This loan will be used to buy general feed for the dairy livestock; there have been shortages of feed for a large part of the year. Mrs. Hilda tells us that her biggest dream is to grow her dairy farm so she can leave her daughters a good inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying feed for dairy livestock (soy, corn)

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
el señor Edilberto R. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, su compañera de hogar trabaja en la empacadora ibermar (empacadora de mariscos).
Edilberto se dedica a la compra y venta productos de uso personal, su producto lo vende ambulante en diferentes colonias y caserios cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
tiene  4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
las ventas en la epoca de navidad fueron buenas para el y ahorita se quedo con poco producto y desea surtir mas su negocio. las ganancias que obtuvo en navidad las invirtio en su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Edilberto R. is 37 years old he lives in a civil union and he has a three year old daughter. His companion works in the packing plant Ibermar, she packages seafood. Edilberto buys and sells personal use products which he sells on foot in different towns and at farms near his home, he has had this business for four years. Sales during the Christmas season were good for Edilberto and now he is left with few products and he wants to resupply his business. What he earned at Christmas he invested in his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothbrushes, deodorants, toothpaste, nail clippers, creams, flashlights, bateries

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly S. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental Province. She is 45 years old, unmarried, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beverly makes and sells snacks and other delicacies to members of the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Beverly joined Kiva field partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos which she plans to use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a snack business.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn B. is a married woman who supports her family by selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes, vegetable vending and doing other networking sales activities. She lives in Brgy. Basak, Cuayan Negros Occidental with her husband and their 6 children.  Her children are 5 to 17 years old; one works and 5 are currently studying and also helping their parents.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Ma. Lyn is now borrowing PHP 20,500 so that she can continue with her multiple business activities, the bulk of which is selling RTW clothes. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. A previous loan of PHP 20,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Lyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her cafe business

loans.name: Jovita's Group

texts.en:
Jovita C. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default.

Jovita is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a weaving business, primarily selling personal home products like plastic wares to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her ninth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rou

texts.en:
Rou S., 24, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She is employed in a local garment factory and makes an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her husband produces stoves made from clay, earning an income of USD 5.00 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business and generate a better income.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to pay for the children’s schooling. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Katwekamwe, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
K. Getrude, aged 57, is hardworking and dedicated to her banana plantation enterprise that she has run for over ten years. This has earned her a monthly profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings that has helped in providing basic needs for her children with some side income generated from selling clothes.

This loan will be an incentive for Getrude to purchase farm tools like hoes and fertilizer and to modernize her plantation to improve on the banana crop which is commonly used for making a local dish by customers. This will increase Getrude’s sales revenue and enable her to pay her daily bills including her children’s school bills.

Getrude belongs to a group of nine members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools like hoes, manure and mulches

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells planks at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to grow her business in the future.

Mary is 42 years old and is married with four children. Her children attend school and she hopes they become graduates very soon.

Mary is a hardworking woman and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta tiene 55 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Jesús D. 60 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes ya son mayores D. edad e independientes económicamente, pero viven juntos en su casa que es propia, ubicado en la ciudad D. Pichanaki. Sus campos agrícolas producen todo los productos naturales oriundos D. la zona, por eso lo cuida con mucho esmero desD. hace 15 años. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos, esto lo realiza en compañía D. su esposo.  Ambos disfrutan D. sus trabajos y lo gratificante que le resulta, permitiéndoles vivir cómodamente. Lo que más le gusta D. la agricultura es procurar que estén limpios sus terrenos, D. esa manera se desarrollaran mejor, sin embargo el tener que trasladar su cosecha a los puntos D. venta, siempre le ha sido muy pesado y caro por tener que pagar el flete. Su carácter emprendedor le ha dado mucha ventaja para continuar trabajando, por lo que ahora anhela instalar un negocio D. venta D. comestibles al por mayor y menor en su vivienda y con ello lograr a ser una D. las distribuidoras más importantes D. su localidad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología D. trabajo D. su grupo comunal se muestra contenta D. seguir perteneciendo a este grupo que es muy unido y exigente en los pagos, eso le convierte en una persona responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios para que retiren la maleza D. sus terrenos así como comprar insecticidas para cuidar D. las plagas que afecten sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Roberta is 55 years old and shares her life with her husband Jesús, who is 60 years old, and their four adult children. Even though they are financially independent, her children still live in her house located in the city of Pichanaki. Her farmland produces all types of natural products that are indigenous to the area. Roberta has been farming with great care for the past 15 years. In addition, she manufactures bricks along with her husband. They both enjoy the work and find it rewarding since it allow them to live comfortably. What she enjoys most about farming is clearing her land because it allows her crops the best chance to develop properly. However, transporting her harvest to market is difficult because the loads are heavy and the cost of moving the freight is expensive. Her entrepreneurial spirit has proven to be an advantage because it has enabled her to continue working. Roberta now yearns to open a grocery store in her home where she can sell retail and wholesale with hopes of becoming one of the largest distributors in the area.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Roberta is familiar with the work methodology of her Communal Bank and happy to continue her membership because her group is very close and demanding when it comes to completing their payments. As a result, Roberta has become a responsible person. With the loan she requested, Roberta will hire workers to rid her farmland of weeds. She will also buy insecticides to guard against pests that can impact her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides & hire workers to remove weeds from her land

loans.name: Ami Chantal Essenam

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisé dans le commerce  de pagnes  depuis 2007, elle a associé à cela la vente d’eau en sachet  appelée pure WATER. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut dynamiser son commerce raison pour laquelle elle sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit de WAGES qui lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes  de grandes qualités. Elle est célibataire, c’est  avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle  subvient  à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This woman has been selling “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing] since 2007; in addition, she also sells drinking water in plastic pouches known as “Pure Water.” She buys her stock at the big market in Lomé. She would like to give her business a boost, which is why she is seeking a second loan from WAGES, allowing her to purchase ten sets of high-quality “pagnes.” She is single, and the income derived from this business allows her to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" cloth and water in plastic pouches

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto P.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 42 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child. They are from the town of Banga. Roberto has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be his first loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. In addition to credit for its clients, CEVI also provides savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est une femme de 30 ans elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de KANDIA1 depuis le 1er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiant, elle habite un ville éloigné de la ville, les population se déplacent très souvent en moto alors que ces produits se font rares du fait de la distance. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en carburant et lubrifiant et revendre aux populations locales. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna S. is a 30-year old woman who is a widow and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KANDIA1 since June 1st, 2007 and has received six consecutive loans, all repaid without incident. She is starting a small business selling fuel and lubricant. She lives in a village away from the city and people often move around on motorcycles, but these products are scarce due to the distance. Her new loan will allow her to stock up on fuel and lubricant, and sell to local people. In doing so, she plays an active role in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run a small business selling fuel and lubricant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy thirty units of Tropigas.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn F. is from the village of Turod, Quezon. She is 28 years old, married and has an infant. Novelyn owns and operates a business making and selling cooked food for daily meals. Novelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Novelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Novelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Novelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin N. is a villager in Thommoda village, in Takeo province and she is 48 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land. She cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family's costs of living. Her husband, Mr. Khy Ben, is a chicken and duck seller, in the local market, where he is able to earn some income to support his family. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Phin N. is requesting for a loan to buy more chickens and ducks to resell. She is a mother of six children, one is a teacher, while another one is a laborer, and the rest are studying in school and they are helping in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks to resell.

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Doña Esmirna tienen 60 años D. edad, ella vive con su esposo, se dedica a la venta D. materiales para manualidades, los cuales se utilizan en bodas, bautizos, quince años, etc. Tiene treinta años D. contar con el negocio el cual la ha ayudado a mantenerse, por la falta D. capital no ha logrado surtir bien su tienda. Se organiza con otras vecinas quienes se conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo, el Banco Comunal le eligen el nombre D.  PROSPERIDAD, es integrado por diez mujeres quien cada una D. ellas cuenta con su propio negocio. Ella espera que el préstamo la ayuD. a salir adelante e incrementar la clientela y el volumen D. las ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Esmirna is 60 years old and lives with her husband. She spends her time selling craft supplies used for weddings, baptisms, girls’ fifteenth birthday parties, and other events. Esmirna has thirty years of experience in this business which has helped her to support herself. However, she lacks the capital needed to keep her store well-stocked. She organized a group of neighbors who have known each other for a long time. This Communal Bank chose the name “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) and consists of ten women who each have their own business. Esmirna expects that the loan will help her get ahead, expand her customer base, and increase her sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy craft materials

loans.name: C2168 Amahoro Group

texts.en:
Madi is 40 years old and is married with two children: the first one is 10 years old and the last one is 8 years old.

Madi is a businessman who works hard so that he can provide all the basic needs of his family. He puts that hard work into a business he owns selling various styles of clothes. In particular, Madi is a new entrepreneur because he has an experience of only two years but he is well-known in his business and well-organized. The hours of his business are from seven in the morning to four in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Madi is the leader of this group of six members. He and his group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Through this expansion, all members of group will be able to satisfy their customers and can expect to earn more profits which will help them to save money and to sort out their family problems.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: La Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Juana es una D. los miembros del grupo La union 1 y 2, ellos son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, ventas D. comida, etc; en la ciudad D. Hato Mayor una D. las ciudades mas rurales del pais, cuya economia depenD. D. la agricultura. Está asociada D. Esperanza es madre D. 10 hijos, los cuales ha criado con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios junto a su pareja. DesD. hace 18 años se dedico a hacer negocios que generaran mas ingresos para el sustento D. su familia, inicio su negocio en su casa, con un poco D. dinero que pudo conseguir, actualmente lleva con nosotros 4 años y esta recibiendo su octavo prestamo, en cada uno ha realizado sus pagos satisfactoriamente y ha realizado buenas inversiones. Ella actualmente esta operando una fritura (un puesto D. comida fritas) y una fantasia (una pequeña tienda D. cosmeticos y accesorios especialmente para las mujeres).

Juana está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. Pollo, platanos, carnes, etc, pero tambien cosmeticos, ropas, zapatos y accesorios, etc. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para terminar D. construir la cual la esta construyendo poco a poco. Su actividad favorita es negociar y su reto primordial es mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the “La Unión 1 y 2” (The Union 1 & 2) group.  They are micro enterprisers dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, teaching, food sales, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture.

This Esperanza associate is the mother of 10 children who she has raised with many sacrifices and much effort together with her spouse.  For the last 18 years she has been in business to generate additional family income.  She started her business at home with a little money she was able to obtain.

She has been collaborating with us for 4 years now and is getting her 8th loan.  Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. some good investments.

She currently operates a “fritura” (fried fast food stand) and a “fantasía” (a small cosmetics and women’s accessories store).

Juana is planning to invest the money from the new loan purchasing chicken, plantains, meats, etc. but also some cosmetics, clothes, shoes and accessories, etc.

She will use her profits to finish building her house that she’s been building little by little.  

Her favorite pastime is negotiating and her main challenge is keeping her business afloat.

loans.use: For bananas, chicken, beef, cosmetics, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Felicitas is widowed and has six adult children. Before, she only earned income through pig raising. Now she also farms for a living. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to her community. She says investing in farming is a good decision since it has been helping her family financially. She hopes to keep her farm productive.

Felicitas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers who helped at her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers who helped at her farm

loans.name: Salankat Ole

texts.en:
Salankat has been rearing animals for sell in Niavasha for the last two years. He is 37 years old, married to S. Ene Lepinguiki, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy five calves, each at 5,000 KES, that he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Salankat hopes to open a butcher shop from where he will be selling meat.

loans.use: To buy five calves

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 47 years old. Nancita is married and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 6. To make a living, Nancita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nancita is a hard-working mother and she wishes for her children to be professionals someday.

Nancita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nancita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nancita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and rice and corn seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice and corn seeds.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.fr:
PIERRE T. EST UN COMMERÇANT BASE A DAKAR IL EXERCE CE MÉTIER DEPUIS 7 ANS:SON ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE EST LA VENTE DE PRÊT A PORTER ET DE CHAUSSURES POUR HOMMES ET FEMMES. LA VARIÉTÉ DE CES PRODUITS S'EXPLIQUE PAR CES VOYAGES EN GAMBIE ET A SANDAGA AFIN DE POUVOIR FIDÉLISER SA CLIENTÈLE SURTOUT LES FILLES ET CES PRODUITS SONT PAR EXEMPLE DES BODYS DES JEANS DES ROBES ETC.
L'OBJET DE CE PRÊT REPOSE SUR LE FAIT QU'IL VEUT RENFLOUER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT AFIN DE SATISFAIRE LA FORTE DEMANDE DE CES CLIENTS.
texts.en:
Pierre T. is a merchant based in Dakar. He has been in this business for seven years. His main activity is the sale of ready-to-wear clothing and footwear for both men and women. He can offer a wide selection of products due to his travels to Gambia and Sandaga. This allows him to keep a loyal clientele, especially the girls. He sells bodysuits, jeans, dresses, etc. among other things.

He is seeking this loan to strengthen his working capital and meet the high demand of his customers.

loans.use: To strengthen his working capital

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: La señora Araceli L. Hernández es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. Doña Araceli tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria por que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para apoyarla con los gastos de la escuela, también dice que en su localidad en ese entonces no había secundaria y que tenían que trasladarse a otra comunidad para estudiarla. Doña Chely como es conocida por sus amistades esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en la cenaduría (restaurante para cenar) que tiene ella vende ahí pozole, tacos, enchiladas, tostadas etc. comenta que la abre los días viernes, sábado y domingo y entre semana se dedica a la venta de verduras en un local que tiene en el centro de localidad. Ella esta casada con el señor Isidro el cual es carnicero, ellos tienen 3 hijos la mayor ya casada, después le siguen Miguel, de 12 años de edad que estudia la primaria y Jesús Guadalupe de un año de edad. La meta que tiene para su negocio es invertir en abarrotes, comenta que poco a poco a estado comprando anaqueles para empezar a surtir los abarrotes. También comenta que su esposo es una persona muy trabajadora ya que los días domingos vende barbacoa. Ella y su esposo están trabajando muy duro porque están construyendo su casa, dice que esta ahorrando para comprar las ventanas y puertas por que ya le gustaría vivir en ella ya que es de cemento porque donde vive es prestado por su papá y es una casa de madera donde en época de invierno se mete el frió.
texts.en: Araceli L. Hernandez is originally from the region known as San Jose Purua. It is located in the state of Michoacan, a beautiful region known for its thermal water springs. Araceli is 38 years old and she has a grade six education. Her parents did not have sufficient funds to keep her in school. Her community did not have a high school at the time and they would have had to move to another community to attend. Chely, as she is known to her friends, requests a loan to invest in her restaurant (restaurant where dinners are served). There she sells pozole, tacos, enchiladas, tostadas etc. She opens the restaurant on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. During the week she sells vegetables from a stand she has in the downtown area.  She is married to Isidro, a butcher, and they have 3 children together. The eldest girl is married. The second youngest is 12 years old and she is in primary school and Jesus Guadalupe is 1 year old.  She wishes to invest in her business with the purchase of grocery items. Slowly she has been purchasing more items to be well stocked. Her husband is a very hard working person who, on Sundays, sells barbecued meats. She and her husband work hard because they are having a house built for them. She says that they are saving to purchase windows and doors. She would like to live there already because it is made of cement. Where they live now is on loan from her father and it is a house made of wood and in the winter it is very cold.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purcase more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem R., 37, is married and lives with her three young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband works in construction, making $5 each day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kem R. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor P. L. tiene tres años de laborar en una empresa de nombre ENACAL que está ubicado en el Municipio de Granada, del Departamento de Granada como Operador de Pozo, actualmente es acompañado y dependen de él cuatro personas.

Como es un sueño que tiene el ir mejorando su casa esta señor se acerca a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar Mejoramiento de Vivienda y de esta forma satisfacer o cumplir sus sueños esto lo hace con el fin de que su familia tenga un techo digno y con las condiciones que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. P. L. has been employed as a Well Operator, by a firm called ENACAL, located in the town of Granada, Granada department, for three years.  He is currently in a relationship and has four dependents.

Because his dream is to gradually improve his house he approached the Ceprodel offices to request a home improvement loan thus making his dream come true.  He does this with the end in mind that his family has a proper roof and living conditions.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan O., 47, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. O. and her husband are both farmers raising pigs, earning an income of USD 4 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 65 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses.

O. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Yut

texts.en: Mr. Yut C. (pictured here) is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Thuon You, is 32 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yut is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives because it has broken in some places.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives

loans.name: Maura Gudelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Maura O. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de Induarma en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

Doña Maura tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad y su segundo hijo en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una unidad de taxi que es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia es empleada privada, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en sus momentos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon y ropa por catalogo, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es que su negocio crezca mucho mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maura O. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in the Induarma District of Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Doña Maura is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 18 and 17). Her first child, a daughter, is studying at the university while her son attends high school in the city. Maura’s husband is a driver by profession and has his own taxi.

She is a private employee and works Monday through Friday from 9am to 6pm. During her free time, she sells Avon products and clothes through a catalog. Maura has been in this business for five years.

She joined the Communal Bank seven years ago. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and clothing so that she can expand her business. Maura’s goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara M. lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband worked hard, but unfortunately his salary did not cover the expenses of their household at all. In 1993, in order to find a means of subsistence, they went off to Russia in search of a living and worked in a cafe. In 2006 they came back to Kyrgyzstan and opened a cafeteria in Osh city, using a start-up capital of 20,000 KGS. They worked a lot to make their café one of the most popular places, and achieved success. 

But in June of 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in Osh city, Gulsara lost her business. Her cafeteria was robbed and burned. But Gulsara, being a very optimistic person, didn’t give in. In order to reconstruct her cafeteria, she decided to engage in reselling foodstuffs. She rented a selling place at the local market and took different kinds of frozen goods on credit from her business partners. This fact indicates a great confidence in Gulsara’s personality and the prosperous future of her business.
 
Now, Gulsara is applying for a loan of 135.000 KGS, which she needs to broaden her assortment of goods.  With the revenues, she plans to resume her cafeteria business and continue to work. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old and married with four children. She has been farming for five years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business. She has also managed to provide an education to her children. In five years, she hopes to become the major supplier of cereals in her home town. She is also looking forward to adding more cows to her farm. She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de kiosco escolar donde vende sándwich, dulces, gaseosas y galletas y los días sábados y domingos la socia vende papa y haba en la ciudad de Cusco en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de kiosco escolar y negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el kiosco escolar.            
                                       
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion-Anta". It is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and to the department of Cusco.

Her name is Juana. She is 49 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her school canteen business. She sells sandwiches, sweets, soft drinks, and cookies every week day. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells potatoes and fava beans in the city of Cusco itinerantly. She wants to expand and to improve her school canteen business and her vegetable business. She requests a loan to purchase products for her canteen.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase products for her school canteen business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old while the youngest is 6.

Yolanda is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Yolanda sells her harvest at the market. For the past months, Yolanda earned about 3,000 PHP per month from farming. Yolanda works hard to improve her earnings and sustain her family.

This loan will be used by Yolanda to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and be able to improve their house soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Blanca le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventas y puertas de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar  y colocar la protecciones, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagarle y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Dona Blanca trabaja en una restauran de mesera y con ese ingreso pagara el crédito y que su esposo el señor Victor se encargara de los gastos familiares y escalares de sus dos hijos que tiene.
texts.en:
Blanca needs protections on the windows and doors to her house.  She is requesting a loan to pay a person to make and install the protections.

At this time she does not have the money needed to pay for it, and she worries about her family’s security.

Blanca works as a waitress at a restaurant, and she will use this income to pay back the loan.  Her husband, Victor, will take charge of paying the family expenses and the school expenses for their two children.

loans.use: to install protection on the windows and doors.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Julieta has a food shop that sells longganiza or home made sausages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like ground meat and food seasoning.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like ground meat and food seasoning

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is married and has six children aged 5 to 25. She is a greengrocer selling spinach, onions, mangoes, and various green vegetables at a busy street near a school. She often sells her produce to students at the school and residents in the neighborhood. Mildred has been running this business for 10 years.  She intends to use her loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business. 

Mildred wants to use the profits from her business to educate her children. She hopes to own a cereal store in the future. Mildred describes herself as dedicated and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar su actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia.
El se dedica a la carpintería. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad, ya sea maquinaría, herramientas, es muy reconocido en Pilar por la calidad y elaboración de sus muebles. Tiene el sueño de algún día poder ampliar aun mas su taller para poder seguir creciendo laboralmente.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como ser maderas, barniz, pinceles. Agradece a la Fundación por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and married.  He lives in the city of Pilar.   He owns his own house, which has the basic conditions necessary for him to carry out activities within the family nucleus; he also has his own vehicle.

He is a carpenter, and he has been doing this for four years.  He has the needed infrastructure, whether it be machinery or tools, to develop this business activity.  He is very well-known in Pilar for making furniture and for the quality of his work.

He has the dream that one day he will be able to expand his shop even more.  He wants to do this to be able to continue growing in his work.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies like wood, varnish, and paintbrushes.  He is grateful to the Fundación for its support.

loans.use: to buy raw material like wood, varnish, and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a married man with two boys who attend school. He lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, Duncan has operated a boda boda (motorcycle taxi business), his customers being town dwellers and passersby. The high cost of servicing his taxi is Duncan’s major challenge.

Duncan decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to buy hair cutting supplies and establish a barber shop. He dreams of expanding this business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting supplies and establish a barber shop.

loans.name: Asila

texts.en:
Asila is married with 3 children. Asila is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Asila is a pig grower to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for the pigs.

Asila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Asila hopes to have a concrete piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Twisungane Tudahemukirana Group

texts.fr:
Marceline  est agricultrice de pomme de terre et elle est membre du groupe Twisungane Tudahemukirana. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 27 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a 3 enfants de 3 à 7 ans, dont 2 enfants  scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des grains des tomates, des pompes, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmentation des quantités pour agriculture en augmentant l’étendue des champs. Dans les prochaines années Marceline voudrait être une grande agricultrice des tomates  dans sa région et être le fournisseur des usines. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aide sa famille d’en sortir dans la pauvrette.
texts.en:
Marceline is a potato farmer and a member of the group Twisungane Tudahemukirana. She was born in Rwanda and is 27 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 3 to 7 years old. Two of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade education. 

This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy tomato seeds, pumps, and fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor. 

Her strategy for business growth is to increase her yields by increasing the reach of her fields. In the next few years, Marceline would like to be a major tomato farmer in her region and to be the supplier for factories. With the profits, she foresees covering her children's schooling costs and helping her family climb out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, pumps, and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jifferson

texts.en:
Jifferson is 27 years old and still single. He did not pursue his secondary education due to financial burden. Despite this, he engages in vegetable production to help his parents in gaining income for their basic necessities, and finance the education of his younger brothers and sisters. He has been in this business for almost 9 years now. 

At his age, he is planning to get married, but thought that he needs to earn and save more money so that he is able to support his family when they are going to settle down. At this time, he planned to plant more vegetables but due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that this loan will help him work out his plan. 

He hopes that in the future, he will raise his own family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a business man, age 31 and single. For the last eight years, he has been selling clothes. He also practices dairy farming for more income. He has employed two people to help him to manage his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Wilma

texts.es: La señora Wilma y su familia viven en la zona villa armonía ubicada a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ella trabaja vendiendo diferentes tipos de cosas a crédito como ser frazadas, camas, ollas, juegos de vajillas y regalos. Tienen un promedio de 50 a 70 clientes en diferentes zonas e inclusive en oficinas públicas. Ella habla con sus futuros clientes y ellos hacen diferentes pedidos que ella paga y luego va cobrando de manera semanal o mensual con un incremento por el tiempo que tarden en pagar. Lo mas resaltante de esta actividad es que ella hace que sus clientes elijan los productos que desean y no así como hacen otras personas que primero compran los productos antes de ofrecerlos. Además esto asegura que sus clientes estén satisfechos ya que son ellos los que elijen de manera directa lo que van a adquirir. La Sra. Wilma trabaja con emprender desde hace tres años y en este tiempo demostró ser una cliente puntual y responsable. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de ollas a presión para pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Wilma and her family live in the Villa Armonia zone, located some 20 minutes from the city center. She works selling different types of things on credit, including blankets, beds, pots, sets of glassware, and gifts. Wilma has on average 50 to 70 customers in different zones, including in public offices. She speaks with her future customers and they make different requests which she purchases and then later she collects payments weekly or monthly, with an increase for time payment. The advantage of this activity is that Wilma has her customers select the products they want rather than as with other persons, first buying the products before offering them for sale. In addition, this assures that customers are satisfied, since they selected directly what they are acquiring. Wilma has worked with Emprender for some 3 years and during this time she has proven to be a punctual and responsible client. On this occasion, she is requesting a cash loan to buy pressure cookers ordered by customers.

loans.use: buy pressure cookers ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et fréquentent la même église. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Marie Kottin, est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une cinquième fois,l'appui financier de ALIDé. Marie Kottin est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Idelphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés,dont un reste encore à leur charge. Marie Kottin n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Marie Kottin mène comme activité depuis trente cinq  ans environs, la vente du charbon de bois à son domicile.A côté de cette activité, Marie Kottin  vend du vin de palme.C'est dans l'une des villes du Bénin, que Marie Kottin s'approvisionne en charbon de bois.Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle,Marie Kottin et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUTIN has three members who live in the same neighborhood and attend the same church. The representative for the group, Marie Kottin has her hand raised in the photo. To increase sales and to better serve their clients, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDE for the 5th time. Marie Kottin is 58 years old and married to Idelphonse. The couple has four children who attend school, so are naturally still in their care. Marie Kottin never attended school. In order to satisfy her needs and those of her children, Marie Kottin has been selling wood charcoal from her home for about the past 35 years. As a side business, she also sells palm wine. Marie purchases her charcoal from a city in Benin. In an effort to strengthen her business and better serve her clients, Marie and the other members of JESUKPEGO are requesting their 5th loan from ALIDE. Their goal is to grow the business. Their past loans have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y un hijo, es vendedor de frazada, set de cubrecamas y cortinas entre otras cosas para el hogar, este negocio se dio gracias a su propia iniciativa, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes, y cuenta con experiencia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercaderia de trabajo: frazadas, cortinas, cubrecamas, colchas, sabanas, esta compra le ayudara a surtir su negocio ya que es necesario para ofrecerle más mercadería  a sus clientes y le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias.
La proyeccion de Luis es mantener el negocio y generar más ingresos para el hogar y la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and son.  He sells blankets, bedspread sets, curtains and other household textiles.  The business was started on his own initiative and he has experience.  He has no fixed work schedule to attend to customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his business such as blankets, curtains, bedspreads and sheets.  This will help him increase inventory because he must be able to offer more variety to his customers to improve his profits.

Luis plans to stay in business and generate more income for his household and son's education.

loans.use: To buy blankets, curtains, bedspreads, and sheets for his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 41 años, es un hombre con muchas ganas de trabajar, dinámico y emprendedor. Convive con su pareja y sus dos pequeños hijos,  a los que quiere mucho y se esfuerza para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
La actividad que realiza Juan es la venta de abarrotes en general, para esto cuenta con un puesto de venta propio ubicado en el mercado informal Bellavista. Por tanto ésta muy contento de tener un ingreso económico propio y que así contribuye con los gastos de su hogar. Es así que su día laboral empieza desde muy temprano en donde acomoda sus productos esperando que la llegada de sus clientes, a quiene atiende amablemente, ganándose así la amistad de muchos de ellos. Sabe que el trabajo constate es la clave para el éxito, por ello espera crecer su negocio, ampliarlo y comprar variedad de productos en mayores volúmenes y a un menor costos. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contento con su grupo comunal ya que conoce a todos sus integrantes, y los considera buenas personas, puntuales y solidarias. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará mas productos como: azúcar, leche, arroz para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 41 years old, is a dynamic and enterprising man who likes to work.  He lives together with his partner and their two small children, who he loves very much.  Juan makes every effort to give them a better quality of life.
Juan's business is selling general groceries.  He has a sales stand located in the informal market, Bellavista.  As such, he is very happy to have his own income and to be able to contribute to the household expenses.  Juan's workday starts very early.  He arranges his products and waits for his customers to arrive.  He gives them friendly service, which has earned him friendships with many of his customers.  He knows that hard work is the key to success.  And that is way he wants to grow and expand his business and to purchase a variety of products in greater quantities and at a lower cost.  This will be Juan's first loan with MFP.  He is happy with his communal bank, since he knows all of the members and considers them to be good, punctual and supportive people.  With the requested loan, Juan will purchase more products, like sugar, milk and rice, to stock up his business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock up his business.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is a 43-year-old humble villager who lives in the Ang Snoul district with her husband and two children. She is a rice cultivator, earning approximately $2 per day to cover her daily expenses. The main source of her income is from her husband who raises poultry, earning around $8 each day. 

Mrs. Phuong is a responsible housewife who satisfies the family’s needs as much as she can. She wants to upgrade and make her living more comfortable. So she decided to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a pumping machine. Moreover, with the rest of this fund, she’ll pay for the electrical connection fees. Currently, the electricity network is connected in the vicinity of her commune.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine and to pay for the electrical connection fees.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Leonisa has a shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
