Aneit B. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Aneit is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Aneit owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Aneit has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aneit joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aneit has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Aneit is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aneit from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.ru:
Ramila A. 46 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Ramila yeyo muj i deti jivut v qorode Baku. 
Uje 5  let kak Ramila zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsay v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe produktov dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Ramila A. is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, who are college student. Ramila  lives with her husband and children in the city of Baku.

For the last five years, Ramila has been in business selling groceries. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space  and be able to accommodate more wares.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Lucy Belen

texts.es:
Lucy de 34 años, tiene un negocio de venta de bollos (comida típica en las playas de Ecuador contiene plátanos y pescado).  Empezo el negocio con una herencia familiar ya que a los 16 años aprendió como preparar este platoo típico. 

Continúo con el negocio y lo convirtió en su negocio económico hasta ahora que tarabaj vendiendo bollos a un valor de $ 1.00 cada uno. Trabaja sola aunque en ocasiones le ayuda la hermana a realizar los bollos ya que hay que rayar mucho el platano para que quede en su punto y cocinarlo.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo cemento y materiales de construcción para mejorar el local donde los vende.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 34, has a bollos sales business (bollos are a typical food on the beaches of Ecuador, containing bananas and seafood). She started this  business from a family inheritance since she learned how to prepare this typical dish at the age of 16.

She continued with this business and converted it into her main source of income. She sells bollos at $1.00 each. She works alone, although her sister helps her to make the bollos since it is necessary to cut up the banana quite a bit so that it will be the proper shape before cooking it. She has many dreams for her business, so she wants to continue with her business. She will use this loan to buy cement and construction materials to improve the store where she sells the bollos.

loans.use: cement, sand, blocks

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Nadezhda sells perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products in the central marketplace of her home town. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnyas in this business; the profit is 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda started her enterprise 3 years ago. Today, Nadezhda owns a container-store. Container-stores are large metal shipping containers often used for overseas shipping. They can be used for storage, but make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise.

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase her working capital. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel C. is from the village of Barucboc, Quezon, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Richel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Richel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Richel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Richel is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Richel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old businessman who runs a cafeteria to earn a living. He also sells second-hand shoes to supplement his income. Most of his time he spends on selling shoes so he has employed four people to help him run the cafeteria. Prior to this, he was selling second-hand clothes. He hopes that someday, he will open a hotel.
Charles is very grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, because he has received training in customer care from them. This has meant that he has been able to attract many customers to his business and his income has increased. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients and to install electricity in his business premises.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients, plus install electricity in business premises

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with twins. He lives in a small agricultural town of Vodyanoye. Alexander grows vegetables. He owns six big greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. He has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this business. Alexander has been in farming business for six years. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase plastic film. He is planning to re-cover his six greenhouses before the upcoming spring farming season to plant early tomatoes and protect them from freezing temperatures. In general, Alexander is hoping to use 5,000 Grivnyas out of the whole amount to purchase the film, 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, 3,000 Grivnyas to purchase coal and the rest for miscellaneous expenses related to greenhouse business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for his greenhouses

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman with five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marjorie is 44 years old. 

Marjorie has a spices and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Marjorie would like to send her children to school and have a good job.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Virginia is married and has two school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling green bananas & coconut wines in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 13,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. Virginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional yellow and green bananas. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de refrescos de horchata, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado municipal de san Francisco Gotera.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar ajonjolí,  morro, maní y azúcar, para preparar los refrescos, esta será una gran ayuda para ella y fortalecer el negocio, con suficiente material para preparar los productos.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda y fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in San Francisco Gotera, located in the department of Morazán.  She lives with her three children, and dedicates herself to selling horchata (a milky, rice-based drink flavored with sugar and spices).  Her stall is located in the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera.

She requests a loan to buy sesame seeds, morro, peanuts, and sugar to make her refreshments.  This would help her a great deal in strengthening the business with enough supplies to make her product.

Her objectives are to help her children, improve her home, and strengthen her business.

loans.use: buy sesame seeds, morro, peanuts and sugar for making her beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Candawan

texts.en:
Candawan  is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 51 years old. Candawan is separated from his spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Candawan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Candawan has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Candawan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candawan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by purchasing piglets to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Candawan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by purchasing piglets to raise.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 36 years old. She has six children who are aged from four to 15, some of whom she has adopted. Five are at school while the youngest is not yet at school. Pascasie sells foodstuff  which she has been doing for the past three years. This business has enabled her to take care of her family. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuff. With the profits she plans to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Ciudad Satélite. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona de Villa Exaltación  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene un dos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010.
texts.en:
Víctor works as a driver.  He is a member of the Ciudad Satélite drivers' union.  He needs this loan to buy a new engine for his passenger transport vehicle.

Víctor lives in his in-laws' home which is in Villa Exaltación district, in the city of El Alto.  He is married and two children.  He has been a client of IMPRO since 2010.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Solidario America Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario América lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor José Javier de 27 años quien trabaja en la construcción desde hace 10 años  como albañil y cuenta con dos trabajadores. Él con el crédito construirá su casa comprara los materiales arena, cemento, bloques…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Sheila es comerciante de variedades los cuales vende por encargo desde hace 5 años y Reyna de 39 años tiene una fritanga desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The 'América' solidarity group has three hard-working and entrepreneurial members.  The group's coordinator is 27 year-old José Javier who has been working in the building trade as a builder for 10 years.  He has two workers.  He will use this loan to build his own house.  He will buy sand, cement, blocks, etc.

The other members of this group are Sheila, who has been selling a variety of merchandise to order for five years, and 39 year-old Reyna, who has owned a fried food joint for seven years.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi has operated a food stall business for the past year, preparing and selling food to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the market. Her major goal is to establish a restaurant in the future.

Mwanamwinyi and her husband own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. They have three school-going children. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, Mwanamwinyi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, age 39, owns a store where she sells a variety of goods, such as soft drinks and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have two children. The family lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000.00 in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop. 

Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to open a mini-mart.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Tsinandali in the Kakheti region. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband, Ivane.

Natalia works in the Alexander Chavchavadze museum located in her village (Chavchavadze was a famous Georgian poet). Ivane works in a local winery. In addition to this work, Natalia and Ivane have a vineyard of two hectares as well as a one-hectare maize field. The family sells grapes and maize when they are in season. Their total monthly income is 750 GEL.

750 GEL does not result in enough to save up and beyond their present income. Therefore, Natalia has requested a loan of 1,100 GEL to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house. The house was repaired a long time ago, and it is too uncomfortable now for the family.

After renovation, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Dulamhand

texts.en: Dulamhand is 34 years old and lives with her two daughters and father in a one-room apartment in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two daughters are both high school students. Dulamhand operates picture trading business. She started her business in 2002. She paints by her self and sells her paintings at Local market. Her business is going well as she has collected nine years of working experience. She is planning to open her exhibition in the near future. She is a diligent and honest woman who says, "I want to expand my business and have constant income sources." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT loan to remodel her apartment.

loans.use: To remodel her apartment

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 48 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Maria Elena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Ebel. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maria Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria Elena was born in Cusco department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  Maria Elena currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Her business is selling Ebel-brand beauty products.  She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Maria Elena needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as perfume, lipstick and other products.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Amparito Manuelita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kenedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amparito, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 20 y 16 años de edad, la mayor está casada y la menor vive con ella y estudian en colegio.
 
Nuestra amiga para poder salir adelante con sus hijas después de que se divorcio empezó un negocio en su casa, allí instalo con los pocos recursos que tenía un pequeño restaurante y con el paso de los días ha ido ampliando y mejorando para brindar un gran servicio a sus clientes, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h00 hasta las 15h00, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que gracias a este negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijas. Con ella trabaja una chica a quien le paga un sueldo mensual.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “New Kennedy” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally.  It’s where the famous straw hats come from.

We met Amparito, 42, here.  She’s separated and has two daughters who are 20 and 16 years old.  The oldest one is married and the younger one still lives with her and is going to school.

In order to get ahead with her daughters after her divorce, our friend started a home-based business.  She used the few resources she had to open a small restaurant and as time has passed has been expanding and improving it to provide great customer service.  She works there Monday through Saturday from 6am until 3pm.  She makes breakfasts, lunches and a la carte dishes.  She tells us that thanks to this business she’s managed to get ahead and help her daughters.  A young woman works with her that she pays a monthly salary to.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs to prepare the meals.  This is the first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the speed with which the loans are approved.  Her goal is to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 33-year-old farmer married to Margret who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are five and two years old respectively. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Wycliffe will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into raising pigs. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and raise pigs in large amounts, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Rosmery Luz

texts.es: La señora Rosmery es cliente nueva de la institución la señora Rosmery ella tiene la actividad de peinadora,  tiene un pequeño hijito la señora Rosmery se dedica a realizar peinados  por toda la zona sur ya que su servicio lo realiza a domicilio ella vive en alquiler en una casa de la zona de Ovejuyo, su  esposo se dedica al manejo de una volqueta en una empresa con lo cual ayuda a la manutención de la familia ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de cepillos y tintes para el negocio ya que tiene que proveerse de material porque en cualquier momento le llaman sus clientes  para realizar peinados, ella es una persona joven  con ganas de superación y con el deseo de pronto tener su propio salón de belleza y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, la Sra. Rosmery se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rosmery is a new client of the lending agency. She is a hair stylist and has a little boy. She provides her services throughout the southern region since she travels to her customers. She rents a house in the Ovejuyo region. Her husband drives a dump truck for a local business, which helps to cover the family’s living costs. Rosemery is requesting the loan to purchase brushes and dyes for her business. She must provide her own supplies since at any moment her customers could call on her to style their hair. She is a young woman who hopes to improve her life. She hopes to have her own beauty salon soon, and to be able to offer better service to her customers. Rosmery feels happy and grateful towards the lending agency for the help it has offered her.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, such as brushes and dyes, for hairstyling.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: José De La Cruz es un joven incansable. Diariamente trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche en su vulcanizadora. Desde hace 17 años está dedicado a esta actividad con la que se ha sostenido. Comenzó cuando no tenía mucha experiencia porque era muy joven pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando obtuvo mucha clientela en el lugar donde estaba ubicado. Ahora solicita un crédito con el que pueda comprar llantas, herramientas, suavizantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
José de la Cruz is an industrious individual. He works from 7 in the morning to 7 at night every day in his tire repair shop, a job he’s been doing for 17 years. When he started he didn’t have much experience as he was very young, but as time passed he learned more and now he has many customers.

José is seeking a loan to buy tires, tools, fabric softener etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, fabric softener, tools etc.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marlina is 52 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marlina has a natural medicine business in the Philippines. Marlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Marlina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Elyse

texts.en:
Elyse is 27 years old and is married with two children between the ages of two and five years old.
He owns a business of transporting people. This is his first year in this business and he works from 6am until 10pm every day.

Elyse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) to help him in the business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tire, mirror, and engine) for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa, Nelson es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su negocio propio que es venta de calzado, dicha actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico por el cual transitan muchas personas y esto hace que sea muy visitado, todos los dias se lavanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado al por mayor para tener mayores ventas y buenos ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is 41 years old and he lives in the town of San Marcos de Colon with his wife and their children. Nelson is a hardworking man committed to his retail activity: he sells shoes, an activity he has been engaged in for 4 years. His shop is located in a very convenient spot in the town center: as the area is attended by many people, the shop has many customers, and he gets up early every day to open his shop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shoes at wholesale price to improve his sales and increase his earning in order to offer a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy shoes for his shop.

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством, на данный момент имеет 7 голов коров и 8 голов овец. Он выполняет всю тяжелое работу, чтобы дать образование своим детям. Султонкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он очень трудится и все его старания приносят ему стабильный доход и дают возможность продвигаться вперед. Султонкул планирует на полученную прибыль сыграть свадьбу сына. Все его планы требуют усердного труда и расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он хотел бы купить 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Для этого он просит  вас помочь ему в осуществлении его планов. Он планирует после женитьбы сына открыть ему отдельный бизнес для самостоятельного ведения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sultonkul is married and is a responsible father of 2 children. He has been working in cattle breeding for over 20 years and currently owns 7 cows and 8 sheep. He is doing all the hard labor so that he can provide education for his children. Sultonkul wants to expand his business and get good income. He is working hard and his efforts will provide him a stable income and will allow him to move ahead. Sultonkul is planning to use the income to pay for his son's wedding. All his plans require hard work and business expansion. In order to do that he would like to purchase 2 additional heads of cattle. His is asking for your help in realizing his plans. He is planning to open a separate business for his son after the wedding.

loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is 57 years old and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.

Arcadia has a bread-making business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery. Arcadia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for just one month.  In the future, Arcadia hopes to have savings and to be able to repair their house with the additional income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Lanie Jean

texts.en:
Lanie Jean is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Lanie Jean is married and has one infant. 

To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Lanie Jean has been in her business for two years, and earns PHP 3000 a month from this activity. 

In 2009, Lanie Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie Jean is requesting a loan of PHP 6,300 which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jossias Nguiliche

texts.pt:
Jossias de 45 anos de idade, casado pai de 5 (filhos) dos quais 4 (quatros) estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario  a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante de productos da primeira necessidade a mais de 10 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da primeira necessidade tais como: amendoim, arroz, feijao, caldo, rebucados e diversos prudutos para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu proprio estabelicimento comercial, actividade que esta ser acompanhado junto com a sua mulher
texts.en:
Jossias is 45 years old and married. He has five children, four of whom attend primary and secondary school and the other daughter is too young to go to school. He has been selling products that are household staples for over 10 years.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his store, a business he runs alongside his wife.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie âgée de 54 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Marie est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari. les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Marie vend divers produits (du lait, des bougies et des bonbons). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Marie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es:
Rosa Isela es una mujer sonorense trabajadora, entregada a su familia y orgullosa por su espíritu de lucha. Estudió la carrera de contaduría, tiene 47 años y ha estado casada por diez. Sus grandes tesoros y en quienes encuentra una motivación diaria son su hija de 24 años, una mujer casada quién estudió ingeniería, y su nieto de 6 años, a quién desea darle una mejor calidad de vida y un ejemplo de lucha.
Rosa tiene una tienda de abarrotes que inició porque vio una oportunidad con su trabajo de contadurías independientes y la aprovechó. Con esta tienda ha ayudado a sustentar así familia, así como hacerla crecer y desarrollar. 
Rosa solicitó un crédito que le está ayudando a comprar mercancía de navidad como adornos, regalos y comida, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que buscan en esta época y así poder incrementar sus ventas y enfrentar el reto de crecer y convertir su tienda en un mini súper. 
En un futuro, a Rosa le gustaría poder construir otra tienda de abarrotes en una zona distinta y crear una cadena de tiendas de abarrotes propias.

loans.use: comprar mercancía de navidad como adornos, regalos y comida

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary A. is 38 years old. She lives in a semi-urban part of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married with six children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says that with a loan of $350, her business will be able to expand.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq has 6 years of experience in trade. He started receiving loans in July, 2005. He was one the first entrepreneurs in his town that received loans from MicroInvest and he has been advising the same to others since then. The loans he has been receiving were small in size because his business turnover is not very speedy. Sadiq is a handicapped person, but he has an active lifestyle.  He travels to Uzbekistan to buy the goods himself. His current business site is in open-air market and he would like to change it. Therefore he needs funds for new shelves and rent payment for the first three months.

loans.use: Change his business site

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Marco Antonio has had his house for more than 5 years. “Little by little, I have been improving the house where my mother and I live. We only have to finish the façade of the house and the fence, and then we will be more safe. There have been several robberies in the neighborhood. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to finish the façade and the fence.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Marco Antonio tiene su casa desde hace más de 5 año. Poco a poco le echo mejorar a la casa en ella vivimos mi mama y yo, solo nos ase faltar terminar la fachada y la barda y así estar mas seguros, ya que sean presentado barios robos en la colonia. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la terminación de la fachada y barda.

loans.use: To finish the facade of his house and and the fence around it

loans.name: Fabiola Verónica

texts.es:
Fabiola is a very quick-thinking and active woman. She is married and has two daughters who are 9 and 7 years old, and a young son who is only 8 months old. Two years ago Fabiola started her own business selling snow cones and, in winter, selling fried snacks and nachos in order to earn some extra income to improve her family’s quality of life. Thanks to an increase in profits, she now has a snow cone maker and a refrigerator, and, little by little, her business is growing.

To take advantage of the hot season, Fabiola wants to increase her production and cover her clients’ demands. For this reason she would like a loan of $250 which she will use to buy ingredients. She will repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Be a part of Fabiola’s achievements and help her to improve her business. Fabiola and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Fabiola es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, ella es casada y tiene dos hijas de 9 y 7 años de edad y un pequeño de sólo ocho meses de nacido. Para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, desde hace dos años Fabiola inició su propio negocio vendiendo raspados y en tiempo de frío incorporó la venta de frituras y nachos con lo que incrementó sus ventas. Ahora cuanta con una máquina para elaborar los raspados y un enfriador, poco a poco ha estado haciendo crecer su negocio.

Por aprovechar la temporada de calor, Fabiola quiere incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, para lo que está solicitando un crédito de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Fabiola y ayúdala a mejorar su negocio, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is an artisan who embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, blouses and she sells them in the Santo Domingo city market. She is 30 years old, has 5 children, and her husband grows and sells flowers in San Cristóbal City. She is part of the Liliz 3 group. With her loan she will buy thread, which is the primary material needed for embroidery, and she will also support her husband to purchase liquids and fertilizers that they need for their flower harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

JUANA es artesana borda servilletas, manteles, chales, blusas y los vende en el mercado de Santo Domingo de la ciudad. Ella tiene 30 años, cinco hijos, y su esposo se dedica a la Floricultura, lo cual vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Forma parte del grupo llamado Liliz 3. Con su préstamo comprara hilos ya que es la materia prima para el bordado y también apoyara a su esposo en la compra de líquidos y fertilizantes que se necesiten para la cosecha de flores.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery thread and flower harvest supplies

loans.name: Kurbonhol

texts.ru:
Kurbonhol S. is 65 years old, he is college educated and is an agronomist by profession. He is married, has 6 children and is currently receiving a pension. Kurbonhol owns a business that sells food. He has transformed part of his house into a store that is located in Beshkapa village in the Yavan region. The store is open 24 hours a day.

Kurbonhol plans to use his loan to increase his inventory and product selection. The loan will help the residents of the village and nearby areas to purchase necessary food items as the closest stores are several kilometers away, closer to the center of the region and close around 5pm. Kurbonhol plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Курбонхол, возраст – 65 года, образование высшее, по специальности – агроном, женат, имеет 6-х детей, в настоящий момент находится на пенсии. Курбонхол имеет торговую точку по продаже продуктов питания. Для этого он переделал часть одну часть своего дома под магазин, который находится в кишлаке Бешкаппа Яванского района. Магазин работает круглосутосчно. На полученный кредит клиент планирутет увеличить товарооборот, а увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Данный кредит поможет жителям этого кишлака и близлежащих районов приобретать необходимые им продукты питания, так как близлежащий магазин находится на рассточние нескольких километров, ближе к центру района, которые закрываютя около 17:00 вечера. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product inventory

loans.name: Antoine

texts.fr:
Mr. Antoine M. is 29 years old married and the father of 2 children. For the last 6 years, he has been the owner of a store that sells traditional colorful wrap around fabric in Adéta. He buys in bulk in Lomé and retails them in his store. For the last year his customer base has increased considerably because of the quality of his fabric (pagnes). To meet the demand, Mr. Antoine M. is requesting a loan to cope with his customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mr Antoine M. est agé de 29 ans marié et père de 2 enfants . Il est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de tissu imprimé à Adéta depuis 6 ans. Il s'approvisionne à Lomé en gros et revend en détail dans sa boutique. Depuis plus d'un an sa clientèle a considérablement augmenté à cause de la qualité de ses pagnes.Pour satisfaire la demande Mr Antoine M. sollicite le présent emprunt pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 60 pieces of traditional fabric in Lomé to be sold retail in Adéta

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar Y. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He owns and operates a small spare parts store in Beylagan. He started his business seven years ago. Ilgar needs a loan in the amount of $475 to buy more kinds of spare parts and to expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mr. K. Hong and his wife, Ngau Sokheng, have been married since 1984. They have three children; two sons and one daughter. One of their children is a construction worker and other two are students at the local school. Mr. Hong has been a taxi driver for two years and a farmer while his wife has grown flowers for resale since 1985.

Mr. Hong and his family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong and approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Both husband and wife hope that their business will support the family and allow their children to continue their education.

Mr. Hong is requesting his first loan in the amount of $300. He will use this money to purchase flower beds for his wife to increase her flower sales.

loans.use: To purchase additional flower beds for resale

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Mrs. Prok S., age 60, works with her retired husband making fishing nets and selling them for a profit. She also sells biscuits to generate extra income to cover some parts of her family’s financial cost. Mrs. Prok S. has six children. Five are single and one is married. One of her children sells make-up and beauty products and another one is a photographer. Some part of their income is added to the family income.

Mrs. Prok S. has requested for a loan to purchase more make-up and beauty products for her daughter to sell, so that she can satisfy her clients’ needs. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured, she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more make-up and beauty products for her daughter's business

loans.name: Noacha's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Noacha is 39 years old and is single woman with 3 children, ages16 and15 years old. Noacha is a soap seller, she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Moula, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena started the business to increase her family's income. She's a single mother with 2 daughters, 6 and 8, and she has to be at home for them. The only way to manage was to set up her own business. She started, 3 years ago, selling used clothing in the "tianguis" (traditional markets) and surrounding neighborhoods. She now rents a shop where she sells clothes and accessories for women. Thanks to her dedication and perserverance, she's managed to grow and increase her sales.

Lorena needs a US$500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to continue expanding the business so that she can increase her sales and, in turn, her income. With your help, Lorena and her children will be able to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares debido a que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 8 años de edad, debido a que necesitaba estar junto a ellas, la única forma para poder hacerlo era poner un negocio propio. Ella inicio hace 3 años con la venta de ropa usada, primero vendiendo en los tianguis y rancherías, actualmente renta un local en donde vendo ropa para dama y accesorios, gracias a su dedicación y constancia ha logrado crecer e incrementar sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para seguir ampliando el negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu ayuda Lorena y sus hijos podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa started her business when her husband lost his job and they entered into a difficult financial situation. Since Rosa wasn't working either, she and her husband couldn’t afford food for their two children. Two years ago Rosa started selling roasted chicken out of her home. Later she had a chance to start selling ceramics, which she has begun to do as well. Selling these ceramic items has been profitable for Rosa, so she would like to continue with this aspect of her business.

Rosa needs a $400 loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, to purchase additional ceramic items for sale. With your support Rosa will be able to continue building a better life.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Rosa inicio el negocio debido a que su esposo estaba desempleado, por lo que su situacion economica era muy dificil, ya que ella tampoco laboraba y no tenia ni para comprar alimento para su 2 hijos; por lo que hace dos años ella inicio vendiendo pollo asado en su casa, despues surgio la oportunidad D. vender articuL. D. ceramica. y decidio inicar con esto tambien, esta ultima actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos por lo que desea seguir llevandola a cabo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas articuL. D. ceramica y continuar con las ventas. Con tu apoyo Rosa seguira progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Mrs. Yung S., 37, sells perfume and similar goods and earns around $4 per day. She has been selling these kinds of goods for two years now. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and earns around $2 per day. They live with six children in Toul Vihear Village, Kampong Cham Province. The family is also supported by her two daughters, one of whom is a face decorator and the other a tailor.

Now S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more perfume to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase face decorating tools for her daughter’s business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more perfume to sell

loans.name: Mariam Kakooza’S Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been operating this business for the last 4 years. She works six days a week and operates a salon and beauty shop. She buys her merchandise twice a week from the Kampala city centre and uses public transport back to her shop. Mariam rents the shop where she operates her business and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her customers are women in her community and those on the move. She works on 3-4 customers daily. Her challenges include: high rental charges, transport costs, thieves who usually break into her shop, and flooding during the rainy season. The area where she is operating is prone to floods, and this destroys her merchandise.

She was inspired to join MCDT because it was dealing with the active poor. She caters to customers who were previously moving long distances looking for salons and cosmetics. She has been with MCDT for the last 3 years and is servicing her seventh loan. She has been able to improve her standards of living by getting three meals daily and also taking her children to good schools. Her main inspiration is owning a permanent commercial house where she will be operating and also seeing her business progressing.

Mariam is a leader of a 5-member group. She is 38 years old and married with 5 children. They are aged between 18 and 10 years, and they are all in school. Mariam owns a five-room house in which she lives with 7 people. She also takes care of two orphans of her late brother. There is no piped water, but she has electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area in the outskirts of Kampala.

loans.use: To invest in her inventory

loans.name: Phalsim

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalsim U. and her husband, Mr. Rithy Om, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have two daughters who study in local schools.

Mrs. Phalsim has been selling grocery items and vegetables for over ten years. She buys them from Prak Anchan market about five kilometers from her home for re-sale in her store in the village. We could not photograph her store because she had closed it for the day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Phalsim is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase more grocery items for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for re-sale at her store

loans.name: Georgina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Georgina inició su negocio con venta de refresco, pan y café, ha recibido capacitaciones en desarrollo empresarial y créditos de adim, lo que le ha permitido administrar bien el negocio  incrementando el inventario; en la actualidad cuenta con una pulpería siendo una de las más grandes del barrio. Georgina manifiesta que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, así se puede tener un nuevo crédito y progresar. En la próxima navidad quiere aprovechar las oportunidades ampliando su oferta con nuevos productos. Uno de sus mayores deseos es poder ampliar y mejorar su casa, para tal propósito pretende utilizar las ganancias del préstamo, esta ahorrando para que al final de año invertir en su casa
texts.en:
Georgina started her business selling refreshments, bread and coffee.She has received training in business development and administration which has helped her administrate her business, building her inventory; currently, she has one of the largest grocery stores in the neighborhood. Georgina says that to progress one needs to save and that's how one can obtain another credit and progress. Next Christmas she'd like to take advantage of opportunities by expanding her offerings to include new products. One of her greatest desires is to expand and improve her house. To this end, she hopes to use the income generated from the use of the loan. She is saving money now in order to invest it in house renovations at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Min Lay, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family house. Two children attend a local school, one son is employed full-time, and one daughter is a grocery seller.

Phal has been selling silk fabric since 1986. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village for resale in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in the business and also helps her daughter to buy grocery items for resale.

Phal is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka sells bags that she designs herself. She also sells materials for producing bags. Amaka is 23 years old and married with a child. She is a LAPO client. She is happy because the demand for her bags will increase during this festive season.

Amaka lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more materials to make bags to sell.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more bags to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saory Horn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of 12 people is located in Thlok Damnak Luong village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Saory H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.3 hectare plantation to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a poultry breeder who raises chickens. Since this business is goI. well, she wants to expand it, so she is askI. for a loan to buy more chickens for breedI.. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chicken food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. S. Chim, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Saory H. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term (EoT) loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The client with the EoT loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The EoT loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for breeding and chicken food to feed them.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 46-year-old man who is married, with six children. He and his family live in Twayte, in the Bekaa Valley. Ahmad has owned a mini-market since 2002, where he serves his small village. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to increase his inventory, and his income.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama F. est une jeune femme de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 5 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ce commerce lui est très florissant car elle fait des livraisons en gros et en détail. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle souhaite avec ce crédit mieux approvisionner sa boutique afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Ama F. is a young woman, 49 years of age, married, and the mother of four. She has been the owner of a grocery store for five years in Lomé, the Togolese capital. Business is booming for her because she makes deliveries wholesale and retail. To satisfy her customers better, she would like to use this loan to do better in supplying her shop, so as to avoid inventory shortages. This will enable her to earn more money to address family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Khursheed Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of N. A. and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband has been running a grocery shop in the community for the last 5 years. People come to his grocery shop to buy groceries. 

Khursheed baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory on monthly wage. The others are getting an education from a school located near her house. She is involved in a clothes sewing business. She charges $2 per dress and her customers are mostly her neighbors. She saves her income in a committee and wants to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store. 

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor repair workshop. Munawar sarwar baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Merijina

texts.en:
Merijina S. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Merijina is 38 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop to sell maize flour

loans.name: Numon

texts.ru: Нумон мужчина 43 лет , женат имеет пятерых детей. Работает таксистом на своём автомобиле. Его жена работает медсестрой в поликлинике. У Нумона два сына уже женаты , имеют отдельное хозяйство. Дочери учатся в ВУЗах. Нумон с утра до вечера работает на линии города Худжанда. Узнав, что в кредит можно отремонтировать свой автомобиль, он решил взять кредит в Микроинвесте
texts.en:
Numon is a 43 year old man. He is married and has five children. Numon works as a taxi drive using his own car. His wife works as a nurse at a clinic. Numon has two sons who are already married and have their own households. His daughters study in college. Numon works from morning to evening on Khujand’s route. After finding out that he could get a loan to repair his car he decided to take out a loan from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repairs

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Esteria has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 12 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Esteria is 42 years old, married, and has three children: ages 11, 17 and 14. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Grene, who has her own small business selling eggs in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Tuwe Wamoja Group

texts.en:
Asha has been a clothes and tea bag seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to Tuwe wamoja group loan (Group code 2067).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and tea bags for resale and improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  


Asha is 40 years old, married, and has given birth to seven children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zaituni, Zuhura, Mmanga and Blestina. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tea bags for resale

loans.name: Muong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Moung C. is a borrower who has been selected as group leader by the other members of this group loan. Moung C. is a 59 year old widow and mother of two children. One of her daughters helps to feed the family by working as a garment worker. Moung C. currently earns a living by growing both rice and vegetable crops in the village. Her clients come to buy her mature crop in bulk two months after planting and they then sell the produce in the market. Moung C. does not own a vehicle so she pays a lot in taxi fees. To reduce her transportation costs, she would like a Kiva loan to add to her personal savings to buy a used motor. The other two borrowers are:
Mrs. K., 27, a farmer, who is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for her husband’s business.
Mr. H., 29, a local farmer is requesting a loan to buy a cow to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To buy a used motor vehicle

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Like any other businessperson in their location, Merlyn Peranco's only wish is to make her business flourish so that she can pay all the expenses in their household. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming. She tills a hectare of farmland to produce abundant harvests. Aside from that, she also has pigs. She takes good care of her hogs to be able to earn a bigger profit. She is also starting to raise ducks.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. The loan will greatly help them increase their income. Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her livelihood for a very long time. CEVI gives her not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Abdul Razaq

texts.en:
This is Abdul Razaq, the son of M. A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 and married with five children. He is a carpenter. He has been working as a carpenter since 2000. He is a hard-working man and is busy doing work in his shop seven days a week. 

He needs to buy more wood and tools for his carpentry shop, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani. 
He would like to state that this effective process can support entrepreneurs a lot to start a business and sustain it as well.

loans.use: Purchasing tools and wood

loans.name: Mjimwema Group

texts.en:
Chrisentus Paulo, age 22, is single and lives with his sisters and their sons ages 16 and 12. He makes a living selling used clothes. He started this business in 2007, and works daily from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m., earning a monthly profit of around $113. Chrisentus has applied for his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and hopes to use it to buy more used items to sell.
 \t
Chrisentus will share this loan with his loan group,  Mjimwema, which has 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, we see Chrisentus in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy K. is aged 41-years-old, separated with his wife and helives alone. Sammy is in the business of manufacturing  liquid detergents and he has been in that business for the last four years. He mainly supplies the detergents to retail outlets at wholesale prices.

This loan marks Sammy's first borrowing from KADET and with it he intends to purchase ingredients and chemicals for the manufacture of both industrial and domestic detergents. He also intends to purchase packaging and labeling materials.

In future Sammy hopes to produce a top quality detergent that will position itself in the Kenyan market.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing  ingredients and chemicals for making detergents and the packaging and labeling materials for the detergents.

loans.name: Kitoboi #2 Group

texts.en:
Kitoboi #2 is a group of five borrowers, led by Molay Z., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Molay is 45 years old and married with three children, aged 8-23. Her middle child is in the 8th grade but the oldest didn’t get to attend school because of the war. Molay was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Molay lives in remote Kolahu City in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Molay’s business is dry goods, including Maggi cubes (a soup product), spices, matches, palm oil, etc., which she buys wholesale and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades. She has run her business for four years and is successful because her customers like her personality and her work ethic.

Molay’s dream is to grow her business so that she can one day have a bigger table in the market. With the profits from her business she dreams of raising her family well and sending her youngest children to school which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: To purchase spices, palm oil, and Maggi cubes to sell

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en:
Ancilla U. is 38 years old ,married with 6 children aged between 6 and 15 years old.
She lives in Rubavu District , west  province of Rwanda where she sells the fishes for  fives years. She starts her business everyday from 7h00 AM to 5h00 PM,and employs one person in her business.

Before this business she was a fermer where she could not get all needs for her family.
With this new loan she plans to purchase more fishes so that she gets more profit .
With extra profit ancille will be able  to save money,to get more food for her family, to pay school fees for her children and expand her business

loans.use: for purchasing more fishes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V. is a 52-year-old mother of five. All her children are now grown-ups; two are in college and two others attend high school. Her husband Marcelino, 48, works as a technician. They live in a small house in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Myrna owns a general store located in their house. She put this up five years ago. Just last year, she ventured into buying and selling cosmetic products and apparel thru the popular direct-selling schemes offered by prominent brands (Personal Collection, Avon, Sarah Lee, etc.) She earns at least P 4,500 a month from these combined business activities.

She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for a year now. Now on her 6th loan, she has applied for a loan worth P 8,000 with the cooperative to purchase more cosmetic products for her customers. She will also use portions of the funds to purchase additional stocks for her store.

Myrna has been saving a lot of her earnings. She is looking forward to having other businesses soon.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn L. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improve and expand her business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie E. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 29, married and has 5 children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which she will use to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 59 years-old and married with four adult children and two grandchildren. She runs Theresia Ladies Fashion where she makes and sells wedding dresses. She has been in business for 24 years and has two employees. She also earns some income through small-scale farming of maize and beans.

Theresia has successfully completed a previous loan for Kes. 80,000 and is requesting another loan for the same amount from Kiva partner Faulu to buy more material for wedding dresses. She hopes to generate more income so that she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric.

loans.name: Ify

texts.en: Ify sells drinks and Nigerian cooked foods like moi moi (steamed bean cake), eba (cassava dough), pepper soup and beans. She loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her cooking skills to yield her money. Ify is 30 years old, married with a child. She is determined to increase the financial strength of her family. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Gloria Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria Betty, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia y se encuentra casada con don Juan de profesión Graficador, con el que tiene 2 hijos, la señora tiene como actividad la venta de regalos en la casa de su papá con esta actividad ayuda con los gatos de la casa.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar mercaderia, papel selofan, papel de regalo, carton por temporada de fin de año ya que esta epoca mucha gente compra regalos y a la Sra Gloria tieme mucha venta esta epoca.
texts.en:
Gloria Betty is 36 years old and owns her own home. Her husband, Don Juan, is a professional illustrator. They have two children. Gloria works in her father’s home, selling gifts, which helps to pay their household expenses. This loan will help Gloria buy new merchandise, cellophane paper, wrapping paper and gift boxes. People buy a lot of gifts this time of year, so Gloria’s sales are quite high.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise and gift wrap

loans.name: Esvin

texts.es:
El señor Esvin N. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Esta solicitando un crédito para colocar una techo de concreto al frente de la casa ya que tiene nietos pequeños y quieren salir a jugar. 
Don Esvin trabaja para una compañía de gasolina en el departamento de despachador, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito. Ya que su hija la señorita Nancy N. se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso que obtiene como asesora de servicios de una compañía de autos. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señorita Nancy N., hija del señor Esvin, ya que el se encontraba en horario de trabaja cuando se realizo la visita.
texts.en:
Señor Esvin N. has already had four loans through FVP, all of which he has repaid punctually. He is requesting a loan to build a concrete roof out in front of the house, because he has small nephews who want to go out and play. Don Esvin works as a dispatcher for a gasoline company, he will use this income to repay his loan. His daughter, Nancy N., is also responsible for family expenses from her income as service consultant for an auto company. Nancy N., daughter of Señor Esvin, is the person who appears in the photo, since the visit was during his working hours.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing for the patio in front of the house

loans.name: Magadalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 40 years of age and married, with five children aged 5 - 18. All her children go to school. Magdalene lives in a rented two room house where she stays with seven people. She has three meals a day and takes care of additional family members. Her three greatest expenses each month are the electricity bills, the children school fees and rent for her residence and business premises.

Magdalene has a stall in Nalukolongo selling charcoal and raw food such as bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes. She mainly sells on a retail basis. Magdalene works seven days a week and serves about twenty-five customers a day. She has been in this for business for four years now. Her main challenge is that there are many stalls that sell the same products as hers.  She has been in her business for ten years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates for two years now. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta Lidia M. D. V. D. 64 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. DesD. hace algunos años atrás ella quedó viuda, viviendo en la actualidad en casa propia junto a dos hijos mayores D. edad, una nieta y su nuera. La señora Marta, se dedica a la venta D. cremas para el cuerpo y rostro, negocio con el cual logra percibir ganancias las cuales le proveen D. todo lo necesario para seguir adelante.
