Cada día Marta ofrece sus productos D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Soyapango, con la esperanza D. poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le beneficien. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar cremas para cuerpo, y rostro, así mismo invertir en nueva mercadería como perfumes para hombre y mujeres. A pesar D. su edad, Marta es una mujer muy trabajadora quien debe esforzarse a diario por sus sustento, a pesar D. largas jornadas D. trabajo a las cuales se enfrenta cada día.
texts.en:
Marta Lidia M. D. V., 64, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department. She was widowed several years ago and currently lives in her own house that she shares with two adult children, a grand-daughter and her daughter-in-law. Marta sells body and face creams, the profits from which proviD. all she needs to continue forward. Marta offers her products by wandering the streets of Soyapango hoping to earn the highest profits possible in order to benefit from them. She is asking for funding to buy body and face creams as well as some new products, like perfumes for men and women. Despite her age, Marta is a hard-working woman who realizes that she must struggle every day to support herself notwithstanding the long work days she faces daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skin creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair products and additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Adetola

texts.en:
Adetola, age 47, is married with five children and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to help their husbands support the family.

Adetola has operated a restaurant for 25 years. She sells drinks and food in other to make a profit and earn a good living. With the profit from her business, she has been able to save a little money and to assist her husband in running the affairs of the home. Her husband is a civil servant who, like his wife, is working hard to meet the family's financial needs. 

Adetola hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and more cooking ingredients to use in the restaurant. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000, primarily to purchase more drinks to sell. She promises to repay back her loan by its due date. She sends her thanks to Kiva and LAPO Microfinance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell at her restaurant

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
A person, who has just started his business, has to know that what he/she is undertaking requires at least as much attention as a person who is trying to build a house with playing cards. Any move, breath, or an awkward gesture can tumble the house. However, provided that needed care, patience and labor is given, the output is a lot more valuable than just a house made of cards. Saltanat T., 29, is the leader of this group. She is unemployed as she has to stay at home with the children. Her husband is a new entrepreneur. He buys sheep in a mountain region, brings them to town, and sells them at the cattle market. He used to do another job, but because of health problems had to get a leave without pay. On one hand he is happy as he has started his business earlier than he thought. If he were to have got this leave later, the opportunities would not be as abundant as this time. Saltanat has applied for this loan to help her husband buy five sheep, bring them to town, and resell them.   

Saltanat’s partners are:

Ainakan A., 49, is a wife of a private builder. Ainakan trades in fish and her monthly income is $240. She hopes to obtain this loan and buy tools for her husband and purchase fish for sale. 

Kubanychbek S., 33, has two children. His wife trades in cell phone cards. Kubanychbek provides for his family by working as an operator at a gas station. He also works as a taxi driver and at weekends he trades in sheep at the cattle market. Kubanychbek needs a loan to buy sheep.

Begayim A., 29, is a mother of two children. Her spouse is a general worker. Begayim is a cook in a kindergarten. She has applied for this loan to buy a car so that her husband could work as a taxi driver.

Kylychbek C., 31, has a son. His wife works as a school teacher. He earns his family’s living by working as a builder. He needs a loan to buy tools for his work.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy five sheep in order to resell them later.

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en: Enhtaivan is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Purevdulam, is 7 years old and attends a local primary school. His 1-year-old daughter, Serjmyadag, attends a local kindergarten and has not reached school age yet. Currently Enhtaivan operates a souvenirs and religious articles trading business with his wife near the tourist spot “Frog Rock” in his province. The province he operates the business in is one of the largest tourist attractions in Mongolia. They started their business in 2006, and have been successfully operating it since then. Enhtaivan has been planning to expand and stabilize his business in the future. He has been working hard with his wife to provide a better life for their family. Enhtaivan is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of souvenirs and religious articles in Ereen, a Chinese border town to resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rama Shahi

texts.en:
Rama Shahi T. is a grocery shopkeeper in Sainbu-Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery store five years ago, to upgrade her family's standard of living. She sells different types of groceries in her store. She is proud to help her husband fulfill the needs of the family. She sells a variety of groceries, such as rice, maize, noodles, and biscuits, in her shop. Now she is requesting a 25,000 NPR loan to buy different kinds of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. Rama Shahi T. lives in a single-family house with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in a private office. Her older son is a house painter, and her younger son is in grade 12.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Los Ideales Group

texts.es:
Yanet Hernández Vázquez, ella cuenta con  25 años de edad, curso la carrera de Leyes  por cuatro años en la universidad GUABJO; en el estado de Oaxaca.
 Vive  en la comunidad de San Felipe Jalapa de Díaz, es madre soltera de su pequeña hija Kimberly, vive en casa de sus padres, su madre ama de casa y su padre dedicado al campo al igual que sus 3 hermanos; dos de ellos trabajan y uno sigue estudiando. La  casa donde vive es pequeña.  
 Debido a la escasez de recursos con la que se cuenta en esa comunidad sus padres no pudieron seguir ayudándola con sus estudios, así que no logro titularse. Pero busco una forma de conseguir sus propios ingresos. Y es así como decidió poner su negocio.
El grupo fue formado por doña Carmen  que cuenta con un restaurante en la comunidad de los ideales, es así como Yanet al igual que los otros 9 integrantes pudieron ingresar y formar el grupo , que estará empezando su primer ciclo. 
El grupo fue denominado LOS IDEALES, la palabra que muy a parte de ser denominado asi su lugar de residencia, significa para ellos metas, objetivos, perseguir sueños que un día gracias al esfuerzo de cada uno y al apoyo de instituciones de prestamos lograran ver cumplidos.
Yanet solicito el préstamo para invertir en un negocio que ya tenia desde hace varios meses y que junto con su hermano han mantenido hasta ahora. Ella no cuenta con un local establecido, pero su negocio se concentra en el interior de su vivienda.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de 100 crías de pollitos, considerando que hasta ahora cuenta con 50 pollos listos para su venta.  También invertirá en la compra de alimento para hacer crecer a los animales  lo que pronto será su fuente de ingreso, incluso tendrá más recurso para seguir creciendo. 
Pero ella aparte de criar y vender pollos cuenta con dos actividades mas, que demuestran el verdadero interés de esta joven por ser mejor cada día.
Ella hace aretes, pulseras y collares de piedras y frijoles  de colores. Los vende de casa en casa con las amistades y conocidas de la comunidad, ella se surte cada mes de este material para la elaboración de los mismos en el estado de Oaxaca, con lo que gana se ayuda para invertir en cualquiera de sus negocios.
Ella cuenta también con una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de su casa en una comunidad llamada Piedra de Amolar, aunque su negocio es pequeño siempre trata de tenerlo surtido ya que es una de las pocas tiendas con  las que cuentan los habitantes.
Ella desea tener su propio hogar en donde pueda crecer su hija, darle una comodidad aparte de lo que para ella es esencial el estudio con lo cual pueda sentirse orgullosa de ver fructífero sus esfuerzos y que mejor viéndolo en el desarrollo intelectual de su familia. Así mismo seguir manteniendo como hasta ahora sus pequeños negocios y hacerlos crecer. 
El grupo esta conformado por  7 mujeres y 3 hombres :
La Sra. María del carmen que invertirá en mobiliario nuevo para acondicionar su restaurante, la Sra. Kicsia Irais que utilizara el préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de antojitos, la Sra. Jazmín que comprara mas pares de zapatos, para vender con las amistades. La señora Cecilia que utilizara el préstamo para comprar mas cerdos y así criarlos para después revenderlos en las carnicerías, el joven Otilio que comprara pollos para su crianza y posteriormente su venta. La señora Reyna que comprara telas e hilos para realizar su oficio de costurera. La señora Nallely que iniciara su negocio con la venta de abarrotes la cual con el préstamo a otorgar surtirá su tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, el señor Moisés que comprara telas, hilos y manta para seguir bordando sus prendas artesanales, el señor Rogelio que surtirá su tienda de arroz, frijol, azúcar, galletas y artículos de limpieza.
A todos esto ellos agradecen saber que ahí gente como FUNDACION REALIDAD y junto con ellos otras instituciones  que puedan ayudar a la gente necesitada y ver como ellos también pueden crecer, y así mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Yanet Hernández Vázquez, 25, pursued a law degree for four years in UABJO University, in the state of Oaxaca. She lives San Felipe Jalapa de Díaz in her parents’ small house. She is a single mom of one daughter, Kimberly. Her mother is a housewife and her father works in farming, along with Yanet’s three brothers. Because of the scarcity of resources in the community, her parents could not continue supporting her in her studies, so she never earned her degree. For this reason, she decided to look for a way to earn money, and started her business. Carmen, who has a restaurant in the community of Los Ideales, formed the group. Yanet and the other nine members joined her in forming the group, which is now beginning its first loan cycle. The group is named Los Ideales which, aside from being the name of the community, signifies for them, goals, objectives, and following dreams that one day, thanks to the efforts of each member and the help of loan institutions, will be fulfilled. Yanet needed this loan to invest in a business that she has run for a few months with her brother. She does not have an established location, but works from her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of 100 young chicks, as she now has 50 that are ready for sale. She will also buy feed for the chicks and have a little left over to continue growing. Aside from the raising and selling of chicks, Yanet has two other business activities, which demonstrates her entrepreneurial spirit. She makes earrings, bracelets, and necklaces from stones and colored beans. She sells these from house to house among her friends and acquaintances in the community. She stocks up on materials for the jewelry each month in the state of Oaxaca, and she re-invests her earnings back into one of her businesses. Yanet also has a small grocery store located 15 minutes from her home in the community of Piedra de Amolar. Although this business is small, she tries to keep it stocked, as it is one of the few stores available for the residents of this town. Yanet would like to have her own house in which to raise her daughter and give her a place to study, something she considers essential. She also wants to continue maintaining and enlarging her small businesses. The Los Ideales group is made up of seven women and three men. María del Carmen will invest in new furniture for her restaurant. Kicsia Irais will use her loan money to buy ingredients for the making of snacks. Jazmín will buy shoes to sell. Cecilia will buy young pigs to raise and resell to butcher shops. Otilio will buy young chicks to raise and resell. Reyna will buy cloth for her tailoring business. Nallely will use the loan to stock her general store. Moisés will buy cloth, and thread for making aprons. Rogelio will stock his general store with rice, beans, sugar, cookies, and cleaning products. All the members are grateful to know that organizations like Fundacion Realidad are there to help them grow and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry making supplies and stock for general store

loans.name: Mariana Marlene

texts.es:
Mariana de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, tiene un hijo que le ayuda en ocasiones. Por la falta de oportunidades ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres para vender a sus vecinos. 

Poco a poco fue readecuando su casa y convirtiendo la sala en un local para su tienda. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene un tienda con arroz, granos, bebidas etc. En ocasiones su hijo le ayuda cuando termina de hacer los deberes. 

Para tener mas variedad en su negocio quiere comprar arroz, aceite y bebidas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana is 36, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil and has a son that helps her occasionally. Due to a lack of opportunities she had to invest her savings in goods to sell to her neighbors. Little by little she re-purposed her home and converted her living room into a store. That good decision means she now has a store with rice, grains, beverages etc. Occasionally her son will help when he is done with his duties. She wants to buy rice, oil and beverages with the loan to offer a greater variety in her store. In the future she wants to continue her business and finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil and beverages

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech S. is a 54 year-old widow farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province.  She is blessed with five children, three are married and the others are single. Pech's daughter appears on the left of the photo.  They work together as farmers.  They are able to plant crops at least twice a year.  The coming rainfall is good for growing, but Pech needs a loan to plant seeds and to tend to a crop.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de  su pareja Betty (36), y 2 de sus 3 hijos, pues el mayor trabaja de manera independiente.Este trabajador hombre se dedica al cultivo de papa, olluco y avena (pastizal), desde hace 20 años, también trabaja brindando servicio público a bordo de su auto ,que cubre una ruta de su ciudad, mientras su esposa administra su tienda de venta de comestibles, y él también atiende este negocio durante los días que descansa. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar su producción de papa porque la traslada directamente a los mercados de la ciudad, y le pagan mucho mas, ya que los tubérculos que siembra son de calidad y de diferentes variedades. Sus producciones son muy solicitadas en los mercados de la capital, por eso considera que sus labor es muy rentable, por lo que este año se proyecta en sembrar todas sus chacras de papa de una nueva variedad, asimismo, quiere instalar una graja de ovinos, aprovechando que ya tiene varias cabezas de carnero, para venderlos al por mayor.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y esta muy satisfecho de trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo  comunal, pues ya los conoce y sabe que son puntuales y responsables con el pago de sus cuotas.Moisés tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  tres carneros que sacrificara para vender la carne en su negocio, y también comprará productos comestibles para abastecer su tienda que administra con su esposa.
texts.en:
Moisés is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Betty, 36, and two of his three children, as the third lives on his own. Moisés is a hardworking farmer who has been growing potatoes and oats for over 20 years. He also uses his car as a taxi providing transportation throughout the city while his wife works in their grocery shop. On his days off Moisés helps in the shop. His favorite thing about his work is harvesting the potatoes because he brings them directly to the markets in the city. His crops bring a good price because he grows popular varieties using high-quality seeds. His crops are very sought-after in the markets, and so his work is very profitable. Because of this, this year he plans to plant a new variety of potatoes as well as to construct a pen for sheep to raise and sell wholesale, as he already raises cattle. This is his second loan from MFP, and he is very satisfied with the work of the members of his communal bank. He already knows them well and trusts that they are responsible and punctual with repayments of their loans. Moisés will invest this loan in the purchase of three rams to butcher and sell their meat in his shop. He will also buy merchandise to stock the shop he runs with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rams and merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools to speed up his work (repairing air conditioners)

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia  S. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Tuguis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a General store and a Rice Retailing business. 

Delia  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her 23 past loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 24th loan, she is again borrowing PHP 29,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general (sari-sari) store and rice retailing businesses so that she can continue to save up for their future.  The profit she will earn will be part of her savings.  Delia  S. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Urnuhbileg

texts.en: Urnuhbileg G.  is 32 years old and lives with her big family in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her family enjoys a comfortable lifestyle and they all are in good health. Her elder two children attend a local middle school, the middle son goes to a kindergarten, the youngest one is too little and stays at home under the care of her mother. Her husband works as a security guard for a local security company. She and her family has lived in the province for 6 years. Urnuhbileg operates a taxi service in her area. Since starting in 2008, she has made much progress with her business which has improved her family's life. She is optimistic about her future and hopes to work with her husband to expand her transportation business to an adjoining province. Urnuhbileg is an open-minded and kind woman who remains optimistic about achieving her goals. She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a motor, tires, and other parts for her transport car.

loans.use: To purchase a motor, tires and other car parts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Elsa ; tiene 42 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos y la socia es artesana y ella lleva todos sus trabajos a Urubamba para venderlos allá, La socia sale de su pueblo para buscar mejor postores para su trabajo, ella es una mujer que siempre sale adelante pese a las pocas oportunidades que el país da a los artesanos y a la situación económica baja que ella tiene sigue prestándose  para poder comprar materiales y continuar con su trabajo y así crecer poco a poco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y realizar su arte y finalmente viajar a Urubamba a llevar sus tejidos para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Elsa is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is an artisan and she brings all of her pieces of work to Urubamba to sell. She leaves her town in search of better bidders for her pieces of work. Elsa is a woman that always gets ahead, despite the few opportunities that the country has for artisans and the poor economic situation. As a result, she has to continue borrowing to be able to purchase materials and continue with her work to have her business grow, little by little. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make her handicrafts and go to Urubamba after to bring her weavings to sell.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Apu Katunki Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KATUNKI ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Nohemi, ella tiene 26 años D. edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a trabajar en artesanía en piedra, la socia venD. en las diferentes ferias artesanales sus productos, ella venD. al por mayor, lo que quiere decir que venD. como mayorista; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. artesanía en piedra.

Los otros socios trabajan en construcción civil, venta D. golosinas, venta D. chicha, venta D. verduras, venta D. productos D. abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nohemi is a member of the Apu Katunki communal bank, located in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Nohemi is 26 years old and is a single mother with a son. She works selling stone handicrafts in the different artisanal markets. She sells wholesale, meaning that she sells as a wholesaler. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of stone handicrafts.

The other group members work in civil construction, candy sales, chicha sales, vegetable sales, and grocery sales.

The group members are grateful for and value the loan provided and they promise to make their payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase stones and quartz (handicrafts).

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo, nos cuenta que le gusta el Banco por la seriedad tanto de las socias que son responsables y de parte de la institución que siempre cumple con ellas. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 16 años que están estudiando en colegio. Su esposo es chofer de un tráiler.

Tiene un negocio de venta de tarjetas y cabinas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00, dice que le va bien ya que por allí cerca no hay otro negocio como el suyo además también vende colas y helados Pingüino. En la actualidad quiere comprar unas computadoras para también poner un negocio de internet.

Es para esto que solicito este crédito para ayudarse a comprar dos computadores para iniciar este nuevo negocio.

Sus metas son salir adelante en su nuevo negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, members of the Salud y Vida (Health and Life) Community Bank meet every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Maria is a founding member of the Community Bank and works as the treasurer there. She tells us that she likes the bank because of the seriousness both of the members, who are very responsible, and of the institution, which always serves them. She is 42 years old, married and has two children, a 15 and 16 year old, who are studying in high school. Her husband drives a tractor trailer. 

She has a business selling phone cards and phone calls. She works everyday from 8am until 8pm and says that the business is going well because there is no other business like hers in the nearby area. She also sells soda and Penguin ice creams. She would like to buy computers in order to start an internet cafe. That is why she is requesting a loan, in order to buy two computers to start this new business. 

Her goals are to succeed in her new business and that her sons have professional careers.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Como Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Como las Águilas está conformado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Flora de María de 50 años la cual desde hace años ha trabajado de todo un poco actualmente se dedica a la realización de nacatamales y la venta de leña negocios en los que invertirá el crédito. Ella es madre y padre para sus hijos de los cuales tiene dos menores de 14 y 11 años quienes estudian.

Las otras integrantes de grupo son Yadira, Claudia María, Mercedes y María Cecilia. Sabala se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años y sueña con tener un establecimiento ya que trabaja de manera ambulante;  Gómez tiene un taller donde se especializa en la realización cuadros y su meta es aumentarle al taller,  P. de 50 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y riega ropa en zona franca las mercedes desde hace 8 años, y O. de 32 años vende delantales y  hueso y enchiladas las fines de semana desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The group “Como Las Águilas” (Like The Eagles) consists of five hardworking women.  One of them is Flora de María, age 50, who has worked for many years in all different areas.  She currently makes Nicaraguan tamales and sells firewood.  Flora wants to invest the loan in her businesses.  She assumes the roles of both mother and father to her two young children, ages 14 and 11, who are in school.

The members of the group are Yadir, Claudia María, Mercedes, and María Cecilia.  Yadira has been selling clothing and cosmetics for two years and dreams of opening her own establishment since she works as a street vendor.  Claudia has a shop that specializes in making paintings.  Her goal is to expand her business.  Mercedes, age 50, has been butchering pigs and selling clothing in the free trade zone for eight years.  María, age 32, has been selling aprons, seeds, and enchiladas on the weekends for the past four years.

loans.use: Purchase pork, corn, onions, peppers, tomatoes, cumin, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jose Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Sr.  José  vive la zona de Villa Obrajes ,es una casa donde el  y su familia  viven como cuidadores  ya que los dueños vienen solo  cada dos veces al mes , tiene una niña que esta en la escuela es su mejor inspiración y fuerza para trabajar por su familia , el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de la línea de minibuses  de sacaba, trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia , el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una radio de frecuencia para taxi , tiene un auto donde lo hará trabajar con un chofer , su sueño de don José es juntar dinero para la compra de un terreno y así tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
José lives in the Villa Obrajes zone in a house where he and his family live as caretakers since the owners only come twice a month.  He has a small daughter in school and who is his best inspiration and strength to work for his family.

José is very well known in his work in transportation in the Sacaba minibus line.  He works from Monday through Saturday spending Sundays with his family.

The loan will be used to buy a short wave radio for a taxi because he has a car that he will put into service with a driver.  José’s dream is to save enough Money to buy a lot in order to have his own house.

loans.use: To buy a short wave radio for a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more banana, oranges, plantain, eddoes, etc.

loans.name: Tiwae Ole

texts.en:
Tiwae Ole N. is 56 years old. He is married to Kinyeketa N. and he is a father of three children. 

Tiwae is a farmer and he has been doing farming on his own piece of land for the last four years.
  
He learned about KADET from a member of a group within his locality that is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to prepare 15 acres for wheat planting in the next planting season. Wheat normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and be able to buy his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To prepare 15 acres of land for wheat planting in the next season

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en: Cerenia M. is from the village of San Isidro, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Cerenia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Cerenia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods. Cerenia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Cerenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cerenia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and biscuits. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Cerenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and biscuits

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 38 años, convive con Johana, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jomira, de 13 y Mayela, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, actividad que lo ejercía desde que tenia 18 años; donde siembra papa, arveja y maíz; los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de Tarma, pero según afirma en épocas de campaña agrícola, los mismos comerciantes visitan la localidad de Huasahuasi, para negociar su producción. Lo que más le gusta a Manuel, es abonar sus cultivos, para que le proporcionen buenos frutos, ya que en tiempos de lluvia necesitan mayores cuidados. Ahora él desea invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas, ya dio el primer paso, comprando un pequeño terreno paralelo a de su casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y espera obtener buenos logros con el trabajo que está realizando en su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito está pensando invertir en la compra de 8 kilos de semillas de arvejas, que oscila entre los 30 soles cada una, y con el resto del dinero comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old.  He lives with his partner Johana who is 36.  They have 2 children: 13 year-old Jomira and 8 year-old Mayela.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Every morning, at an early hour, Manuel heads out to care for his crops.  He has been in this business since he was 18 years old.  He grows potatoes, peas and corn which he then harvests and sells in Tarma central market.  However, he says that during the farming season, salespeople visit the area of Huasahuasi to negotiate for his crops.  What Manuel enjoys most is spreading manure on his crops so that they grow well since, during rainy periods, they require more care.

Manuel would like to invest in buying more farmland.  He has already taken the first step, buying a small plot of land parallel to his home.  This is his fourth loan with MFP and he hopes to obtain good results through the work that he is carrying out as a member of his community bank.  He is planning to invest this loan in buying 8 kilos of pea seeds which cost around 30 Peruvian soles each and he will use the rest of the money to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy 8 kilos of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen B. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Aileen joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell (e.g. canned goods and junk foods)

loans.name: Fernando Efraín

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada labora el señor P. desde hace cinco años en una empresa en el que con el sudor de su frente se gana su salario que es con el que le da el pan de cada día a sus cuatro hijos quienes están en edad escolar y esposa. 
En estos momentos este señor tiene una gran necesidad la cual es la de realizar mejoras en su vivienda, por tal razón ahora se  acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar dichas mejoras y de esta forma satisfacer la necesidad que tiene.
Con este que está haciendo el tiene la certeza que le estaría mejorando su nivel de vida a su familia ya que le brindaría todas las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se sientan bien.
texts.en: Over the last five years Mr P. has worked for a company in the municipality of Granada. Thanks to his hard work he earns his living and feeds his four children, all of school age, and his wife. At the moment he really needs to make some home improvements. That´s why he went to the CEPRODEL offices in order to apply for a loan to carry out said improvements and meet his needs. He is convinced that this will provide his family with a better standard of living and the necessary conditions to make them feel comfortable.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Catherine Wambui

texts.en:
Catherine, age 49, has been farming and keeping poultry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 25 years. She and her husband, Mwaura Kimani, have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy iron sheets and timber to build a house for keeping poultry.

In future, Catherine hopes to increase both her farming and poultry-rearing efforts to large-scale concerns, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and timber to build a house for keeping poultry

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita P. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Alnao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Violita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, spices, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Violita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca R. is from the village of Kinuman Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca raises crops, primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang D., age 25, owns a small shop located along the street in her village, in Kompong Thom province. She sells soft drinks, food, sweets, cooking ingredients, and other goods. She typically makes around US $2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Her husband, Mr. Van D., is a primary teacher in the community. They have two school-aged children, both of whom are attending school. 

In addition to her sales business, Leang D. cultivates potatoes on her own farm as an annual crop. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house as well as to use as capital to grow more potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house as well as to use as capital to grow more potato crops

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex G. is 49 years old. He lives in the village of Ikalto, Telavi District. Alex is married and lives with his wife Mzia, their parents, their 22-year-old son and their daughter-in-law. Alex works as a taxi driver in Telavi. Also, he helps Mzia to manage their  second-hand clothes shop. Their shop is popular in the village as they always provide a variety of good clothes to the villagers. The profit from the shop amounts to 800 Laris per month.

With the requested credit Alex and Mzia will increase the stock in trade in their shop. New stock will insure that the shop will have a sufficient number of customers and a constant flow of income. The profit will be reinvested in further expansion of the shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan, es agricultor, vive acompañado de su esposa y tres hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio y lo hace todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, pero sobre todo cuando está sembrando.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de abono, tratamiento de plagas y otros que son necesarios para realizar el cultivo, esta compra le ayudara a contar con los insumos necesarios e ir preparando la tierra con tiempo.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha de maíz y frijol, con esta producción ayudar a su familia para salir adelante con ellos.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer and lives with his wife and three children who are 16, 14 and 12 years old. They live in San Rafael Oriente in the region of San Miguel. He has worked in this business for 20 years and he works every day from 6:00 am until 3:00 pm, especially when planting. He currently needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and other chemicals for his crops. This will help him have enough fertilizer and keep on schedule when preparing his land.

His goal is to have a good corn and bean harvest and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Roselyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling biscuits, junk foods and chocolate milk drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages.

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is 39 years of age and married with five children. Malama is a fruit and vegetable farmer. She has one year of experience in this business. Malama needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Malama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Malama's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is 34 years old and married with five children. She has been running a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines for the past two years as well as selling fish.

Vangie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

Vangie works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like milk, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Ivan trabaja  como empleado en la empresa QUALITY. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (ladrillo, estuco, pintura) ya que hará la refacción de una habitación Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Plan Autopista  de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Ivan works for the company QUALITY. 

He is seeking a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, stucco, and paint so that he can make alterations to a room in his parents’ home where he lives. The house is located in Plan Autopista in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children. This is Ivan’s second loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, stucco, and paint to renovate a room in his parents' house

loans.name: Árbol Group

texts.es:
El grupo el árbol lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Lidia Marina de 48 años quien desde 1981 inicio con una tortillería, luego empezó a realizar tamales, fritanga los fines de semana y postres. Ella con el crédito comprara un quintal de maíz, arroz, aceite, carne…etc. todo por mayor.
Las otras integrantes son Margot del Carmen de 60 años quien vende hace 20 años tiste, pozol, pan, huevo…etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo Margot de 60 años se dedica al comercio de tiste, pozol, pan, huevo…etc. y Eugenia del Carmen de 20 años vende tiste, pozol y pan casero que trae de Mandaime.
texts.en:
The "El Árbol" ("The Tree") group consists of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Lidia Marina, 48 years old, who started with a tortilla shop in 1981.  Then she began to make tamales and desserts and to run a restaurant on the weekends.  She will use the loan to purchase a hundred pounds of corn, as well as rice, oil, meat, etc., all wholesale.

The other members are Margot del Carmen, 60 years old, who for 20 years has sold tiste and pozol (traditional Nicaraguan drinks), bread, eggs, etc, and Eugenia del Carmen, 20 years old, who sells tiste, pozol, and homemade bread that she brings from Mandaime.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agnetta is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a butterflies-hunting business, selling to foreigners visiting the coastal region. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, during hot dry season the availability of butterflies is lower compared to demand. She dreams of supplying as wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase equipment for hunting butterflies for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for hunting butterflies for sale.

loans.name: Glenna Flor

texts.en: Glenna Flor is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. Glenna Flor has a food shop that sells viands like caldereta and pancit bihon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking the viands she sells. Glenna Flor is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Glenna Flor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands to sell

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 54 years old and supports a family of five members. Her children are 30, 25, 15 and 10 years old.  She raises livestock on her farm and has been in operation for a period of 15 years, earning a monthly income of KSHS 8,000.

She has been given a loan from KADET LTD of KSHS 15,000. This is her third loan after servicing the previous loan successfully.  She wishes to use this money to purchase livestock feed as well as dairy meal.  

The profits that she will get from the sale of milk will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Walter desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.   También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa teniendo otro para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimento para engordar a sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, al igual que su producto y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Walter es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a su familia y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
26-year-old Walter lives with his wife and children in his own home which doesn't have basic services.  The house is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its livestock raising, farming and handicrafts.

Walter has been raising and selling sheep for several years.  His pen is located a few minutes from his home and it is spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and pasture so that they reach an ideal level of growth and he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area, making very good profits with which to cover his personal expenses.  He also owns farmland where he grows lemons.  He harvests and sells the lemons which makes him another income for his household.

Walter has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to buy feed with which to fatten his animals and fertilizers with which to improve his land and his crops.  This will enable him to sell them to his customers at a better price.  He will use the income that he makes to repay his loan and improve his quality of life.  Walter is very committed to his work.  The only thing he wants is to be able to provide his family with some comforts and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals and fertilizers to improve his land

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a clothes materials business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other cloth sellers in the area. Omar dreams of establishing a stall to sell clothes for resale.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36 years old and married with 2 children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is 51 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a farmer in her native home in Kitale, Western Kenya, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables to the local market.  She relies on farming for her family needs.

Unice has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partners Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.  This boost in her business will provide for better living standards for her family. She says there is high demand for poultry birds and eggs and is optimistic that the returns will be great.

Unice is glad that Juhudi Kilimo is promising to pay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 30 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y alegre, vive en compañía de su pareja Olga y de su hijo de dos años, en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Pedro, es la crianza de pollo, para lo cual se asoció con su primo hace tres meses, donde cada uno da una cierta aportación; su primo puso el galpón y el terreno donde se criarán los pollos  y Pedro el capital para comprar los alimentos y los pollos, de esta manera empezó el negocio familiar, pero en sus ratos libres de dedica dar servicio de transporte con un mototaxi que posee. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar los gastos de su hogar, además se siente a gusto de contar con un familiar para este negocio, sin embargo debe dedicarle mucho tiempo para poder aumentar su producción. Este sería el tercer crédito con MFP, considera a los miembros de su grupo comunal ser personas tranquilas, esperando que sigan siendo puntuales en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado podrá invertirlo en la compra de materiales para implementar su galpón, comprando bebederos, mangueras, asimismo invertirá en dar mantenimiento mécanico a su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Pedro, 30, is a hardworking, enterprising, cheerful man living with his spouse, Olga, and their two-year-old son in their own house.  Pedro raises chickens having partnered with his cousin three months ago to do so.  Each of them contributes his own share.  His cousin put up the shed and the land they raise the chickens in and Pedro put up the capital to buy feed and chicks.  This is how the family business got started.  In his free time he also provides transportation services with a mototaxi he has.  What he likes about his work is being able to have income to cover household expenses and he also feels good about being in business with a family member.  However, he must put a lot of time into it in order to increase production.

This would be the 3rd MFP loan.  He considers the members of his communal bank to be very levelheaded and he hopes they will continue to be punctual with their payments.  He will use the requested amount to buy supplies to equip the shed.  He will buy drinking troughs and hoses and will also service his mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy water troughs, hoses and to take his mototaxi in for servicing.

loans.name: Damaris De Los Angeles

texts.es: Damaris está estudiando para ser contadora, está a muy pocos pasos de culminar su carrera, el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. La culminación de sus estudios ha sido una meta muy grande para ella, ya que en el pasado por falta de recursos económicos se tuvo que retirar, y con mucho esfuerzo por parte de ella y sus padres, pudo regresara a la universidad. Espera en un futuro poder tener su propio negocio, crear una empresa con los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Damaris is studying to be an accountant; she’s very close to finishing her studies.  The requested loan is to pay for her final course.  To complete her studies has been a very big goal of hers because due to lack of economic resources she had to drop out and thanks to much effort on her and her parents’ part she was able to return to the university.  She hopes in future to have her own business and to create a firm with the knowledge she’s acquired.

loans.use: to pay for her courses.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Antonieta has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings & vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables.

Antonieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Antonieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation services to his passengers. With the loan investment, he will pay the remaining installments on his rickshaw. This will make the rickshaw his own property and he will be able to run it more freely and increase his profits.

He is a very good driver and also provides pick-up and drop-off services to different school children. Parents of school children trust his driving and offer him good money for that purpose.

Nasreen is a seamstress and works for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and never compromises on quality. Her principal of not compromising on quality helps her in attracting more customers toward her.

She is the mother of five children; two of them are studying while the others are young and haven’t started their education. She is very hopeful that her step of receiving a loan from Asasah will have a good impact on her husband’s business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments on the rickshaw.

loans.name: Copala Group

texts.es:
Marlene cuenta con 33 años de edad es soltera es doctora, pero también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes ella vive con su madre,  una de la otra se ayudan para sacar adelante el negocio ya madre e hija son muy trabajadoras y le gustaría hacer el negocio, ella ahora con su préstamo lo invertirá para comprar productos de abarrotes como son: agua mineral, aceite, huevo, leche, productos lácteos, refrescos, etc. a Marlene le gustaría ampliar el local para poner más cosas en su tienda llamada  “miscelánea cayita” ya que pusieron el nombre de cayita por su abuelita, ella está muy contenta y espera hacer muchas cosas con la ayuda de su préstamo.

Marlene pertenece a un grupo llamado cópala cuyo está integrado por 10 integrantes todas son mujeres a continuación serán mencionadas: Alicia, Martha, Eduarda, María de los Ángeles, Julia, Rubísela, Celerina, María Lucas, Celerina, que se encuentran trabajando con su préstamo con actividades comerciales como son: venta de cosméticos, accesorios, productos de abarrotes, frutas, perfumees, quesos, comida, sabanas, edredones, etc.
texts.en:
Marlene, 33, is single and has a good education.  She is applying for a loan to stock her retail grocery business.  She lives with her mother and the two of them, mother and daughter, work hard to grow the business and support their small household.  Marlene will use this loan to buy merchandise--mineral water, cooking oil, eggs, dairy products, soft drinks, etc.--that she will resell.  She would like to expand the store which she named Cayita Miscelanea, Cayita being the name of her grandmother.  She is pleased with her progress so far and hopes with your help to do even more.  

Marlene belongs to the Copala Cuyo community bank.  The group has 10 members, all women--Alicia, Martha, Eduarda, Maria de los Angeles, Julia, Rubisela, Celerina, Maria Lucas, Celerina and, of course, Marlene--who operate a range of businesses selling cosmetics, accessories, groceries, fruits, perfumes, cheeses, food, sheets, comforters, etc.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old, a married woman with two children. One of them is in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Alice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon (pictured above) is a widow. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. Thon has been selling porridge and Khmer noodles in her village. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok are considered the national dish of Cambodia that can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. In addition, Thon also raises a cow and grows rice when the rice farming season comes. She is asking for another loan of $800 to assist with her rice farming by buying seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farming.

loans.name: Lorijun

texts.en:
Lorijun is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Lorijun has a souvenir shop that sells souvenirs made from sea shells. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

Lorijun is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lorijun hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

loans.name: Thomas Musumba

texts.en:
Thomas is a trader and was born in Emachinga Village in Matungu district. he is married with children. Thomas  has been involved in Business for five years, he wants to own a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community, Thomas is to be linked with CHW working in Bungoma and will  support the community health worker by providing transport on set days, this will give the needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during  counseling appointments and health visitation. Thomas hopes to encourage and recruit other members of his group to join in supporting community health outreach programme in his community.

Thomas  will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family and expand his business. Thomas hopes to to support more youth CHW volunteers in his community by encouraging them to save money and join in a group to buy motorcycles for CHW work and Livelihood support.

loans.use: To pay for Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Karangura Farmers Associations Group

texts.en:
Annet is a very active young member of Karanmgura Farmers Group where members guarantee each other for loans and stay in the same localities. She has a total of three children and one is of school going age. 

Annet operates a drug shop selling human drugs and supplements her income by farming. She started this business in 2010 to support her family and wishes to grow this into a pharmacy. Annet is asking for a loan to buy drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 30-year-old smallholder livestock farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya. She is married and has five children (the youngest that she bears on her back on the picture is only 12 months old). 

Nancy started farming 15 years ago. Her main capital was the six-acre land that belongs to her family. On the land today, she has two dairy cows, 10 head of poultry and over 150 trees. She is seeking a loan to buy a brood of hens which will give her eggs, chicks and meat to sell. 

Income generated from this investment will be used by her to help her husband provide for the family's basic needs and school fees for the children. Her end goal is to elevate the quality of life that members of her family are living.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, de 25 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción secretariado, está casado, su esposo trabaja como albañil, tienen un hijo de tres años de edad y viven en casa familiar.

Ana, es empleada en una empresa de telefonía desde hace dos años, decidió buscar trabajo debido a la situación económica y para obtener ingresos mensuales, su lugar de trabajo está a diez minutos de su casa.
 
Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar frutas para vender en bolsas, porque su mamá vende estos productos y de esta manera ayuda con los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de Ana, es seguir trabajando para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y ayudarle a sus padres en lo que pueda.

loans.use: para comprar frutas para vender en bolsas.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 55 years married with four children. She has been in LAPO for 4 years and is also a member of the LAPO group in Benin City. She trades in drinks. She hopes to expand her business if loaned the money.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and a deep freeze

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is a 70-year old widow with eleven children.  She had always relied on the income of her husband, but when he died, she was left with only three cows and no savings.  Kalameli then decided to join SPBD, and she used the loan funds to start up a small grocery shop in her village.  The launch of the store has been successful, and Kalameli, who had never before made her own money, can now support herself and provide for the basic necessities of many members of her family.  Kalameli recognizes the value of her business and  wants to continue to reinvest in it.  She is seeking an additional loan in order to expand the product line that she is able to offer her local customers.

loans.use: Expand her shop activities

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
Mr. Negmat R. began his business by selling pasta at a counter in Pakhtakor. He has been in business for 6 years. Over the 6 years, Mr. R. gained a great number of clients. Today, in addition to selling pasta, he began to offer beverages, canned food, etc. His business is doing great. Mr. R. is married and has 3 children. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to open a new retail spot in the center of his town.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджаабов Негмат начинал свой бизнес с продажи макаронов, в одной из прилавок находящейся в Пахтакоре. В бизнесе 6 лет. За эти 6 лет у него появилось очень много своих клиентов. Раджабов Негмат продает не только макароны, но и перешел на продажу напитков, консервированных изделий и т.д. Его бизнес процветает. Раджабов Негмат женат, имеет 3 детей. Он просит 1200$ на открытие новой точки в центре города.

loans.use: To open a new retail spot

loans.name: Sunso

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunso A. is 38 years old and lives with her family in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer and earns $2 a day. Both she and her husband also buy and sell recyclable products.

They would like to purchase this loan in order to buy seeds to grow their own food, and also to buy more recyclable products for their business. In the future, they hope to expand this business and send their children to University.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and recyclable products

loans.name: Rosa Heraclia

texts.es:
The bravery that Rosa has demonstrated when faced with failures has helped her overcome them gracefully. To successfully fulfill the basic needs of her family in all the activities that they do, she opened a small store in her house two years ago. She had to sacrifice the development of the store because of her constant health problems caused by a uterine fibroma. Not long after finding out about the fibroma, she had to undergo surgery in a local clinic in order to save her life. Rosa is mother to 4 children and now only the youngest, who is 13 years old, is in her care. For this reason she wants to continue to strive. At present she is in better physical and financial condition and she has been able to find work lending small amounts of money to her neighbors, which allows her to buy certain necessities to support her family. Nonetheless, she longs to once again open her little store in order to lend her services and satisfy the needs of the general public. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $350, which will be the first step in her effort to see her dream succeed. We support a woman who can overcome any obstacle with bravery. With your help you will be able to do that, too.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La valentía que demostró ante los fracasos le ha servido a Rosa para salir siempre airosa de cada una de ellas y a poder satisfacer exitosamente las necesidades primarias de su familia con cada una de las actividades que ha desempeñado, hace dos años abrió una pequeña tienda en su casa y tuvo que sacrificar su desarrollo por sus constantes problemas de salud debido a un fibroma en el útero, a poco tiempo de sucedido este hecho tuvo que ser operada en una clínica de su localidad para salvar su vida. Ella es madre de 4 hijos y ahora sólo la menor de trece años se encuentra en su poder, razón por la que aún desea continuar esforzándose. Actualmente se encuentra mejor física y económicamente y ha podido encontrar una muy buena ocupación realizando préstamos pequeñísimos a sus vecinos que le permiten obtener ciertas utilidades para sostener a su familia; sin embargo anhela abrir una vez más su pequeña tienda para prestar sus servicios y satisfacer las necesidades del público en general. A razón de este hecho solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que se convertirá en el primer escalón de progreso para continuar con este deseo. Apoyemos a una mujer que con valentía vence cualquier obstáculo. Con tu colaboración podrás hacerlo.

loans.use: To create a small grocery store in her home

loans.name: Sangali

texts.ru:
Sangali F., 47, is married and has 4 children. Sangali has been engaged in cattle farming for 3 years. He lives in the village Muramshokhi, Yavansky region. Cattle farming is Sangali’s main source of income. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 animals, raise and sell them with a profit. Most of Sangali’s customers are butchers, who come to his village to purchase cattle at a lower price. Sangali F. plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзов Сангали, возраст – 47 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сангали занимается разведением и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Живёт в кишлаке Мирамшохи Яванского района. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота. Так как основной доход получаемый им это доход от продажи скота, он планирует на полученный кредит приобрести несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и после его откорма продавать его через каждые 40-45 дней. Большая часть его покупателей эти мясники которые приезжают из города для закупа скота по более низким ценам и дальнейшей его реализации в качестве мясных и молочных продуктов жителям городской черты не имеющим место для содержания скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of cattle

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. C. has had her business, which she runs from her home, for 8 years. This business allows her to obtain supplementary income, thus permitting her to help her husband and provide for her family. Her family is made up of four members—one is a dependent child.

This is the second loan she has requested. She used the first one for the business, and she is requesting this loan in order to buy the products that are most popular during this season. This investment will allow her to generate more income, and she would not lose the opportunity to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora C. tiene siete años de tener su negocio, la ubicación de este es en su hogar, lo que le permite obtener otros ingresos para ayudar a su esposo y no descuidar a su familia. Su grupo familiar lo componen cuatro personas una depende directamente de la solicitante.

Este es el segundo crédito que maneja con integral el primero lo utilizo para negocio y esta solicitando este para surtir con algunos productos que se venden mas en esta temporada esta inversión le generaría mas ingresos y no perdería la oportunidad de prestar un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, grains, dairy products, meat, sausages, and apparel

location.town: Col.san Carlos 2 poligono 34 numero 3 Ciudad Arce

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the group, Cesar Vallejo, loacted in the Bolognesi 125 street, in the Calleria district, in the state of Ucayali. She is 52 years old, and has 3 kids, all of whom are adults. She is married and her husband is an independent merchant. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of $300 she decided to invest in fizzy drinks.

Now she sells candy from home, and she also has a car which helps her to gain more income. She gets up at 6am to do house work and also to sells her drinks.

With the loan of $3000, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will buy candy and drinks, and she will invest in the upkeep of her car.

Maria is very happy as her business is growing more and more and her kids are very grateful for the sacrifices that she has made for them. She is also happy that she has had good times and made many friends with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora María pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en pasaje Bolognesi 125, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes. Es casada y su esposo es un comerciante independiente. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decidió invertir en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en su casa, además cuenta con un motocarro que le genera un ingreso adicional. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para realizar las labores del hogar y simultáneamente atiende a sus clientes en la venta de gaseosas. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará golosinas, gaseosas y otra parte de capital lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro (activo) María se siente muy feliz y contenta porque el negocio crece más y más y sus hijos están muy agradecidos por todo el sacrificio que hizo por ellos y además siente que con Manuela Ramos ha encontrado muchas alegrías y amigas.

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks and candy / Compra de golosinas y gaseosas. Mantenimiento del activo

loans.name: Fathi
