texts.en: Fathi lives with his wife and six children in the southern Lebanese town of Saida. Fathi is 47 years old and runs a small wood-carving business. This is the fifth time Fathi has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and he plans to use this new loan to improve the productivity of his shop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a small wood-carving business

loans.name: Joao Francisco

texts.pt:
Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: João Francisco C. Actividade: Habitação Mantante:15.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: João Francisco C. Actividade: Habitação Mantante:15.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 João Francisco C. was born in the Province Majacaze, Gaza, in 1978. He is the seventh of 9 siblings. He is attending his second year at the Tutoring University in Maputo. He lived with his parents up until 1999 when he moved in with his brother in Boane for 5 years. In 2000, he started working at the Umpala's Junior High School as a teacher. In that same year he got married and had two children - the eldest is now 7 years old. Currently he works at the Primary School in the district of Boane. He has worked with other credit institutionsin the past, such as Tchurma and Procredito. He stoped working with those companies because he realized that HLUVUKU's services were better, their interest rate was lower and it was located closer to his residence. He found out about HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends and co-workers. He was awarded a loan in the amount of 12,000.00 MT for housing purposes, which was repaid without any problems. He intends to use the loan amount of 15,000.00 MT to continue the construction project, more specifically to purchase cement and sand to build walls. In the future, he plans to seek more credit so that he can continue to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

João Francisco C. nasceu em Majacaze Província de Gaza em 1978. Tem 9 irmãos sendo ele o sétimo filho. Esta a estudar ate então na Universidade Pedagógica em Maputo frequentando o segundo ano de licenciatura. Viveu na responsabilidade dos pais ate 1999 altura em que veio viver com o irmão em Boane durante 5 anos . Em 2000 começou a trabalhar na Escola Primaria de Umpala como professor. No mesmo ano juntou se maritalmente tendo gerado 2 filhos sendo o mais velho com 7 anos de idade. Actualmente trabalha na Escola Primaria na sede do Distrito de Boane. Já trabalhou com algumas instituiçoes de credito como Tchuma e Procredito. Deixou de trabalhar com os mesmos porque viu que os serviços HLUVUKU são melhores e que a taxa de juros é baixa, também porque esta mas próximo da sua residência. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças aos vizinhos e colegas de serviço. Já teve o primeiro credito no valor de 12.000,00 MT para Habitação, tendo reembolsado sem grandes dificuldades. Com emprestimo de 15.000,00MT pretende dar continuidade com os trabalhos da obra, concretamente compra de cimento e areia para rebocos das paredes. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para dar continuidade com os trabalhos de melhoramento da sua obra.

loans.use: To buy materials to build families house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child. Grace owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Jesus Martin

texts.es:
Martín learned the bricklaying trade as a child thanks to his father. Now he is 21 years old and wishes to become independent and work for himself in order to obtain greater income and support his family with their expenses.

He needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy materials and his own set of tools for work in order to be able to offer his services. Let’s help Martín build his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Martín desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de albañilería gracias a las enseñanzas de su papa, pero ahora que ya tienen 21 años, el desea independizarse y dedicarse a este oficio por si solo, para así poder obtener mejores ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos familiares.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materiales y sus propias herramientas de trabajo, para así poder ofrecer su servicio. Ayudemos a Martin a construir su negocio.

loans.use: Buy tools for work

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is married, and her husband is a contracted security guard but does not make much income. They have two small children, one in preschool, the other in primary school, and given that there were a lot of expenses and little to pay it with from her husband Maria decided to start her business to generate extra income. Little by little she was able to set up a convenience store, and the business has given the economic stability it needed.

Now Maria is requesting a loan of $975, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase merchandise for her store. With your help, Maria can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Maria es casada su esposo trabaja en seguridad publica, por lo que no percibe muchos ingresos, ella tiene 2 niños pequeños que cursan pre-escolar y primaria, dado que eran muchos los gastos y muy pocos los ingresos de su esposo ella decidio emprender un negocio que le genrara ingresos extras, por lo que poco a poco fue poniendo una tienda de abarrotes, este negocio le esta dando la estabilidad economica que su familia necesitaba, ya que el trabajo de su esposo es por contratos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Maria hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Zaituni C., 33 is married, and has one child, aged 16. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2006, Zaituni established her bread making (Bakery) business. She opens her business six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day. Zaituni requires a loan in order to buy flower and cooking oil in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to then, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy flower and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Witnes's Eden Group

texts.en:
Witnes is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has been a banana and maize seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

Witnes now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas and maize for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Anastazia , who has a business dealing with grocery ownership.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and maize for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 48 years old and she is a widow with 3 children aged between 28 and 15 years old. She has been a food and vegetable seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to improve her business by adding more food items and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding more food items and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Sayu Ketut Meling

texts.id: Sayu Ketut Meling disamping seorang ibu rumah tangga juga memiliki kesibukan memelihara 1 induk babi yang saat ini sedang mengandung. Sayu Ketut Meling tergabung dengan program ternak babi selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pinjaman pada akhir periode. Modal yang didapat dari DINARI Rp.5.000.000,- dipakai untuk membeli 1 induk lagi dan modal pakan persiapan anak  babinya yang akan lahir. Dengan perawatan dan juga ketelatenannya sekarang babinya sudah hampir melahirkan dan memerlukan pakan yang banyak. Sayu Ketut Meling juga rajin memberikan daun hijau seperti daun pisang sebagai makanan selingan. 1 bulan lagi induk babi ini akan melahirkan. Anak babi yang lahir akan dijual. Biasanya induk babinya melahirkan 8 – 12 ekor anak babi. Sayu  Ketut Meling sudah berhitung, jika induk babinya melahirkan 10 ekor anak. 3 bulan pemeliharaan, 1 ekor anak babi harganya Rp. 450.000 X 10 = Rp. 4.500.000.- Biaya pakan selama 3 bulan Rp. 3.000.000,-. Keuntungan bersihnya Rp.1.500.000,-. Dengan memiliki 2 induk, Sayu Ketut Meling yakin usahanya akan sukses sehingga kehidupannya bisa sejahtera dan bisa mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.
texts.en:
Besides being a home maker, Sayu also currently is involve in the pig farming program. With the Rp. 2.000.000 capital provided, she intend to buy another pig and make another pig sty for piglets. Currently her pig is pregnant and Sayu feeds her extra food during this period. In a months time the pig will produce 8-12 piglets which will be sold in the market. From her calculation she reckons that if her pig produce 10 piglets, each piglet can be sold for Rp. 450.000 X 10 = Rp. 4.500.000. Feeds for 3 months Rp. 3.000.000, her net income will be Rp.1.500.000. With 2 pigs, Sayu is sure that she will be successful and will be able to pay back the loan on time.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli induk babi dan pakan

loans.name: Elmin

texts.en: This young man lives in the Khachmaz region in Dadali village. He is married and has one child. Elmin was born in 1981. He has run a taxi business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat G. is 29 years old, married, and the father of three children.  Shavkat resides in Shahristan, Tajikistan.  He cultivates vegetables such as: potatoes, onions and carrots, which he resells after harvesting them.  Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this opportunity from Kiva to increase the size of his business in terms of more significant production, allowing for a better return.  The profits derived from his business will enable him to take on part of his household needs. Shavkat and his family sincerely thank you for you support and encouragement.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav is married and has two children. He rents a store and sells various construction supplies that are used to build and fix houses. His large assortment, good prices and good location bring more and more clients to his store. Miroslav has been in this business for six years. He knows what is in demand and offers his clients what they need.

Miroslav is a very optimistic person and believes that his business can grow even more. His goal is to purchase the store so that he can save money on rent. Moreover, one of his children (his one-year-old daughter) has an eye problem and the family needs money for the surgery and following treatment.

Miroslav would like to receive a loan of 7,000 UAH (USD$900) to purchase more inventory. At this time the prices for construction supplies are low and he can make very good deals and receive more profit.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his construction supply store.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.ru: Мирзоев Наби житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 58 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. По профессии водитель. Но занимается бизнесом. Торгует коврами  из Ирана. Кредит планирует использовать в течение 9 месяцев. Опыт в бизнесе уже 33 года. Дело приносит неплохой доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nabi M. lives in Gissar region. He is 58 years old and is married with two children. He is a driver by training but he makes a living by selling Persian carpets. He has 33 years of business experience. His business is quite profitable, and Nabi plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is a rice grower. She saves some of her harvest for family consumption and sells the rest to some of the rice traders in their village. Farming is her life. Her parents taught her to plant and harvest. Because of her farm, she was able to send her four children to school. She was also able to provide adequately for their needs. Her husband, Jurlito S., is also a farmer. They work together to raise all their children. They have big dreams for their family. Hard work and capital are their only means.

Fe is asking CEVI for a loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her farm. Through her loan, she will be able to increase her yield. When that happens, she will have more to give to her children. She also is considering looking into some other possible income areas. The loan will help a lot to start another line of business.

CEVI helps Fe to start a new business and expand her farm. CEVI provides her with the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maribel B. se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora el cual se dedica a su negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario abre las puertas de su casa para atender sus pulpería y así llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por la que ella ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos y por este motivo es que muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel para salir adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribel B. has distinguished herself for being a hard working person who is dedicated to her small store in the city of Chinandega. She opens the doors of her house daily to service her small store and provide for her home. The reason she has requested the loan from Ceprodel is because she needs to purchase some products. She trusts that Ceprodel will help her be successful in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’Avédji, elle exerce depuis 1998 le commerce de miel, elle est dans son quartier la seule à vendre du miel, ce monopole lui permet  de réaliser d’important bénéfices, parfois même les habitants des quartiers voisins se déplacent pour acheter chez elle. Son stock actuel de miel ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES et elle demande son deuxième crédit pour acheter 30 bidons de miel. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas d’enfant.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Avédji district and since 1998, she has been selling honey. In her district she is the only one who sells honey, and this monopoly allows her to make a good profit. Sometimes, people who live in neighboring districts take the trouble to come to buy her honey. Her present stock of honey does not allow her to respond to the needs of her clientele. She has already had one loan from WAGES and she is now asking for her second to buy 30 containers of honey. She is married but has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of honey

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is managing a small piggery. She started her business three years ago using her small savings to buy two piglets. Now she has her piggery, which helps her pay all the bills at home. Her business is truly a help in buying the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will truly help Myrna expand her business. Aside from feed, she will also buy additional piglets.


CEVI is reaching out to hog growers like Myrna to sustain and grow their business. They provide easy access to CEVI credit, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed and more piglets

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for three women living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, led by Mrs. A., 30, who, along with her husband, owns a shop next to their house where they sell ferrous metal tools to earn a living. They have four single children, all students. To increase the business's capital in order to meet customer demand, Mrs. A. is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner HKL, the money to be used to purchase more ferrous metal to store and later re-sell.

The other two borrowers are: Mrs. Chhob R., a domestic building worker seeking a loan to buy a motorbike for family's riding needs; Mrs. Un R., who sells dried sausage in the market and is requesting a loan to buy additional sausage to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more ferrous metal.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Mrs. Shirley O., 50 years of age, is the mother of twelve children with eight of them still her dependents and students.

She buys fish of different kinds from various fishermen and she dries all the fish and sells it in the market. Her economic activity is the one that feeds all her children and sends them to school. She deeply wishes that her business will flourish and hopes to continually support her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase the materials for a fishing boat

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is engaged in a food-vending business. She is 53 years old and is married to Benjamin B.. They live happily with their two children in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Neither of them were able to graduate in high school but they wanted their children to finish their studies in college so that they will have a better future someday. The couple helps each other to earn income and support the studies of their children.

Their main source of income is farming which is being managed by her husband very well to harvest a good yield. Lucrecia also manages a food vending business that is situated in front of their house. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to improve her business. She enjoys operating her business and does not get discouraged, even when things are difficult. She believes that having strength and passion in her work is one of the great factors to become successful someday.

loans.use: To uses as business capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is 35 years old, married with eight children, and presently resides at Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Marites has been a member of Paglaum MPC since October 2008, and she admitted that, with the help of PMPC Microfinance Program, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She is now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 intended to buy vitamins and feed for the hogs. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph W. is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He has been a charcoal wholesaler for the last ten years. He serves both wholesale and retail traders and his customers are mainly from within Kiambaa Shopping Center. Besides that, he is also involved with dairy and poultry farming.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend. This is his 3rd loan from KADET. He intends to buy a motorcycle to run a taxi business. In addition to that, he hopes to open a big charcoal store.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to run a taxi business.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Keita est âgée de 42 ans, mariée  et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari au quartier Bougoufié de Ségou dans une grande famille traditionnelle (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en  classe de 8ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour aider sa mère à faire les activités de petit commerce d’articles divers, habits, draps de lit, la fabrication des jus de fruits, condiments alimentaires  etc. Forte des années d’expériences passées auprès de sa mère, à son mariage, Oumou opta de perpétuer  la même activité de commerce de divers dont elle a une parfaite maîtrise. 
Le besoin de renforcer ses activités et d’augmenter ses bénéfices l’a amené à faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle collabore depuis 42 mois, après avoir correctement remboursés 5 prêts solidaires et un  prêt individuel.
 Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour  acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes brodés et légers, 20 draps de lit, 10 douzaines de parfums, 1sac de sucre, 1/2 sac de gingembre, 1panier de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée et des essences pour le jus. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso pour les habits (tissus brodés et de légers) et les draps, sur place pour les produits et ingrédients des jus locaux. Elle vend ses articles à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers de la ville, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et aussi d’enfants.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est d’augmenter le volume de son activité et d’ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou Keita, 42, is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband in the Bougoufié district of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) in a big traditional family.

She left off her schooling in the basic school (8th grade in the Malian educational system) to help her mother sell various items: clothing, bed sheets, home-made fruit juices, condiments, etc. Having learned a great deal from working with her mother, Oumou decided to continue in this same business that she is very good at, after her marriage.

Needing to expand her businesses and increase her profit led her to turn to Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 42 months. She has correctly reimbursed 5 solidarity loans and one individual loan.

She intends to use this new loan to buy 10 lengths of lightweight, embroidered “pagne” (cloth traditionally used for clothing and head wraps in West Africa), 20 bed sheets, 10 dozen bottles of perfume, 1 sack of sugar, ½ sack of ginger, 1 basket of dried hibiscus flowers, and flavoring for juice. She buys her cloth and sheets in Burkino Faso and the ingredients for juice locally. She sells her goods out of her home and on foot in the neighborhoods, for cash and credit, to a clientele composed of men, women, and also children.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which will be used to grow her business capital and cover certain family expenses.

Her ambition is to expand her business and to open a shop where she can sell garments.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Nevi

texts.en:
Nevi is a member of the Juhudi,borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 12,06,02 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Nevi started her own clothing business selling clothes 4 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Nevi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Nevi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata D.  N° 2 est âgée de 37 ans,  célibataire  et  mère d’un enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant  au  quartier ATTBOUGOU de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Commis de l’administration publique, elle est secrétaire de direction dans un service publique. Parallèlement à ses obligations professionnelles, elle mène des activités commerciales avec la vente de l’encens et des habits depuis 14 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété. Ses clients, innombrables sont composés majoritairement de fonctionnaires. Elle reçoit de la commande venant de l’intérieur du pays et de l’extérieur. Elle est sollicitée lors des mariages car sa marchandise est très prisée par les nouveaux mariés.
Le  processus de préparation de cette matière si douce et si sensationnelle est la suivante : il faut 2 kg de  magnonkisèni (plante exotique) assaisonnée de parfums et eaux de Cologne (30 bouteilles)  pendant un mois afin d’avoir une bonne senteur. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle  est en relation  depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement bien remboursés, elle  est à son 2ème  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 10 kg de graine d’encens (magnonkisèni), et 5 complets de bazins moins riches et des habits confectionnés en wax à l’approche des fêtes. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur place au grand marché de Ségou et  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes pour l’encens, de femmes et d’hommes pour les habits. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui servira à se prendre en charge et investir le reste dans ses activités.
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage afin de la mettre en  location.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D. N° 2 is 37 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child, with whom she lives in the ATTBOUGOU district of Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A representative of the administration, she is a personal assistant of the management in a public agency. Concurrent with her professional obligations, she has been running a business selling incenses and clothing for fourteen years and enjoys great recognition. Her countless customers are composed mostly of civil servants. She receives orders both domestic and foreign. She is in demand for marriages because her merchandise is highly prized by newlyweds. Here is the process of making this exquisite and sensational product: you need 2 kg of magnonkisèni (an exotic plant) seasoned with perfumes and eaux de cologne (30 bottles) for a month in order to have a nice scent. Concerned about increasing her sales and about coping with customer demands, Fatoumata turned towards Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with this micro-finance institution for 36 months. After four solidarity loans and an individual loan, all properly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. As the holidays approach, she intends to use the loan to buy 10 kg of incense seeds (magnonkisèni), five outfits made of ’less-rich’ damask, and some clothing made of ‘wax’ cloth. She stocks up locally at the big market of Ségou and accepts cash or credit in her sales to customers, who are composed exclusively of women for the incense. And for the clothing, they are both women and men. Fatoumata plans on realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be use to support herself, and the rest will be invested in her businesses. Her ambition is to build a house for renting out.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Renea

texts.en:
Renea V. is a 34 year-old married woman with 3 young children. Her youngest child is only 5 months old and the oldest is just 9. She is married to John V. and the family lives in the village of Purok Paraiso, Brgy. Abuanan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Renea aspires to help her husband increase their family income enough to sustain the needs of her children and provide for their future security.

Renea is always looking for opportunities to provide her family with an additional source of income. First, she started a business selling a variety of native delicacies at the local school. As her small business prospered, she needed more capital to meet her customer's demands. This made her decide to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, which provided access to more capital for her business expansion. By her 3rd loan cycle, she already had some savings and was able to open a general store where she sells ready-to-wear clothes. 

The new ventures were quite successful from the start and her husband encouraged her to put her skills into other possibilities. He suggested that they buy a sow so that they could start raising pigs in their backyard. This turned out to be a wise decision.

For her previous loan, she borrowed PHP 15,000 to invest in her various business ventures, including hog-raising. She was able to repay her loan on time without any delays in the weekly installments. Now that she is borrowing her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she intends to borrow PHP 16,000 so that she can buy another sow and expand her general store,  which is adjacent to her house.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additonal stocks for general store and to buy another sow

loans.name: Petty Trader Group

texts.en:
Petty Trader Group is a group of five borrowers led by James K., 59 years old. He is married with five children aged 21 to 31 years old with educational levels of 9th grade through university graduate. He also cares for an orphan. James is a 3rd grade drop-out who could not continue high school due to poverty. He and his family live in Mamba Point but work in the Ralay Town market which happens to be the biggest food market in southern Monrovia, Liberia.

James’ business is construction supplies. He buys construction supplies wholesale like nails, locks, screws, etc., and sells to residents of downtown Monrovia. He has been running this business for thirty years and started with funds generated from savings when he was employed. He left his job in 1968 to go into business.

James talks to his customers in a good manner so as to maintain them and encourage new buyers to continue buying from him. He plans to become an international businessman in the future.

James needs this loan in order to buy more goods for his business. He dreams of making himself and his family successful and of improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his business

loans.name: Felicino

texts.en:
Felicino S., 58 years old, is still managing and tilling small rice field a short distance away from their village. Farming is his best skill. The farm is what he hopes could help him supply his family with the food, clothes and other basic things that they need. Now, he is constantly attempting to surpass the size of his previous harvest.

He needs additional capital for his business. Receiving a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. will be of great help, especially since he doesn’t have the money to support his business anymore. The loan will not just help him sustain his livelihood but will give him an increased income as well.

loans.use: financing his farm

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem S., age 32, is married and has three school-aged children. She resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is employed seasonally to harvest vegetables for other farmers, earning an income of approximately US $4 per day. 

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. Her husband is a dedicated farmer who grows different types of beans and salad vegetables, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand her agriculture business.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 38 years old. She is a wife and mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells clothes, linen and fabrics. Sandra is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality and large quantity merchandise to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics, linen and clothes in bulk. It is her greatest desire to expand her shop and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Yrma Alvina

texts.es:
La señora  YRMA ALVINA R. R. tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito del PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 5to. de  secundaria, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno depende económicamente de ella.
Yrma se dedica a  la crianza de pollos, gallinas y cuyes en su casa para posteriormente venderlos en el mercado o realizar polladas (venta de pollo).
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró alimentos para los pollos y gallinas.
Con este crédito de 400.00 nuevos soles comprará alimento para los patos, gallinas y cuyes como: engorde, panca, alimento balanceado y alfalfa y también comprará pollos bebes para su crianza.
Yrma sueña con tener su tienda de comestible en su casa.
texts.en:
YRMA ALVINA R. R. is 50 years old and lives in PORVENIR, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad – Perú. She studied through the 5th year of secondary school, and has 3 children who depend on her financially. Yrma dedicates herself to raising chickens and guinea pigs at her home, to later sell at the market or to make chicken dishes. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles she bought feed for her chickens. With this loan of 400 soles, she will buy feed for her ducks, chickens and guinea pigs such as: panca, balanced feed, and alfalfa. She will also buy baby chicks to raise. Yrma dreams of having her food store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her ducks, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be used for the purchase of clothing for children and women, home furnishings, inflammable pools, and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Maïmounatou

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Bassila dans le Nord du Bénin, L. Maïmounatou s’est installée depuis environs 20 ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capital économique du Bénin. Maïmounatou est mariée à ALASSANE Ganiou, un commerçant, et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Seulement trois des enfants reste encore à la charge de Maïmounatou et de son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Maïmounatou n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Maïmounatou a commencé la vente d’igname pilé (repas local apprécié des béninois), du riz et du haricot à Abattoir. Maïmounatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Il y a près de 5 ans que Maïmounatou a commencé par mener cette activité. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Maïmounatou sollicite un sixième crédit pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire tous ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Bassila (northern Benin), Ms. L. Maïmounatou got situated about twenty years ago in the Dandji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. ALASSANE Ganiou, a merchant, and is the mother of five children who are all in school. Only three of the children are still in her care and her husband's. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Maïmounatou attended school primary school only. To help out her husband, she started selling pounded yams (a local meal appreciated by the people of Benin), rice, and beans, in Abattoir. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She started operating this business five years ago. She is a previous client of ALIDé having already benefited from five loans from this micro-finance institution. She has repaid all the loans. Facing the more and more numerous demands of her customers, Maïmounatou is requesting a sixth loan for bolstering her business and satisfying all her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of yams and rice

loans.name: Woly

texts.fr: Madame Woly F. est une commerçante âgée de 41 ans. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle compte une bonne expérience (20 ans)  dans son métier qu’elle a embrassé pour subvenir à ses besoins.  Cependant, comme elle est membre d’U-IMCEC Bambey, elle vient solliciter un financement de 100 000 FCFA pour les besoins de son commerce. Elle compte acheter des produits hivernaux  c’est-à-dire du mil, arachide, niébés, oseilles (bissap) et pain de singe.  Ainsi avec ce commerce, elle tient le seul moyen de disposer d’argent dans la campagne et de pouvoir honorer ses cotisations familiales et sociales.
texts.en:
Ms. Woly F., aged 41, is a merchant who is married and the mother of three children.  She has good experience (20 years) in her trade, which she has embraced in order to provide for herself.  However, since she is a member of U-IMCEC Bambey, she is here to requesting financing in the amount of 100,000 francs CFA for her business needs.  She intends to buy wintertime goods, that is, millet, peanuts, black-eyed peas, dried hibiscus flowers (bissap), and 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree).  And so, with this business, she possesses the sole means for having money in the countryside and being able to keep her family and societal commitments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya J. is a 61-year-old lady who lives with her husband in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Her family lives in a ger, a Mongolian housing tent on the plot of land they own. Her husband, Batsuh, is a driver. Marusya has been running a small bakery shop since 2005. She bakes a variety of cakes, cookies and bread. As she is a very experienced baker, she could have many repeat clients who purchase her product on a daily basis. When she began her business, she had only 350,000 tugrugs. That is equal to $250 US. As a result of her five years of hard work, her working capital has increased 10 times. To increase her business inventory, she requests a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, eggs, and sugar for her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells groceries and soft drinks. She loves her business because her customers pay cash; she does not offer credit because she does not want to incur debt. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 38 and married with five children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Joyce is a hard-working woman determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells foodstuffs like beans and tubers of yam to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profits. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. 

She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 43 years old and married with two children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells plastic containers at Akotokyire.  Aba has no formal educational background.  She is married to a mason by profession.  Aba has been selling plastic containers for some time now. She helps her husband pay for their accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic containers to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for sale.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata Kamaté est âgée de 44 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants  à  Fana Coura un des quartiers la ville de Fana Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Salimata fait diverses activités telles l’habillement, la préparation et vente de jus de boissons etc.
Afin d’avoir des ressources financières complémentaires pour supporter la concurrence de plus en plus rude, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle a correctement remboursé tous ses prêts précédents et compte utiliser ce nouveau pour  se constituer un important stock d’ingrédients (sucre, gingembre, des arômes etc.) pour la fabrication de jus.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière premières au niveau de la ville de Fana.
Les jus sont vendus  sur place et en ambulant en espèce et à crédit avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle estime avoir un bénéfice prévisionnel de 100 000FCFA qui servira de soutenir les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Salimata Kamaté, aged 44, is the mother of six children.  She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in Fana Coura, a district in Fana City, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  Salimata has diverse businesses, such as clothing, making and selling juice beverages, etc.  In order to have supplemental financial resources for addressing the tougher and tougher competition, she decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  She has properly repaid all her previous loans and intends to use this new loan for building up a significant stock of ingredients (sugar, ginger, flavorings, etc.) for making juices.  She stocks up on basic supplies in Fana City.  The juices are sold locally door-to-door.  Cash and credit are accepted from a customer base composed of women and men.  She thinks she'll have a projected profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying ingredients for making juices

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: A. Nafissatou est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU Didier, un mécanicien, Nafissatou est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En dehors de ses enfants, Nafissatou a un autre enfant à sa charge. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou. Il y a près de treize ans que Nafissatou vit dans ce quartier. Nafissatou contribue efficacement aux charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Nafissatou vend en effet, des tissus, mais aussi des bijoux et des produits de beauté, par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Nafissatou achète ses produits. Nafissatou a déjà huit ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité, et a bénéficié antérieurement de deux prêts auprès de ALIDé. Nafissatou est une bonne cliente de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de se faire plus de profits, Nafissatou sollicite un troisième crédit, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Nafissatou was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Mr. DOSSOU Didier, a mechanic, she is the mother of three children, who are all in school.  Besides her children, Nafissatou has another child to support.  All the children live together with their parents in the Tokplégbé in Cotonou.  She has been living in this district for almost thirteen years.  She contributes effectively to covering family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Basically, she sells cloth but also jewelry and beauty products by the distribution system.  She purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Nafissatou has already had eight years of experience operating this business and has benefited in the past from two loans with ALIDé.  She is a good ALIDé client.  With the goal of bolstering her business and making more profit, Nafissatou is requesting a third loan in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bolts of cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou B. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS1, dont elle occupe le poste d'assistante dans le comité de gestion, depuis le 19 octobre 2002. Elle est couturière de profession, elle a ouvert un atelier de couture où elle a embauché du personnel pour la confection sur mesure des vêtements. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock de fournitures de couture afin d'augmenter sa production. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes tout en participant à la prise en charge des besoin familiaux.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and a mother responsible for nine children. She is a member of the “Banc Villageois” Samba 15 ANS1. Since October 19, 2002 she holds the position of assistant in the managing committee. She is a seamstress by trade. She opened a sewing workshop where she has hired help to make custom made clothing. Her new loan will allow her to increase her sewing supplies in order to boost her production. Her goal is to consolidate her savings while participating in meeting the family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her sewing activity

loans.name: C2363 Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Saverine is 58 years old and married with three children who are 20, 26 and 28 years old.  Saverine is the president of a group called "Turibamwe" and this group puts their strengths together in order to expand their businesses meaningfully.  Her business hours are from 5 am to 8 pm every day.

Although Saverine and her team do all their best in order to expand meaningfully, their capital is still too low to earn enough profit.  To end this, Saverine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding a large quantity of foodstuffs.  If successful, Saverine and her team will keep reinvesting for better financial stability and saving for a better future.

loans.use: To  buy a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La Sra. Clotilde invierte el préstamo en los insumos para preparar diversos tipos  de refrescos y de diferentes sabores como: Chicha morada, maracuyá, manzana y otros. Además su hermana la ayudo a conseguir un puesto así que también se dedica a la venta de ropa ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos por los cuales tiene que salir adelante. Los ingresos le permiten aportar con los gastos en casa, además su esposo lo apoya en todo momento. La Sra. Clotilde esta agradecida  por el préstamo, además es puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Clotilde will use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare various kinds of drinks with different flavors such as: Chica morada (a typical maize-derived drink prepared in Peru with purple corn), passion fruit, apple and others. On top of this, her sister helped her finding a job, and so she also dedicates herself to clothes selling. She is married and has 3 children she needs to provide for. The income helps her contributing to the household expenses, and her husband always helps her however he can. Clotilde is thankful for the loan, and she is punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Eufemia Elizabeth

texts.es: Eufemia Elizabeth C. es una señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora tiene un servicio de recorrido desde hace 30 años. Ella con el crédito mejorar el transporte ya que este requiere de mantenimiento para dar seguridad y confort a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eufemia Elizabeth C. is a dedicated, enterprising, and hard-working woman who has had a transport service for 30 years. With her loan she would like to improve her transport service since she needs to maintain her vehicle for the safety and comfort of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza V. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City. She is 48 years old and is married with three adult-aged children. Flordeliza owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat E., leader of the group, is 35 and married. She has four children: three sons of fourteen, five, and four years old, and daughter of fifteen years old. Her elder son and daughter go to school, and her two younger sons are at home. Her husband combines his job as mechanic at the company “Shumkar” and cattle breeding. Aizat is a worker at the company “Shumkar” and gets 6500 monthly. After their marriage, ten years ago, they started cattle breeding together from purchase of a cow. Together, they increased livestock numbers to thirteen and the cattle number to two. Monthly, cattle breeding brings 9000 soms. 

Now, Aizat and her husband are preparing their house for the winter period. In order to provide living conditions for their children, they need to make repairs at their house. Unfortunately, they don’t have a sufficient amount of money. They are applying for loan in order to buy building materials and make all the necessary repairs at home in time.

Group members:

Nurgul S., treasurer of the group, is 39 and married. She has two children. Her daughter is fifteen and goes to school. Her son is three years old and is at home. Her husband is in construction, and Nurgul is a poultry woman at the company “Shumkar.” Like Aizat and her husband, Nurgul with her husband decided to make home repairs for the winter period.

Bolotbek B. is 44 and married. He has three daughters of two, five and nine years. The elder daughter goes to school, the second daughter goes to kindergarten, and the youngest is at home. His wife works at the company “Shumkar.”  Five years ago, Bolotbek’s relatives offered him the oppotunity to buy coal at low price in Karakeche and resell it at higher price in the Issykkul region. He started it with 20,000 soms, and it now brings 10,000 soms each month. He is planning to build a big house for his family. Unfortunately, he cannot yet afford it. Therefore, he decided to make just repairs at his house. However, he doesn’t have enough funds. Thus, Bolotbek is applying for a loan in order to buy building materials and make necessary repairs himself.

Zharkyn Z. is 22 and single. She is a student but is expected to graduate this year from International Academy. At present, she is waitress at cafe “Zhibek Zholu”. She lives with her parents. Her father makes profits on buying and selling coal. This autumn her last academic year will start. She wants to prepare herself and buy all necessary things for the studying process including clothing. She cannot buy it herself right, now but in the future she will have enough funds to repay all this money. Therefore she is applying for a loan. In the future, she is planning to graduate and work according to her specialization.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mr. Him H., 26, and his wife, 27, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River. They wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets, which they put in the water the night before. After that, they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon. After gathering the fish from the river, Him H. hurries to the market so that he can sell at a suitable price. Him H. requests a loan to buy extra fishing tools to be used to increase the fish quantity.

loans.use: To buy extra fishing tools to be used to increase the fish quantity

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Don Virgilio de 56 años de edad habita en El Ayote junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Maria Lidia y sus 4 hijos, los cuales aun cuentan con su apoyo para que estudien y obtengan una carrera universitaria que les permita tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo y que puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Virgilio se desempeña desde hace 30 años como un pequeño productor de la zona de El Ayote,ademas tiene una pequeña farmacia veterinaria que le genera ingresos adicionales. 

Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su pequeña finca de 100 Mzs mejorando las condiciones de manejo para su ganado, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de la familia.  

El mayor sueño de don Virgilio es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 56 years old and lives in El Ayote with his family, which is comprised of his wife, Maria Lidia, and four children. He still supports his children so that they study and receive a university degree that will allow them to have better work opportunities and be able to improve their living conditions. Virgilio has worked for the past 30 years as a small producer in the El Ayote area. He also has a small veterinary pharmacy which provides him with additional income.

Virgilio is requesting his tenth loan for the purpose of improving his small, 100-manzana farmland (1 manzana is the equivalent of approximately 7,000 square meters) and to improve the conditions for caring for his cattle. This way, he can earn more and improve his family’s conditions.

Virgilio’s biggest dream is for his children to study and be good men.

loans.use: To improve his farmland.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia G. is from the village of Minanga Sur, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 50 years old and the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Delia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, she has a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julio C.tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Jessica es una D. las 8 integrantes D. la Alcancía comunal Julio C. Tello al Progreso, un nombre dedicado a la zona en donD. se ubican con sus viviendas y actividades económicas. A sus 24 años es conviviente y tiene un pequeño niño. Jessica se inicio en la venta D. bebidas diversas con la idea D. su hermana hace 3 años y se dedica a tiempo completo, ha logrado conjuntamente con su conyugue adquirir un trimovil el cual en la fecha es rentado para obtener otros ingresos, ha logrado mejorar su situación familiar en lo económico, ella desea hacer realidad la compra D. un terreno propio para poder construirlo y llegar a rentar habitaciones, ya que se ha dado cuenta que tienen demanda en la zona. El préstamo adquirido será invertido para ampliar su stock en bebidas y a la compra D. envases para su traslado D. los mismos. Jessica es una socia que participa activamente en su grupo hace 5 años y agradece se le otorgue la oportunidad D. ser una buena socia.
texts.en: Jessica is one of the 8 members of the Alcancia community bank Julio C. Tello al Progreso, (the name correlates to the area where the bank is located). Jessica is 24 years old, is married and has a small child. She began in business by selling various soft drinks, which was her sister's idea, and has now been in business for 3 years.  She manages the business, on a full-time basis, with her husband.  With this loan, she would like to buy a piece of land in order to build rooms for rent.  This is very much in demand in her part of town.  She would also like to invest some money into increasing her inventory of soft drinks and containers for shipping her drinks.  Jessica is a  member who actively participates in the group activities of this community bank and is grateful for the opportunity to be a good bank member.

loans.use: Comprar gaseosas (to purchase soft drinks)

loans.name: Shameness Group

texts.en:
Kumba S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kumba was born in Musaia village, in northern Sierra Leone about 53 years ago. She is married to a soldier and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

Kumba has been a businesswoman for over two years now. She sells market food. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia  P. sells a local brew from her home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. She is 30 years old and married to a farmer and has two children in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Taatai Ole

texts.en:
Taatai Ole K. is 41 years old. He is married to Nayuyanye K. and is a father of six school-going children. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last ten years.

This will be his second loan.  He learned about KADET from a colleague who was already a KADET client. He is planning to spend KES 40,000 to prepare his land for the next planting season, and spend the remaining KES 10,000 to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his maize output and also further develop his own plot.

In the future, he hopes to be able to buy a bigger piece of land so that he can plant maize on a larger scale. Taatai believes he is hardworking and that with the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting season, and buy chemicals & fertilizer

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live in a wooden house. He operates a trucking business in which he transports goods, such a wooden materials, to the 44th Building Market. 

His wife operates a dairy business during the summer time. His eldest daughter studying physics and electronics at the national university. His other three children attend the local secondary school.  

In 2000, he moved to Ulaanbaatar to open his transportation business. During his first year of business, it was difficult for him to conduct business because other drivers, in competing businesses, were pushing him out of the market. But he didn't give up and, after years of operation, he has gained a lot of experience.

Badamdorj used his saving to purchased a family truck and his own plot of land with a house. This is his 6th loan from Credit Mongol. Now he is requesting a 3.200.000 MNT loan to purchase cheaper meat from rural areas so he can sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cheaper meat from rural areas

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es:
El señor Adalberto A. Cohue, vive en unión libre con la señora Deonila  Solís López, en el cual tiene a sus responsabilidad tres hijos que estudian en preparatoria  y secundaria, Brayan  de quince años, la otra  es Brianda de doce años y la más pequeña es victoria Ailim de cinco meses de edad.
       El se dedica a su negocio de  cocina económica en donde le va bien ya que  ha logrado aumentar el espacio para que sus clientes estén mas cómodos con el servicio que les brinda del diario. Con esta actividad lleva diez meses y le parece un negocio bueno.
      Con este negocio inicio por su propia creatividad ya que para sacar adelante a su familia tiene que tener un trabajo que le deje ingresos para que ha sí pueda cubrir los gastos generados en su hogar.
      De lo que va obteniendo lo invierte en los ingredientes que utiliza para realizar  la comida que consume su clientela y les prepare lo que desean comer y estén satisfecha con el servicio.
      Adalberto desea que su negocio aumente día con día para que logres salir adelante con su familia y dándole una, mejor educación a sus hijos que están creciendo.
texts.en:
Mr. Adalberto A. Cohue lives with Mrs. Deonila Solís López and has three children who are in Middle and High School in his care: Brayan, 15, Brianda, 12, and Ailim, five months.

His business is a low cost eatery.  He has done well in that he has managed to expand the size of the space so that his customers can be more comfortable with the service he provides daily.  He has been in this business for 10 months and it seems to be a good business to him.

He started this business with his own creativity because he has to have work that produces income to support his family and cover household expenses.

From what he earns he invests in the ingredients he uses to prepare the meals his customers consume and so that he can prepare what they want to eat and be satisfied with the service.

Adalberto hopes that his business will grow daily so that he can get ahead with his family providing his growing children a better education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare meals for sale.

loans.name: Sulaika's Group

texts.en:
Sulaika B. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a woodworker. Together they are bringing up two daughters and a son.  The daughters are at school and the son studies at university. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, the family started to breed livestock.  By reselling livestock animals after fattening they earn 5000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan Sulaika wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. In the future she wants to repair the house and celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to purchase two livestock animals

loans.name: Fabricio Del Socorro

texts.es: Fabricio tiene 24 años, es casado con un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, la cual ya tiene 2 años de tenerla, esta pulpería brinda de manutención a ella y de su familia, sin embargo no gana lo suficiente para la manutención del hogar. Este negocio empezó con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Su meta actualmente, es establecer una tienda de ropa usada, ya que se está convirtiendo en un negocio muy rentable.
texts.en: Fabricio is 24 years old, married, and has a child for which he is responsible.  His business is a general store, located in his home.  He has had the business for 2 years.  The store provides support for the house and his family, but doesn’t bring in enough to support his home.  The business started with very little working capital, as an alternative source of income.  The loan will be used to buy basic grains, which is what sells the most right now.  His current goal is to establish a used-clothing store, which is turning out to be a profitable business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucy Wanjeri

texts.en:
Lucy, 52 years old, has practised agriculture in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 25 years. She mainly plants potatoes which she later sells to her customers. Lucy was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her fourth loan. She has repaid all her previous loans well and in good time and plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Lucy hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia M. K. is 32 years old and a single mother of one child.  

She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She also runs a grocer shop to earn extra income.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards. She hopes to grow her business so that she can employ more people in the future. 

She has requested 10,000 KES to buy spinach, kale and oranges for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy spinach, kale and oranges

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a farming business. She lives in the island of Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,700. 

Tessie is borrowing PHP 17,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Tessie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber yard business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell for her lumber yard business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 20 years. Carmelita earns more income with pig fattening.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en: Marthaline is 28 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She finished only 6th grade and has two children ages 7 and 9, and a fiancée who is a painter. She started a little red palm oil business two years ago. Marthaline makes a lot of money in the rainy season, and has the desire to improve her business, She’s requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, and hopes to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Maria Melany

texts.es:
María, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 18, 14 y 9 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y refrescos, desde hace 2 años y fue por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 9:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de queso, chicharrón, aceite y más materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las pupusas, esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y poder aumentar la producción diaria de pupusas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio para apoyar a su familia, sacar a sus hijos adelante, que estudien y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department with her husband and three children who are 18, 14, and 9 years of age. She sells pupusas (typical Salvadoran fast food) and soft drinks.  She started two years ago on her own initiative.  She works every day from 9am until 6pm.

She needs a loan to buy cheese, pork skin, oil and other supplies needed to make pupusas.  This investment will help her strengthen the fussiness and increase daily pupusa production.

Her objective is to keep the business to support her family, move her children ahead so that they can study and better themselves.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork skin and oil.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en:
Lilis is a 26-year-old lady who lives with her husband David, who is 41, and their baby boy Rafael, who is nine months old, in a modest house. 

Currently, Lilis has a fried food business – selling fried bananas, tofu, soybeans, etc. The reason why Lilis runs this business is because her husband's income is insufficient to support the family. Lilis also needs to provide nutritious food for her baby so they need more money to meet her baby's needs. 

Lilis has been running the business for six months but she wants to try another business that can help her in generating more income. Lilis has an idea to run a food stall business. She plans to sell pork and hotdogs but she does not have capital to start the business. Lilis is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). She wants to spend the loan on cooking spices and the food stall equipment. 

Lilis is hoping that TLM will provide her with an opportunity by providing the business loan so she can start her new business.

loans.use: To purchase cocking spices and food stall equipment

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with 2 children. Her oldest child is only 5 years old. 

Maricel is farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been growing rice for 5 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 42 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, lotion, perfumes and other Avon products to sell.

Ma. Delia has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling personal products business for 15 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Ma. Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, lotion, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 24 años, convive con Eradio su esposo, ambos tienen 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; a los cuales cuida y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la cuenca alta de la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). El trabajo al que se dedica está abnegada mujer desde hace ya 3 años, es la agricultura. Sus principales frutos son los cítricos y la piña; pero el fruto que le da mayor ingreso a Karina, es la piña, ya que siembra en sus más de 9 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo; los cuales cuidan y cosecha constantemente, junto a su esposo. Según menciona; la maleza que crece en su contorno no le permite crecer. Lo que más le molesta a ella es tener que cuidar sus plantaciones con abundante ropa, para evitar que ingresen las espinas de la piña al cuerpo; agrega que “con el intenso calor de la selva, no se puede trabajar”, menciona. En estos meses cosechará 3 hectáreas de piña y está planeando viajar a la capital para negociar a un mayor precio sus cultivos y más adelante convertirse en proveedor mayorista del país. Además está pensando abrir una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en una pequeña tienda cerca al parque de la localidad, donde su mamá colocó un negocio similar obteniendo buenas ganancias. En este mes dará el primer paso con la ayuda de su asociación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo de ustedes para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Karina, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en implementar la tienda de abarrotes que está pensando abrir.
texts.en:
24 year-old Karina lives with her husband Eradio.  The couple have three dependent children who they care for and educate in a rental house which is located in the upper basin of the Peruvian rainforest (in the community of Las Palmas).

The work that this selfless woman has been engaged in for three years now is farming.  Her main fruits are citrus fruits and pineapples.  However, it is the pineapple that provides Katrina with the most income.  She grows her pineapple over 9 hectares of farm land.  She is always caring for and harvesting her crop, together with her husband.  She tells us that the weeds that grow round about do not allow the fruit to grow.  What bothers her the most is having to care for her plantations whilst wearing plenty of clothes to avoid getting the pineapple spines in her body.  She adds "With the intense heat in the rainforest, you can't work".

Karina is harvesting three hectares of pineapple and she is planning to travel to the capital to negotiate a better price for her crops.  In the future, she plans to become a nation-wide wholesaler.  In addition, she is planning to open a grocery store business in a small store near the town park, where her mom set up a similar business and made good profits.  This month she will take the first steps with the help of her community bank.

Karina is a member of the "Las Palmeras" community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan from you in order to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.  Karina enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members of the bank are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Karina will invest the money she has requested in setting up the grocery store that she is planning to open.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store
