loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is  47 years old and married with 5 children between ages 13 and 29, two of whom are currently attending school. She has a mixed farm in Kitale town where she has been farming for 7 years. Her farm produces milk and eggs which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to meet the basic needs of her family.

Grace has made a loan request of 30,000Kes in order to buy additional stock of chickens for her poultry farm. She believes that by expanding her poultry farm her sales volume will increase and this will earn her more income. Grace faces the challenge of diseases which affects her production. She plans to expand her poultry farm in the near future and also to construct a posho mill.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Kasusu Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 39-year-old married woman with eight children, all living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She takes care of the family, and her dream is to educate her children and build a commercial house.

For six years she has been operating a bar and she got her initial capital from selling fresh food. Her major challenge now is inadequate capital to meet the demand.

Teddy needs the loan to buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 32 years old, has been selling mobile phones and accessories in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy mobile phone accessories in bulk as this is cheaper.

In future, she hopes to grow her shop and also be involved with selling computers and computer accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease a field for growing potatoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen D. 57 años D. edad, habita en su propia casa con su familia la cual está integrada por su esposo y sus dos hijas.  Carmen se dedica a la venta D. lácteos es decir: crema, queso, leche, etc. Ha trabajado toda su vida para poder sacar adelante a su querida familia y gracias a Dios siempre ha podido darles el pan D.  cada día. Es una mujer muy carismática y gracias a esto ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas D. la zona donD. ella habita. Los clientes la prefieren ya que es una mujer muy amable, trabajadora, higiénica y además ofrece los mejores precios. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. lácteos, ella compra por botellas la leche y luego D. un proceso realizado por ella obtiene: crema, queso fresco conocido por "cuajada", y requeson. Solicita el préstamo con el fin D. poder contar con suficiente producto dado que en esta época del año, invierno es cuando mas abunda la leche y los clientes consumen mas sus derivados. Espera con ésto aumentar el nivel D. ventas que le generen un mayor nivel D. ingresos y por consecuencia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
57-year-old Carmen lives in her own home with her family which consists of her husband and two daughters.  Carmen sells dairy products: cream, cheese, milk, etc.  She has worked her whole life to get her beloved family ahead in life.  Thanks to God, she has always been able to proviD. for them.  Carmen is a very charismatic woman and, as a result, she has managed to gain the trust of many people in her area.  Her customers prefer to buy from her as she is a very kind, hard-working, hygienic woman who offers her customers the best prices.

Carmen has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying dairy products.  She buys her milk by the bottle and turns it into cream, young cheese known as 'cuajada' (curd), and cottage cheese.  Carmen is requesting this loan with the aim of having enough supplies available as this time of year (winter) is when milk is most readily available and her customers consume more dairy products.  She hopes to be able to increase her sales levels and make more income so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
Jose Domingo nació en la ciudad Cusco y tiene 47 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Jose Domingo vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él tiene una pequeña imprenta en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Jose Domingo requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como papel y tinta. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Jose Domingo was born in the city of Cusco.  He is 47 years old, married, and has two children from his marriage.  He currently lives in the city in which he was born and this is where he carries out his business activities.  Jose Domingo has a small printing business in the city of Cusco.  He has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy more work materials such as paper and ink.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more work materials such as paper and ink

loans.name: Gladis Noemí

texts.es: Gladis Noemí de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una sala de belleza y una venta de productos de uso personal o de uso para estudiantes como crayones, cartulina, cuadernos, ganchos para el cabello, colas, la ganancia que adquiere de la venta de todos estos productos y el servicio que presta es su única fuente de ingresos con la que ayuda al sostenimiento en su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el servicio que presta a sus clientes es excelente, realiza los mejores cortes, alisados, y planchados; además los artículos que vende son de muy buena calidad y todo es a precios accesibles, Gladis es una mujer emprendedora para ella la vida es un desafío diario y está dispuesta a enfrentarlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, cremas, shampo, acondicionador entre otros con los que no cuenta y se hayan demandando sus clientes. De esta forma Gladis Noemí tiene confianza que logrará darle a su familia seguridad económica y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Gladis Noemí, age 39, lives with her life partner and her children. She has a beauty salon and sells personal care products as well as schools supplies, such as crayons, construction paper, notebooks, hair clips, and glue. Her earnings from these sales and her services are her sole source of income, which she puts toward providing for her household. 

She has gained many clients, as the service she provides is excellent, offering the best haircuts, styling, and straightening. Her merchandise is also of very good quality and reasonably priced. Gladis is an entrepreneurial woman who takes life's daily challenges head on. That's why she's taking out this loan with Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoos, and conditioners, among other products, that she lacks to meet her clients' requests. Gladis Noemí is confident that this is how she will succeed in providing her family with economic security and a better life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoos, and conditioners, among other products.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 40 years old and married with three children, between 6 and 25 years of age. She runs an electronics appliance store in Fullahtown in the central part of Freetown. She has two employees working with her. She also takes care of three relatives as well as her immediate ones. 

Fatmata has been in this business for three years and sells televisions and DVD sets at her store. She also earns income from a taxi business. She says that the main challenges to her businesses are insufficient capital and variation in price.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electronic appliances. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business and import more appliances.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions and DVD sets.

loans.name: María Beljica

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de  Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, de un corazón cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 4, 2 años de edad y un bebé de 4 meses. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María realiza bordados, actividad que aprendió trabajando desde que tenía 15 años de edad, trabaja en su casa de lunes a sábados pero solo bajo pedido.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, ajugas, etc.

Su meta es agrandar su taller para tener operarios y tener un local para vender su producto.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres con Decisión (Decisive Women). She lives in the middle of the city of Cuenca, a city which is surrounded by 4 rivers, giving it the name of Santa Ana of the Four Rivers. Cuenca has many natural and cultural riches; its people are friendly and warm-hearted. They maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 34 years old. She’s a single mother of 3 children who are 4 and 2 years old, and one baby who is 4 months. She does not have her own home, so she rents. 

Doña María makes embroidery, an activity which she learned while working since she was 15 years old. She works in her home from Monday to Saturday, but only upon request.

This is her fourth loan from the communal bank, and she will be investing it in the purchase of fabrics, threads, needles, etc. 

Her goal is to expand her workshop in order to hire workers and have a place to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en: Roselyne is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years old. She describes herself as polite, welcoming, and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are the local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of general items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 56 years of age, married and blessed with four children. His three children already finished their college while the youngest is still in college. 

Antonio is engaged in the farming business. He plants rice in their village. He has been in this business for almost 29 years. Antonio usually earns a net income of  PHP 10,000 per crop in his farm.
 
Sometimes, his earning depends on climate, variety of seeds and amount of fertilizers applied in his crops. Antonio wishes to buy hybrid seeds of rice to increase his earnings. It was a big help for him to get a better yield if he applied an exact amount of fertilizers in his farm. Hence, Antonio is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers to be applied to crops to get a better yield.

Antonio looks toward the success of his farming business. He hopes to gain a higher income and be able to continue sending his child to school to pursue his degree.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers to be applied to crops to get a better yield.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Gemma earns a living through selling fish. She is married with two children, aged 20 and 18. Gemma's husband is a fisherman.

Gemma has been selling fish for two years. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys fish from other fishermen in her town. Gemma works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to purchase an icebox, weighing scale and plastic bags. Gemma hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase an icebox, weighing scale and plastic bags.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Artesanas del Fresno” esta conformado por solo mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque casi todas se dedican a las artesanía que son los bordados y tejidos, por eso son artesanas y lo de fresno por su comunidad.
Doña María Juana es una persona mayor de edad conoce muy bien de donde nació el bordado y el tejido de la comunidad, ella tiene 69 años de edad ya es viuda ahora vive sola pero muy cercas de sus hijos y casi pasa todo el día con sus nietos.
Doña María Juana comenta que antes la lana era natural por lo que ahora ya no solo es sintética, antes ellos mismos elaboraban esta producto, primero lavaban la lana del borrego que salía cuando les cortaban la lana, se hacia lino con la lana ya bien lavada y lo obtenían con ayuda de un instrumento de madera, después tejían todos estos hilos de lana hasta obtener una tela y finalmente pintaban la tela los colores mas comunes eran el negro, café y gris. Las cosas han cambiado ahora ya nada de esto se hace porque las telas ya son de muy mala calidad.
Ella bordando lleva ya 30 años desde que sus hijos eran pequeños comenta que esto le ayudo de mucho para darles estudios a sus hijos también ayudaba con los gastos del hogar cuando su esposo se quedaba sin empleo, vendía todos los días lunes en Ixtlahuaca sus bordados,
Ahora ya solo ofrece con sus conocidos de la comunidad esta sola y muchas veces pues no tiene para cubrir sus necesidades básicas como alimentación, calzado y vestimenta por eso se dedica a esto, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar estambres de colores, tela y aujas.
Su desafío es que muchas veces sus trabajo ya no lo valoran como antes y no le quieren pagar lo que realmente es el precio, comenta que es muy pasado ya que se tardan varios días elaborando este trabajo porque todo es echo a mano, ella hace chalecos, morrales, colchas, suéteres con figuras representativas de la comunidad, como pájaros, gretas, estrellas, flores, etc.
Una de las metas de doña Juana es llegar a vender muchos bordados para poder compra maíz, porque si no comprar no tendrá para hacer sus tortillas durante todo el año ya que es uno de sus alimentos primordiales de todos los días.
Todas las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas por el préstamo ya que podrá compra todo el material que les hace falta y podrán cumplir con sus pedidos ya atrasados.
Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, Rufina, Rosio,  y María Lucina invertirán en los bordados, mientras que María de los Ángeles y Juana Iríais invertirán en cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "Artesanas del Fresno" is made up of women who are hardworking and responsible. They chose the group's name because almost all of them are artisans who make crafts like embroidery and knitting - so they called themselves Artesanas [artisans], and Fresno is the name of their community. 

Maria Juana is an older woman who is very familiar with the origins of embroidery and knitting in the community. She is 69, widowed and lives alone but very close to her children and she spends most of the day with her grandchildren. Maria Juana says that the wool used to all be natural, but now it's synthetic. They used to make it themselves, first washing the lambswool then making linen with the well-washed wool. They used a wooden instrument to obtain the wool. Afterwards they knitted all of their wool threads until they had fabric, and finally they dyed the fabric - the most common colors were black, brown and gray. Things have changed now and none of this is done the same way because the fabrics are of very bad quality.

She has been doing embroidery for 30 years, since her children were young. She says that it helped her to put them through school and also with their household costs when her husband was unemployed. She used to sell her embroidery every Monday in Ixtlahuaca, but now she only offers them to people she knows in her community. She is alone and often can't cover the costs of her basic necessities like food, clothing and shoes, which is why she works. This time she has asked for a loan to buy colored wool, fabric and needles. 

Her challenge is that her work is not as valued as it used to be and people don't want to pay a fair price. She says that it's very old-fashioned and it takes many days to finish a piece of work because everything is done by hand. She makes vests, bags, blankets, and sweaters with local figures like parrots, stars, flowers, etc.

One of Juana's goals is to sell more embroidery so she can buy corn, because if she doesn't, she won't have corn to make her tortillas all year, which is one of the foods she eats every day. 

All of the members of the group are very thankful for the loan because they can buy the materials that they lack and meet their back orders. Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, Rufina, Rosio and Maria Lucina will invest in embroidery; Maria de los Angeles and Juana Iriais will invest in cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hongly

texts.en:
Hongly (in the photo) and her husband, Sophal, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003, and have no children yet. 

Hongly stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business; he is a construction worker. Hongly has just finished her house building. She asks for a loan in the amount of $300 to buy a wooden closet. The wooden closet is needed to keep her traditional clothing for attending weddings and other ceremonies -- both important in the Khmer culture -- safe and clean.

loans.use: to buy a wooden closet for keeping her clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goals are to educate his children and building a permanent residential house. He has been distilling alcohol for the last five years after starting with a capital of fifty thousand only, but now his business is worth two millions. The major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to set up a liquor store in town. David needs the loan facility to buy bananas for distilling alcohol.

loans.use: to buy bananas so as to distill alcohol.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns and operates a retail hardware shop. She has been in this business for four years, and she works in her shop six days out of every week. 
 
Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan funds to buy more bags of cement, iron sheets, nails, and barbed wire. She also generates additional income by selling rice. 

Her primary business challenges include thieves and the difficulties involved in transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked hardware shop. She also plans to build a house for the family.

Sarah and her husband live in a rented home with their five children in Kampala. They have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family. All five of her children are enrolled in school. Sarah also takes care of her sister and brother.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, nails, iron sheets, and barbed wire to sell in her hardware shop

loans.name: Kivisi

texts.en:
Kivisi is 35 years old. He is married to a businesswoman.They are blessed with four children. He describes himself as a faithful and social man. 

Kivisi was a landlord in one of the popular slums near his home area. He decided to start up a retail shop selling electrical items such as drills, barbed wire, pipes, and voltage regulators, where he has for 17 years. His business is faced with a challenge of the high cost of transportation.

He managed to pay his earlier loan of KES 20,000 well. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more drills and fault detectors. Kivisi has a plan of educating his children with the profits he will generate from the business.

loans.use: to buy drills and fault detectors.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice âgée de 54 ans, a très peu fréquenté l'école. Béatrice est mariée à un certain Bernardin. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Béatrice vit avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison  depuis quatre ans, Béatrice vend des produits de quincaillerie dans sa boutique. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Béatrice s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Béatrice sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de quincaillerie.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Timotea  continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo ropa a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  y se comprometen  a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.

loans.use: para comprar casacas entre otros.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Queen Egharevba is married with 8 children. She has benefited from a LAPO loan since 2000. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She plans to increase her furniture business if granted the loan.

loans.use: Buy more wood for furniture for sale

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is married with three children. He lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. The area is well known for residents' engaging themselves in animal keeping. Enock sells animal feed to these animal keepers. He buys by-products of maize, cotton, palm kernels, sunflowers and other cereals and packs them in bags of 20kgs to 50 kgs ready for resale.

Enock is planning to expand his business by stocking some other types of animal feeds which are professionally manufactured like broiler-mash and layer-mash for chickens. He also needs a bicycle which he will use to ferry products purchased by his customers to their premises as an after-sale service.

Enock also keeps layers of which his wife is in charge. He is planning to add the flock of these layers to supplement his income in order to meet family requirements as well as school fees for his children. To meet his expectation, Enock is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: Increase stock of animal feeds

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Born in Aklakou in 1967, Madame A. Dado is married and the mother of two children. Her main economic activity is the production of doughnuts. The earnings she makes allows her to support her family. Her husband, a farmer, does not make enough money to support the family on his own. Today, Madame A. needs a loan in order to increase her production to meet the high demand for her products. She is asking for a loan of $600.00 to purchase flour, oil and firewood, so that she can improve her doughnut production. This initiative will help her to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née à Aklakou en 1967, Madame A. Dado est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son activité principale est la production de beignets. C’est de ces revenus qu’elle arrive à prendre en charge sa famille. Son mari, agriculteur de profession ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour lui venir en aide. Aujourd’hui, Mme A. a besoin d’un financement pour augmenter sa capacité de production face aux nombreuses sollicitations. Elle demande un crédit de $600 pour acheter de la farine du blé, de l’huile, du bois de chauffe pour accroître la production de ses beignets. Cette initiative pourra l’amener à une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil and firewood, used for the production of doughnuts.

loans.name: Rute Francisco

texts.pt:
Rute Francisco Muchabjetem is 49 years old. She is a widow, mother of 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Mahotas, in Maputo. She operates a small chicken coop in her home, where she raises and sells chickens. She also sells clothes.

Rute joined the program in October 2006, her first loan was of 5.000MT. She completed re-paying that first loan on time. She is now in the 3rd stage of the program when she plans on borrowing 15.000 MT to be repaid in 6 months. She plans on using the fund to increase her stock for both businesses. Rute has seen positive changes in both businesses since she joined the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rute Francisco Muchabjetem 49 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Mahotas na cidade de Maputo.Tem um pequeno aviário em sua casa onde cria e vende frangos a grosso e também vende roupa nova, a qual faz entrega ao domicílio.

Entrou para o programa em Outubro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000MT. Tem pago pontualmente os empréstimos e também tem depositado as poupanças.Vai para o terceiro ciclo de empéstimo e pretende uim empréstimo de 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para reforçar o negócio. Tem verificado crescimento gradual do negócio uma vez que todo o valor dos empréstimos tem aplicado nos seus dois negócios.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Fatilua

texts.en: Fatilua, 33 years old, has a talent for printing elei (screen printing on elei materials).  She purchases yards of material of various colours and prints on them.  In order to make ends meet and to feed and clothe her four kids, Fatilua has made full use of her talent.  By delivering to the village shops and catering at a stall at the flea market five times a week, she earns a profit of $50 per day after expenses, giving her enough to put food on the table and to make her weekly loan repayment to SPBD.

loans.use: For home improvement and for supplies and materials for her elei printing

loans.name: Juana Mosquea

texts.en:
Juana sells women’s clothing and gold-filled and silver-plated jewels.

Juana is 40 years old and has three children, two girls and a boy, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a skycap in the international airport of Santo Domingo, the capital. Juana sells her merchandise in La Romana and Bávaro, two high tourist provinces of the country.

The entrepreneur hopes she can expand her business operation. She needs funds to purchase large amounts of merchandise so that she can satisfy more customers’ needs and increase her income. That way, she will be able to keep on running the business and have money enough to take care of her children

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk and jewels to supply business.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is 45 years of age and has 5 children. She is one of the members who started Malie J3 centre two years ago. Her first, second and third loan was used to buy chemicals for her three acre taro plantation quite far from her house. She goes to the market twice a week and she makes $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD). She is applying for another loan to expand her taro plantation and to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora Ivonne lives in the Montecristi neighborhood of Managua. She is dedicated to the sales of used clothing out of her home. This business provides the income that her family needs to live. Ivonne is married and has two older daughters who still live at home and help with the household jobs and business. Her husband is a senior citizen who is very old and supports the family with the money that he receives monthly from social security. Ivonne has been in this business for four years now, and the majority of her clients are neighbors who have few economic resources and have to purchase second-hand clothing. Presently, Ivonne wants to buy a bundle of clothes for children, women, and men, because she does not have a lot currently in stock for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Ivonne habita en el barrio Montecristi de Managua, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su casa de habitación, este negocio provee el ingreso que la familia necesita para vivir. Doña Ivonne es casada y tiene dos hijas mayores de edad, pero que aún vive en su casa y son quienes le ayudan con los oficios de la casa y el negocio. Su esposo es un señor de muy avanzada edad y aporta a la familia con el dinero que recibe mensualmente del seguro social. Doña Ivonne está en este negocio desde hace 4 años, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos quienes por contar con bajos recursos económicos tienen que acceder a esta ropa de segunda mano. Actualmente Doña Ivonne quiere comprar una paca de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, porque no cuenta con mucha existencia del producto en su negocio

loans.use: Purchase a bundle of various clothing.

loans.name: Salminaz

texts.en: Salminaz T. is a 44-year-old woman who sells calves for meat production. She has six years of experience in this field. She lives with her husband and three children in a small village in the Saatli region. As Salminaz and her husband are unemployed, selling calves to the local bazaar traders for meat is the only financial source for such a big family. She decided to purchase additional calves to improve the conditions of her family. For this purpose she applied for a loan of $1100 to purchase three calves for $300 each and fodder for $200.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Coni

texts.es:
Mrs. Coni L. I. is a member of the group called "Mientras Tanto Mas Que Vencedoras" (In the meantime, more than winners), she lives in her own house located in the Jiron Tupac Amaru Nº 533, del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril. She sells general goods, candy, and everyday consumables.

The loan of S/. 1000.00, which will be repaid in 4 equal installements, will be used to purchase noodles of different sizes and varieties, canned fish, rice and sugar in big bags, liters of oil, wide variety of sodas, candy and personal hygene products.

She is 24 years old and is very sure of herself and what she wants to accomplish in life. She dreams of owning her own place, increase the size of her business and improve her family's lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Coni L. I.,es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mas que Vencedoras” vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de San Martín ,distrito de Morales,su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Tupac Amaru Nº 533, del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, en el vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. El préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, , además de surtir con gaseosas, golosinas y productos de aseo personal. Ella tiene 24 años se siente muy segura de si misma y de lo que quiere lograr en la vida, es así que sueña con tener su casa propia y en ella implementar un negocio mas grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Items for her store in order to have a wide variety of goods

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat A. has a truck that he uses for providing transportation service mostly to people who want to move bricks, sand, and other construction materials. He is married and has 5 children. Rufat is an Internally Displaced Person from Khankendi and the IDP community from Khankendi knows him well and respects him.

When they were displaced after the war with Armenia, small new settlements for refugees were built, and Rufat has been transporting construction materials for free as a volunteer. Now he earns his living with this truck. He needs this loan to do some repairs and purchase used tires that are in better shape.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and repairs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome L., 69, is married and has four children.  She has three years' experience operating a retail shop, where she sells goods six days a week to passersby. Her husband helps her operate this business. Salome has taken out and repaid two loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $83. SPBD loans are Salome’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy a cash box and a scale

loans.name: Miscelánea

texts.es:
Her dedication to food sale has provided the possibility of building a restaurant at doña Miscelánea’s home, as she has won the affection and respect of her clients due to her good attention and seasoning. She is a single mother and in spite of such a huge responsibility it is her wish to make progress. Doña Miscelánea wishes her business to continue growing as she wants to open another restaurant in the future and therefore she wishes to implement new things to her kitchen and for this project she requires a loan as soon as possible. Doña Miscelánea awaits the selfless support from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Su dedicación a la venta de comida ha posibilitado la construcción de un restaurante en el domicilio de la señora Miscelánea, ella por su buena atención y sazón, se ganó el cariño y respeto de sus clientes. Es madre soltera, y a pesar de cargar con esta responsabilidad tan grande tiene muchos deseos de progresar. La señora Miscelánea quiere seguir surgiendo en su negocio ya que posteriormente quiere abrir otro restaurante y para ello quiere implementar su cocina con cosas nuevas y para este proyecto estima de un préstamo lo más pronto posible para cumplir su objetivo. La señora Miscelánea espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to update kitchen tools and purchase new ones to improve service.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun P., 51, is a widow with five children, two sons and three daughters, who lives in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Three of her daughters are married and live outside the family home and the other two have full-time employment.

For eleven years, Mrs. Phoeun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa N. is a young disabled man who was born in 1982 in Thiès. After abandoning his studies, he decided to start selling spare parts so he would not have to resort to begging. He is requesting this loan so he can increase his supply of parts.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

moussa N. est un jeune handicapé né en 1982 à thies.après avoir abandonné les études il a préféré faire du petit commerce de pièces détachées pour ne pas se rabattre dans la mendicité .il veut renouveler ses stocks c'est pour cela qu'il demande ce pret.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Mbugo

texts.en:
Mbugo H. S. is 38 years old and divorced; she has one 18-year-old child. She has been selling porridge and bites since 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mbugo now seeking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Aoum

texts.en: Aoum S., 58, is one of the grocery vendors in her village and makes around US$2.50 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, making chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. On average, he makes US$2.50 each day as well. Aoum lives with three of her eight children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Five of her children are married and no longer live at home, while one is employed and two stay at home. Aside from selling groceries, Aoum has farmland for growing rice. She has requested a loan of US$1000 to add groceries to her inventory, to purchase fertilisers and to hire a tractor to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To add groceries to her inventory, to purchase fertilisers and to hire a tractor to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hường năm nay 35 tuổi và đã tham gia quỹ tình thương được hơn 5 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã đầu tư để buôn bán thịt lợn. Công việc kinh doanh  phát triển thuận lợi cộng với tiền lương làm thầu điện thắp sáng của chồng đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng  cuộc sống của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ để mua lợn nuôi và đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 35 years old and she is with TYM fund for more than 5 years. Before joining TYM fund, her family income was from pig raising and vegetable cultivation. It was difficult time for her family. Her loan from TYM was used to start a new business: sell pork. This proves to be a successful business providing her a stable income and combining with her husband`s salary, it helps her family to overcome financial difficulties. In this round of loan she is requesting 10.000.000 to buy piglets to raise and investing more in her pork sale.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma is a fashion designer, and she also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Ijeoma makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. Ijeoma is 35 years old and married with a child. Ijeoma lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive holiday season. She needs the loan to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Dianké

texts.fr: Dianké Sané, 59 ans, veuve, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Dianké Sané, age 59, is a widow and has a child to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. She wants to buy palm oil to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 26 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent   généralement dans de familles conjugales nucléaires. Elles résident à Sokoura-Est l’un des quartiers  de la ville de la préfecture de Dioïla (une des préfectures de la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali, Koulikoro). .
Par des relations de commerce ses femmes se sont connues et font essentiellement de l’habillement comme activité principale.
 Dans le souci de fructifier leur activité elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter, 100 pièces de pagnes à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Ces pagnes seront découpés en trois pagnes  vendus au comptant et à crédit sur le marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 50 000 FCFA  chacune et se projettent d’utiliser cet intérêt pour les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi group are all married and on average 26-years old with three children. Most live with their immediate marital families. Their homes are in Sokoura-East, one of the neighborhoods of Dioïla (one of the prefectures of Koulikoro, the second-largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other through business relationships built around selling clothing, which is their main activity. Intending to strengthen their businesses, the women decided to become part of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan. All of the previous loans were successfully repaid. They are planning to buy 100 bolts of fabric from Bamako (the Malian capital) from wholesalers. The bolts of fabric will be cut into three sections and sold on credit in Dioïla's market to customers including both men and women. They plan to make a profit of 50,000 Francs CFA from this loan and each one envisions using this money for health and education costs for their children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Jaleel

texts.en:
Jaleel K.  lives in Bubal Afghanistan. He is 32 years old, married with two children. Jaleel is a hard working carpenter.
He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months because he wants to expand his business. He wants to buy necessary material and complete the  stock for his shop.     
Jaleel is very happy about this small loan process in Afghanistan that wants to help  poor people. He wants to thank all lenders to AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: He wants to buy necessary material and complete the stock for his shop

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Juan Alberto T. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Juan tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la venta de medicina natural. Hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que el compra la mercadería en Managua y también compra productos embasados que dan la originalidad al producto, y en su casa el termina de proporcionarle otro ingrediente. Sus propósitos para el negocio son de  proveerlo lo suficiente de productos para que sus clientes regresen a su tienda ya que vende lo ellos necesitan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar ungüentos, te de manzanilla y además tiene que viajar a los departamentos de León y Chinandega ya que gasta en  combustible porque viaja en una moto. Sus deseos son de tener su propia farmacia de productos medicinales y brindar el servicio a domicilio. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alberto T. is 40 years old and single. Juan has 4 children. He sells natural medicine. He has done this for 7 years with merchandise from Managua. He also buys packaged materials that give the originality of the product, and in his house he finishes it with other ingredients. His propositions for the business are to provide his customers with enough products when they return to his store. This financing is to buy ointments of chamomile and to travel to a store in Leon and Chinandega, which costs because he travels by motorcycle. He wants to have his own pharmacy and provide services to the neighborhood. He is asking for C$9,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, G. yawa est une femme mariée qui vit avec son époux et ses 03 enfants dans le quartier d’adidogomé. Cette  dame a ouvert depuis 1995 une boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS MAWUNYO », dans sa boutique elle fait le commerce de céréales, de produits d'alimentation générale,de charbons  de bois et d’huile. Elle est très connue dans son quartier grâce  à ses  prestations. Actuellement son stock s’épuise, ayant déjà obtenu son premier crédit elle demande son deuxième pour acheter 02 sacs de céréales, 03 bidons d’huile rouge, 10 calebasses d’igname et 05 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Yawa G. lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood with her husband and their three children. In 1995, she opened a shop called "ETS MAWUNYO" where she sells cereals, groceries, charcoal, and oil. She's well-known in her neighborhood, thanks to her performance. Her stock is running out, and so she's seeking a second loan to buy 2 sacks of cereals, 3 cans of "red oil" (palm oil), 10 "calebasses" (containers made out of hollowed out and dried calabashes) of yams, and 5 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, palm oil, yams, and charcoal

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en: N. Milly, 33, is married with four children, of which three attend school. She is the group leader and has been running a retail shop in Lugazi for the past 10 years. At her shop, she sells sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, as well as hair chemicals, braids and children’s clothes. Having a variety of products in her shop has enabled Milly to increase her income, hence being able to save funds for her future. Milly needs a loan to restock her shop with more products for sale.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and other shop products for her shop

loans.name: Mrs. Sieb Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Romon village in Takeo province, Cambodia. They plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Mrs. Sieb M. is the village bank president. She was selected by the group members. She is a farmer and she owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Em Phalla, is a motor taxi driver. Aside from this work, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sieb M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, for breeding, to earn more income for her family. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Eight members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui B. lives with her husband and teenage son in Bayanzurh, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son is an 8th grader at a local high school. Nergui selling meat. She started the business with her husband in a local food market. Since it started in 1998, her business has done well and has expanded; wholesale and individual sales.

Nergui usually buys livestock such as sheep, goats, and cattle in the spring when prices are low and hires a herder to feed the livestock until the meat prices peak in the fall. She slaughters and sells them wholesale and to individuals in the local market. In the future, she would like to expand her butcher business by raising more livestock. She requests a loan to purchase more livestock for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more livestock for her business.

loans.name: Rosell

texts.en:
Rosell R. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City in the Philippines. Rosell is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosell owns & operates a traditional gold mining business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling gold dust to local jewelers. Rosell has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Rosell is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase a gold flasher machine to improve his business activities. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to support his childrens' education. This will be Rosell's third loan from HSPFI, having successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP. He joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a gold flasher machine to improve his gold mining business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine M. is a rice farmer. She is 25 years old and has three children. She married so early that she was not able to have a good education. Poverty is the main reason why she has not been to college. She decided to get married to Ranel M. who is a farmer. The couple are tenants which means that they are not the true owners of the farm that they are tilling. They get a share of the harvest from the farm. This has sustained their family for a long time already. Carine would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming needs. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia I. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a business running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In June 2009, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Desde hace 20 años, en el municipio de Somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, por las calles anda la señora María Auxiliadora S. ofreciendo ropa ambulante con el propósito de subsistir y mejorar su condición económica.

Ella es una señora avanzada de edad pero con mucho amor al trabajo como lo es toda mujer nicaragüense. Ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de ropa y de esta manera ofrecerla ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
For 20 years in the municipality of Somotillo of the region of Chinandega, Señora María Auxiliadora S. has walked along the streets offering clothes for sale in order to subsist and to improve her economic condition. She is a lady of advanced age but with a lot of love for her work like every Nicaraguan woman. She has requested a loan from Ceprodel to invest in the purchase of clothes so that she can offer them for sale on the streets of her municipality and thus continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Adelvina

texts.en:
Adelvina is a member of the Songambele borrower group in Sakina,Arusha,she is 33 years old woman,she is single and she cares for 3 dependents.

Adelvina started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Adelvina first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Adelvina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali K. is a man of thirty-eight years old, married with three children whom one is studying and two are still young. Ali has a retail shop located in Kitaka local council Nyendo and he has been operating his business for six years. He is using the loan purposely for buying retail items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, beans and so forth. She wants to purchase a second hand fridge for cold soft drinks. This will help her business to expand. Ali’s future hopes are to purchase a plot of land, set up rental houses which may support his family and educate his children in future.

loans.use: Purposely for buying retail items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, beans and so forth.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is a 65-year-old widow who has six adult children, five of whom already have their own families. Only Mila, her youngest daughter who has special needs, lives at home. Remedios lives in the village of Serena, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. The death of her husband left her bereft, especially as she has to take care of her youngest, who has disabilities. Her business activities actually help her to slowly forget her grief and move on. Having a child who totally depends on her gives her a reason and motivates her to continue with her business.

Remedios has a general store which she sustains through her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon. This has been her source of income for the past 15 years and it provides her with a net profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos a month, enough to cover her small household's expenses and allow her to save enough to buy appliances, renovate her house and also invest in a frozen-foods business. She is very thankful for the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon because her five children were able to finish their academic education and because it continues to help her be independent and support her special child.

She just paid off her 13th loan cycle of Php 19,500 without any delays in the weekly installment. For her 14th cycle, she is borrowing Php 19,500 to continue the sustainability of her general store. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Donah's Group

texts.en: Donah K. is 34 years old and the leader of her group in Bushenyi. She is a married woman with three children who are all enrolled in school. Donah has been in the business of selling milk for three years and would like to use the loan so she may offset the high electricity costs the operation of her business requires and to increase her turn-over cycles. She hopes that her business savvy and good customer service will allow her to attract more customers thereby increasing her profits. Her dream is that one day all of her children may have the opportunity to be educated at the university level.

loans.use: More Milk that she may Sell

loans.name: Alabi

texts.en: At the age of 35, Alibi is married and has 4 children. He lives in Ogbomoso, in Oyo State, Nigeria where he rents out musical instruments for parties and celebrations. He is requesting a loan of 50, 000 to purchase more instruments for renting. He says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more musical instruments to rent.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum U., 55 and his wife, Mrs. Saroem Eam, 40, live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have one son and one daughter. 

Chhum has had full-time employment in Phnom Penh for 20 years, while his wife has been selling porridge in front of garment factory for 5 years. He is requesting his first loan of US $700 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en: Wycliff is 35 years old and married with a two-year-old daughter store and sells vegetables, onions, cereals and potatoes to walk-ins and local residents  He owns the Benta Groceries dents. He has been in this business for the last six years.  His business challenges are strong competition from similar business and decreased demand from his customers due to their low incomes.  He is using the loan of 50,000 KES to buy cereals, onions, potatoes, fruits and vegetables.  He is looking forward to becoming the major distributor of foodstuff in his area.  Wycliff describes himself as ambitious, social and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cereals, onions, potatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa aminta M. F. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la compra de ropa nueva de cama. tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años, su producto lo vende en empresas del Gobierno. gracias a este negocio a sacado adelante a sus hijos brindandoles estudio, alimentacion y salud. Rosa es madre soltera. ahora necesita comprar carteras de marca, este producto es muy vendido y se tienen buenas ganancias. 
su meta es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que sean unos buenos profesionales.
esta actividad es su unica fuente de igresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta M. F. is 55. She buys new bedclothes. She has had the business for three years. She sells her product in government businesses. Thanks to this business she has gotten her children ahead with education, food, and health. Rosa is a single mother. She now needs a loan to buy brand name wallets. This product sells a lot, and you get good earnings. Her goal is for her children to be able to graduate from the university in order for them to become good professionals. This activity is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wallets and bedclothes

loans.name: Mariela De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Mariela de la Concepción O. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora ofreciendo diferentes productos como especies, bolsas plásticas y productos descartables como vasos, platos y cucharas.

Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que actualmente se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se desarrolloen y así lleguen a ser alguien en la vida.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos como lo son las especies y también las bolsas plásticas y los productos como vasos, cucharas y vasos para así continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Mariela de la Concepción O. stands out for being very hard-working. She sells different kinds of products like plastic bags, and disposable products like cups, plates, and spoons. She is married and has two children. They are now school age, and she needs to give them the necessary conditions so that they develop and become successful in life. The loan she is requesting is to buy products like plastic bags, cups, plates, and spoons in order to continue improving life conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different kinds of products like plastic bags and disposable products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Myriam Agossi

texts.fr: A. Myriam Agossi est née le 22 Septembre 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Myriam Agossi s’est installée à Dandji à Cotonou, il y a près de 8 ans. Mariée à ZANNOU Blaise, un brodeur, Myriam Agossi est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. C’est avec ses enfants et son mari que Myriam Agossi vit. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Myriam Agossi a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de ses enfants, Myriam Agossi a commencé la vente d’œufs frais, depuis deux ans. Myriam Agossi mène cette activité de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Cotonou. Myriam Agossi a obtenu déjà un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé et qui lui a permis d’agrandir un temps soit peu son activité. La clientèle de Myriam Agossi s’accroît au jour le jour ; mais Myriam Agossi n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose actuellement sont faibles. C’est la raison pour laquelle Myriam Agossi sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Myriam Agossi was born on September 22, 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She became situated in Dandji in Cotonou nearly eight years ago. Married to ZANNOU Blaise, an embroiderer, she is the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Myriam Agossi stopped going to class in secondary school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she started selling fresh eggs two years ago. She operates door-to-door and stocks up in Cotonou. She has already obtained one ALIDé loan, which she repaid and which enabled her to expand her business for a time, short though it was. Her customers are growing day by day; but she isn't managing to satisfy them because the financial means at her disposal are currently limited. For these reasons, Myriam Agossi is requesting a second loan for bolstering her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es:
La señora Eveling G. R., vive en el humilde Barrio La Primavera, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de que tiene bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas por el día y en la noche tiene una fritanga, vende cosmeticos por encargo, ella es una mujer activa que no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie y tiene el firme objetivo de formar a su hija y ofreserle los estudios necesarios para que tenga las herramientas para valerse por sus propios méritos. 

Dentro de las mayores aspiraciones que tiene la señora esta la edificación de su hogar y conseguir un buen punto de venta que le brinde una mejor estabilidad económica, ella solicita de un prestamo que le ayude a realizar compras para un mayor inventario de mercaderia que pueda ofertar entre sus clientes y ayudarle a la mejora continua a su económia doméstica.
texts.en:
Eveling G. R., 55, lives in the humble, La Primavera neighborhood. She is a single mother of a daughter, who is under her care. She sells fruit during the day and fried food at night. She also sells catalogue cosmetics. She is an active woman who doesn't have anyone to help her but has the firm goal in mind to raise her daughter and offer her the necessary education so that she will have the tools needed to succeed on her own merits. Among her greatest wishes is to build her house and get a good sales location so that she will have better economic stability. She is requesting financing to buy more stock inventory so that she will have a wider variety of products to offer her customers and, thereby, improved family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional tomatoes ans onions in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing fabric for traditional clothes

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu K. is a very social and happy woman. She is 36 years old, divorced and has three children, all girls. The eldest is in secondary school and the last two are in primary school. She has been a LAPO, SL client for quite some time now. 

She has a shop in Wilberfore, where she sells provisions. She has taken three previous loans with LAPO, SL, a Kiva partner. Abibatu used her previous loans' profit to build the shop where she sell her goods. 

With the help of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders, Abibatu wants to use her new loan to purchase more goods and use her profit to see to the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, cosmetics, drinks and rum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell smoked and fried fish

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She is a happy and hardworking woman who is very industrious. She is also happy because she is a grandmother.
Esther sells medicines to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves her business because of the profits that she makes from it. In the future, she hopes to own a big pharmacy store. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 60 años, está casado con Octavia de 40 años, ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive solo con dos de ellos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Chirio Palomar en Santa Ana. Todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana junto a su esposa, sale a cuidar sus cultivos de café y plátanos, pues saben que los esfuerzos que realizan serán recompensados cuando llega la época de cosecha, en donde cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta a él, es retirar la maleza de sus terrenos, para estén limpios y el abono sea aprovechado por los frutos, sin embargo le disgusta cuando sus plantaciones es invadido por la plaga, por lo que tiene que colocar trampas en cada plantación. Marcelino disfruta de los beneficios que le brinda la agricultura, lo hace muy feliz, por eso quiere adquirir más chacras agrícolas para incrementar su producción, pero ahora su prioridad es construir su vivienda para que su familia tenga comodidades. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que le encanta trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que aprende mucho con las charlas educativas que le brindan. 
Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará madera, calamina y clavos para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 60, is married to Octavia, 40; they have 8 children but only two still live with them in a rented house located in San Chirio Palomar, Santa Ana. He and his wife go out very early in the morning every day to care for their coffee and banana crops because they know that their hard work will be rewarded at harvest time when they can count on help from their children. What he likes most is to remove weeds from his fields so that they will be cleared and the fruits can benefit from the manure. However, he is displeased when his plants are invaded by pests so he has to set traps every planting season. Marcelino enjoys the benefits he gets from farming; it makes him very happy. Because of this, he wants to obtain more fields in order to increase production. His priority right now, though, is to build his home so that his family can have some comfort. This is his 3rd loan with MFP; he enjoys team work very much because he learns a lot from the training sessions they are given. He will use the requested 1000 ne soles to buy wood, calamine and nails to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, calamine and nails to build his house.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou Y. started her grocery business a long time ago. She is a 60 year old villager living in a rural area of Kompong Tom province. She is a widow with five children, four of whom are married and employed with different jobs while one remains a student. She currently sells cooking ingredients, sweets and other items, to villagers. Most of her clients buy on credit and return income after a few days later. This is the second cycle of the loan she has requested. Sou Y. will use this loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tièssiri sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames ayant en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de draps de lits, des vêtements, de la friperie, de la viande grillée (brochettes) et de la friture de farine de blé. 
Dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous  les huit prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
 Madame Oumou D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 balles (colis) de friperie  au marché Médine de Bamako avec les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail au comptant ou à crédit, à domicile, au marché Château de Ségou et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Oumou D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, épargner et assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
The members of the Tièssiri group are married women, the majority of whom live in monogamous families; they average 44 years of age and have an average of five children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the Château de Ségou market. The members of the group sell bed sheets, clothes, second-hand clothes, grilled meat (kebabs) and wheat-flour fritters. In order to sustain their income-generating activities, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on the ninth group loan. All the eight previous loans were repaid on time. Their sales are made on a retail basis for cash and on credit, at home, at the Château de Ségou market and on a door-to-door basis in the various districts of Ségou, to a mixed customer base. Mrs. Oumou D. is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA with this loan; the profit will be reinvested in her activity, put aside as savings and used to cover her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia con 2 de sus tres hijos, pues el mayor ya es independiente.Es  una mujer muy trabajadora, que desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como: hamburguesas y salchipapas (platillo compuesto de salchichas y papas fritas acompañadas de salsas). Desde las 5 de la tarde coloca  un letrero afuera  de su casa para ofrecer estos ricos paltillos, pues ella misma los prepara y los vende en platos descartables a sus habituales clientes, quienes la buscan por su buen sabor y los buenos precios. El negocio progresa  y  por eso se siente contenta de brindarle  a sus hijos (quienes también la ayudan en el negocio) una buena calidad de vida. En el  futuro espera continuar  mejorando su negocio,  pues le gusta mucho y le brinda la comodidad de realizarlo en su casa.Es su diecisieteavo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Cristina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios  ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus platillos, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old and lives in her own home with 2 of her 3 children, as the oldest is now on her own. She is a very hard-working woman that for the past several years has been selling fast food such as, hamburgers and salchipapas (a dish made with fried sausage and French fries served with salsa). At 5:00 in the afternoon she puts a sign outside her house advertising these delicious dishes. She prepares them and sells them herself on disposable plates to her regular customers who come to her because of her tasty food and good prices. Her business is growing and she is happy to be able to give her children (who also help her in the business) a better quality of life. In the future, she hopes to continue improving her business as she likes it a lot and it offers her the convenience of working from home. This is her seventeenth loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible with her payments. Cristina plans to buy the various ingredients that she needs for the preparation of her dishes with the money requested and in this manner, she hopes to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her fast food dishes

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 42-year-old married father of six children between the ages of 2 and 21, all attending school. A farmer for the last seven years in Kisii town, Western Kenya, he produces maize, bananas, sugarcane and milk which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from the carpentry services he offers in the community.

Josphat has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from this loan will help him educate his children and expand his workshop. His biggest challenges have been bovine diseases, lack of capital to expand his farming, exploitation by middlemen, and natural calamities that affect his production.

In future, Josphat would like to specialize in dairy farming by purchasing at least three more dairy cows that will produce enough milk for sale. He appeals for more help and is grateful to Juhudi for being there to assist farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline Q., 36 years old, is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Arline runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community.

Arline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arline joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia F., 53, wants to achieve more in life not just for herself but for her family. Rosalia lives in GMA, Cavite with her four children, one of whom is in high school, and the other three in elementary.

Rosalia has managed her own fruit and vending business for 15 years. She grows some of the vegetables in her garden in her backyard. Everyday she manages to sell vegetables and tropical fruits at her stall. Her main customers are people near their residence in GMA, Cavite. Rosalia gathers a net income of 2000 PHP monthly, which she uses to meet the needs of her entire family.

Rosalia is applying to CCT* for a 8000 PHP loan to enhance her business and increase her profits. She plans to purchase a variety of tropical fruits to add to her current inventory. The loan will serve as an additional capital that will enable Rosalia to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

She hopes to expand her business and also to start up a junk shop as another business. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and her family used for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional tropical fruits and vegetables for vending.

loans.name: Maricel
