texts.en: Maricel A. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 42 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica Marina

texts.es:
Angelica es una madre de familia de 65 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, sus hijos ya se encuentran independizados. La zona en donde vive es netamente agrícola y se geografía bastante accidentada por su cercanía con la sierra del país. Se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en la localidad donde reside. Sus principales clientes son las personas que por motivos de trabajo se quedan en la zona como por ejemplo profesores, profesionales de la salud y todo tipo de trabajadores. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la buana sazon con la que prepara sus comidas y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes.

Angélica utiliza las ganancias de este negocio para colaborar con la economía de su familia. Actualmente desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas insumos, de modo que pueda preparar mas platos y aumentar su nivel de ventas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que desea seguir trabajando para sentirse activa y útil. En la zona las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Angélica, 65, is a mother living with her husband in Oyotún district. Her children are all independent now. The area where she lives in totally agricultural and its terrain is pretty rugged due to its proximity to the country’s mountains. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over 10 years she has sold prepared food in a small restaurant located where she lives. Her main customers are people who due to work stay in the zone like teachers, health workers and all kinds of workers. The business is quite well received thanks to the tastiness of her dishes and the good service she gives customers. Angélica uses profits from the business to contribute to the family’s economy. She would like to buy more ingredients so that she can make more dishes and increase sales. To reach this goal she needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She is a woman who wants to continue to work to feel useful and active. People in the area who know her consider her to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes and to expand her sales.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo N. is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Agay-ayan, a part of Gingoog City in Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Rodrigo runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Rodrigo has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rodrigo is requesting a loan, his first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kofi Kuma

texts.fr: kofi  a ouvert en 2007 son propre restaurant qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. sa clientèle est grande et il est très connu dans sa zone d'activité. à ce jour il constate une baisse des produits nécessaires à l'activité de la restauration raison pour laquelle il s'est adressé à WAGES pour solliciter et obtenir un crédit pour acheter divers produits dont 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 4 cartons de lait concentré "NESTLE" et divers autres produits.
texts.en: Kofi opened his own restaurant in 2007 which enables him to support himself. He has a broad clientele and he is well known in his local area. To date, he has noticed a decrease in products he needs for his restaurant, which is why he has requested a loan from WAGES to buy various products including 3 boxes of pasta, 4 boxes of NESTLE condensed milk and various other products.

loans.use: achat de produits pour la restauration

loans.name: Madenis Judith

texts.es:
Madenis González a sus  25 años es una mujer casada que vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande; ella es muy organizada en su vida personal y en su negocio de miscelánea,  donde vende artículos de papelería, ropa, cosméticos, adornos femeninos, empaques de regalos mediante el sistema de contado y mercancía variada como calzado y ropa a crédito. Desde muy joven vio el emprendimiento como una oportunidad de generar ingresos personales, porque siempre ha sido muy independiente, por eso inició con una vitrina donde exhibía pocos artículos y gradualmente ha ido agregándole más infraestructura y otros productos  ya mencionados; su sistema de identificación de que productos vender,  funciona de la siguiente manera : Madenis tiene un cuaderno donde anota todo lo que le compran diariamente y también registra lo que ella no tiene,  pero que sus clientes requieren; así ha logrado que sus ventas se incrementen y aumentar el número de compradores de sus productos y obtener mejores utilidades.  Madenis  vende a crédito y tiene alrededor de 25 clientes muy bien seleccionados,  con los cuales logra rotar sus cuentas por cobrar cada 30 días, aunque también vende de contado; ella reporta una   utilidad   de un 35%  y un capital de trabajo es de $2.280.000, con una capacidad de pago de 94%. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio, organizar un gran local comercial, pero su gran desafío es tener una vivienda propia y por eso ella y su esposo están empeñados en organizarse diariamente,  para el logro de este propósito.
Madenis está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante financiamiento y su credikiva es el tercer crédito, con los otros dos ha logrado crecer,  adicionándole su disciplina de pago y su compromiso constante por invertir bien, lo mismo que mucha autonomía; con su credikiva comprará artículos de perfumería, calzado y ropa,  pues desde ya,  tiene encargos de sus clientes para responder a las fiestas de fin de año, porque planea aumentar su volumen de  ventas en un 25%.
texts.en: Madenis González is 25 years old, married and lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande. She is very organized in her personal and professional life, where she sells stationery supplies, clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, gift packs, as well as other items such as footwear and clothing on credit. Ever since she was young she saw entrepreneurship as a way to earn personal income because she has always been very independent, and for this reason she started with small store where she showed off a few items. Gradually the business kept adding more infrastructure and products like the ones mentioned above. Her system of identifying which products to sell is as follows: Madenis has a notebook where she notes everything her customers purchase every day and also records what she does not have but her customers request. In this way she has been able to increase her sales as well as the number of customers and obtain better profits. Madenis sells on credit and has about 25 hand-picked customers whose accounts rotate every 30 days, although she also takes cash. She reports a profit of 35 percent and capital of $2,280, with credit capacity at 94 percent. Her dream is to see her business grow and organize a big local business, but her biggest goal is to have her own home. It's for this reason she and her husband work hard every day to achieve this objective. Madenis belongs to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and this is her third loan through Kiva. With the others she has been able to grow her business and increase its cash flow, and she promises to continue her good investments. With this loan she plans to purchase perfume, footwear and clothing to fulfill customers' order for the upcoming holidays because she wants to increase her sales volume by 25 percent.

loans.use: Purchase perfume, footwear and clothing to fulfill customers' orders for the upcoming holidays.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther G.  is 32 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  Her husband is a builder.  Esther is currently in the business of selling different types of fish at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg T. is 64 years old and lives with husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Narantsetseg and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town. They sell a variety of meats to her customers at a stall in the local market. She started her business in 2000 and has since gained a lot of experience as a trader. They plan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat when prices for such products are cheap due to the spread of animal disease. 

Narantsetseg obtained a previous loan from the Xacbank in order to build a house and fence and still pays it. This loan will be her second loan, and she has proven herself to be a trustworthy customer. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman and says, "I am planning to buy a large amount of meats at a cheap price and sell them as a retailer which might be very profitable." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie M. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 36 years old. Tessie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snacks & beverages. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snacks & beverages

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 50 años, está casado con Marcelina, de 48 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arverja y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los que compró gracias a sus 20 años de dedicación. Lo que más le gusta a Esequiel es poder comercializar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pues ve sus esfuerzos concretados. Paralelo a está actividad, Esequiel, se dedica a la ganadería, donde cuida de sus animales entre vacas, toros, y corderos; además que de la leche que extrae puede hacer queso. El trabajo de campo es su vida, por ello está pensando en mejorar sus sembríos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y está seguro que obtendrá buenos resultados con el trabajo que realizan en su banco comunal, donde recibe charlas constantemente. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá invertir en la compra de 3 sacos de semilla de alverja, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en: Esequiel is 50 years and is married to Marcelina, who is 48 years old.  They have five children, but only live with four of them in a house that they own located in the San Juan area.  He works in farming and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and beans.  He grows them on his own farmlands which he bought thanks to his 20 years of dedication to the business.  What Esequiel likes most is being able to sell his crops in his city’s wholesale market, as he sees his efforts paying off.  Along with this job, Esequiel works in cattle farming where he cares for his animals, such as cows, bulls and lambs.  He can also make cheese with the milk that he obtains from them.  Working in the field is his life and for this reason, he is planning to improve his crops.  This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is sure that he will have good results because of the work done in his communal bank, where he constantly attends talks.  In obtaining the loan requested, he will be able to invest in the purchase of three sacks of pea seeds and if he has enough money left, he will buy several sacks of natural fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum O., age 34, is married with four children, all of whom are single. She is a local rice seller who buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill. She sells her finished rice to people to earn an income. Her husband also earns an income by growing rice. Sum O. generates around $2 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. 

The rice-harvesting season will soon arrive and Sum O. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price has increased.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for later resale while cost are low.

loans.name: Lucia Milerna

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lucia, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, uno es mayor de edad y  dos de 16 y 9  años los mismos que estudian en  colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas y pollos de granja pero además de esto el crédito también lo utiliza para los cultivos del cual se encarga su marido, ellos con la ayuda de toda la familia siembran maíz, maní, sandias y ahora están arreglando un terreno para sembrar melón, ella en la cría de sus animalitos trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que  tiene los animalitos por dos meses y luego los entrega a tiendas y a clientes que llegan hasta su casa, y en lo que se refiere a las tareas del campo su esposo y sus hijos trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 7h00 hasta las 13h00, cuando sus productos están de cosecha los comerciantes llegan hasta su sembrío.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, abonos  e insumos agrícolas ya que en esta temporada es cuando más siembran para aprovechar el invierno. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a ella y a sus compañeras. Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the community of 30 de Septiembre in the Rocafuerte city the members of the communal bank named Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro meets every two weeks. This region is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals and they are known throughout the country. 

Here we meet Lucia. She is 47 years old and she is married common-law, the relationship with whom she has three children: one is an adult and the others are 16 and 9 years of age. They are both going to school. Her husband is an agriculturist. 

She raises chickens and hens but aside from this business she will also use her loan to invest in the plantations that are managed by her husband. The entire family helps to cultivate corn, peanuts, watermelons and they are now working on a plot of land to harvest melons. She works at her livestock business every day. She keeps her little animals for two months and later she sells them to stores and clients who visit her house. As far as their agriculture business is concerned, her husband and children work from Monday to Friday from 7am to 1pm. When the produce is ready for harvest, merchants come to the plantations to buy. 

This loan will be used to purchase poultry, fertilizers and other agricultural materials. It is the time of year when the seeds are set down to take advantage of the winter. She has been a member of her communal bank for the past 8 loan cycles and she enjoys it for the support her peers are able to provide her. Her dream is to see her children grow up to have careers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry, fertilizers and other agricultural materials.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Daan Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,400. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a big shop in a good location

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn works hard to support her two children. Remelyn is a married woman and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Remelyn requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Remelyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Remelyn would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vusala

texts.ru:
Vusala jivet v Absheron regione , ona zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Vusala ochen lubit svoyu semyu i rabotu. Vusala M. 29 let. Ona uje 5 let kak kak imeyet sobstvenniy produktoviy magazin. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina chtobi pomestit bolshe raznix tovarov.
texts.en: Vusala lives in the Absheron region.  She is married and has one child.  Vusals loves her family and her work very much.  Vusala M. is 29 years old.  She has had her own grocery shop for five years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to expand the size of her shop so that she will have room for more products.

loans.use: to expand the size of her shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 27-year-old single mother with one child, rents a house in Kasese, Uganda where she has operated a retail shop for seven years. She began the business with capital of 200,000 shillings and a loan acqiured from Hofokam of 300,000 shillings, and she now has 2,000,000 shillings as her working capital.

Grace's main hardship is limited finances to meet the demands of her customers, and she intends to use the loan to buy rice and sugar to sell. Her vision is to become a wholesaler, educate her child, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, reside en San  Miguel, se dedica a la tapicería y bordados, vive con su hija de 6 años y su esposa, quienes dependen económicamente de él, trabaja desde muy temprano tiene dos empleados y la ventaja de Rafael es el lugar donde está ubicado el taller ya que no tiene otro negocio igual cerca.
Él necesita comprar materiales, por lo que solicita un préstamo y tener forros, hilos, plásticos, pega, entre otros materiales que le permitan fortalecer más el inventario de su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Sueña con ser un administrador de varios negocios, potencializarse como microempresario.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in San Miguel and he has an upholstering and embroidery business. He lives with his 6-year old daughter and his wife, both of whom are financially dependent on him. He starts work very early in the morning and he has two employees. Rafael's business has the advantage that where he has his shop there are no other similar businesses around.

He needs to purchase materials, which is why he requests a loan. He needs fabrics, threads, plastics, glue, and other materials to strengthen his business' inventory and to provide his clients with a better level of service.

He dreams of being the owner of various businesses and to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, therads, plastics, and glue for upholstering.

loans.name: Helbert

texts.en:
Helbert is from the city of Guingona Ozamiz City. He is 16 years old and single. To make a living, he offers a tricycle transportation service. Helbert has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Helbert joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Helbert from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service
